glanus: <entryFree id="n19628" type="main" key="glanus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glanus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. glanis.</entryFree>
glarea: <entryFree id="n19629" type="main" key="gla_re^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glārĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n19629.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gravel</hi> (cf. arena, sabulum, suburra, rudus): <cit><quote lang="la">eo loco pulvis, non glarea injecta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:2:2:section=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 2, 2, § 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:9:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 9, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vias glareà substruendas locaverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:27:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 27, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:22:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 22, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:7:59" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 7, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 212</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 30, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
glareosus: <entryFree id="n19630" type="main" key="gla_re^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glārĕōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>glarea</etym>, <sense id="n19630.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of gravel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gravelly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:9:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sabulosaque arva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:10:23" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 10, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 21:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Arb. 21, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rivi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 8, 56, § 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumen saxa glareosa volvens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:31:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 31, 11</bibl></cit> dub. (al. globosa).</sense></entryFree>
glastum: <entryFree id="n19631" type="main" key="glastum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glastum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n19631.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the herb woad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">used in dyeing blue</hi>, usually called Isatis tinctoria, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 1, 2, § 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
glauce: <entryFree id="n19632" type="main" key="Glauce"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Glauce</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*glau/kh</foreign>. <sense id="n19632.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The mother of the third Diana</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:23:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 23, 58</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n19632.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Another name of Creüsa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wife of Jason</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:F. 25" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> F. 25</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19632.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An Amazon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:F. 163" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> F. 163</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
glauceum: <entryFree id="n19633" type="greek" key="glauce_um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glaucēum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">glau/keion</foreign>, <sense id="n19633.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bluish-colored plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">celandine</hi>, usually called glaucion, Col. poët. 10, 104.</sense></entryFree>
glauceus: <entryFree id="n19634" type="main" key="glauce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glaucĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>glaucion</etym>, <sense id="n19634.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of celandine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sucus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 22" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
glaucia: <entryFree id="n19635" type="main" key="Glauci^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Glaucĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. glaucus</etym>, <sense id="n19635.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname in the</hi> gens Servilia and Mallia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 61</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 7, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">34, 96</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
glaucicomans: <entryFree id="n19636" type="hapax" key="glauci^co^mans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glaucĭcŏmans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. glaucus-, 2. como</etym>, <sense id="n19636.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with bluish - gray foliage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bluish-gray</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oliva,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> 3, 622</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
glaucina: <entryFree id="n19637" type="greek" key="glauci^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glaucĭna</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">glau/kina</foreign>, <sense id="n19637.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ointment of celandine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glaucium ointment</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:26:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 26, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:21" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 2, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
glaucion: <entryFree id="n19638" type="greek" key="glauci^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glaucĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">glau/kion</foreign>, <sense id="n19638.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the</hi> (bluish) <hi rend="ital">plant celandine</hi>: Chelidonium glaucium, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 10, 59, § 83</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:27:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 27, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
glauciscus: <entryFree id="n19639" type="greek" key="glauciscus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glauciscus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">glauki/skos</foreign>, <sense id="n19639.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bluish-colored fish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">otherwise unknown</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 10, 46, § 129</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:148" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 11, 53, § 148</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
glaucito: <entryFree id="n19640" type="hapax" key="glauci^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glaucĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, the natural note of puppies, <sense id="n19640.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to yelp</hi>: glaucitat et catulus, Auct. Carm. Philom. 60.</sense></entryFree>
glaucoma: <entryFree id="n19641" type="greek" key="glauco_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glaucōma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">glaucū-ma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:1:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 1, 70</bibl> Ritschl, <sense id="n19641.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>), = <foreign lang="greek">glau/kwma</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">an obscuration of the crystalline lens</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a cataract</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:117 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 6, 38, § 117 al.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Ham. 90</bibl>.—Comically: alicui glaucumam ob oculos obicere, qs. <hi rend="ital">to throw dust in his eyes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:1:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 1, 70</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
glaucopis: <entryFree id="n19642" type="greek" key="glauco_pis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glaucōpis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">glaukw=pis</foreign> (gray-eyed, an epithet of Minerva), <sense id="n19642.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the owl</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si meus aurita gaudet glaucopide Flaccus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:87" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 87</bibl></cit> dub. (ex conject. Scalig., al. lagopode; v. lagopus).</sense></entryFree>
glaucus: <entryFree id="n19642.1" type="greek" key="glaucus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glaucus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">glauko/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">bright</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sparkling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gleaming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grayish</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">caeruleus, caesius): undae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:719" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 719</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of water: amictus (Nymphae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:885" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 885</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">amictus (dei Tiberini),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sorores,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Nereides</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:351" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 351</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ulva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:416" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 416</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 182</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">frons (salictorum),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 21, 30, § 75</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:141" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 37, 53, § 141</bibl> sq.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">glauca uxor, i. e. with gleaming eyes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 12, 1</bibl></cit>.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n19642.2" type="greek" key="glaucus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glaucus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">glau=kos</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a bluish-colored fish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">otherwise unknown</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:58 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 16, 25, § 58 al.</bibl></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n19643" type="main" key="Glaucus3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Glaucus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*glau=kos</foreign>, <sense id="n19643.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Greek proper name.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19643.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A son of Sisyphus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">devoured by his own horses</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:267" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 267</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n19643.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The commander of the Lycians in the Trojan war</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a friend of Diomede</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 7, 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19643.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A fisherman of Anthedon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Eubœa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who was changed into a sea-god</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:906 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 906 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">38</bibl>; 68; <cit><quote lang="la">7, 233: Glauci chorus,</quote> <trans><tr>the Nereids</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:823" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 823</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:335" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 335</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
glaux: <entryFree id="n19644" type="greek" key="glaux"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glaux</orth>, <itype>cis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">glau/c</foreign>, <sense id="n19644.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> eugalacton, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 9, 58, § 82</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gleba: <entryFree id="n19645" type="main" key="gle_ba"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glēba</orth>, and its derivv., v. glaeba, etc.</entryFree>
glechon: <entryFree id="n19646" type="greek" key="gle_chon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glēchon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">glh/xwn</foreign>, <sense id="n19646.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pennyroyal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulegium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 92</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
glechonites: <entryFree id="n19647" type="greek" key="gle_cho_ni_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glēchōnītes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">glhxwni/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n19647.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wine flavored with pennyroyal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pennyroyal wine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:35" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
glesaria: <entryFree id="n19648" type="main" key="Gle_sa_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Glēsārĭa</orth>, v. Glaesaria.</entryFree>
glesum: <entryFree id="n19649" type="main" key="gle_sum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glēsum</orth>, v. glaesum.</entryFree>
gleucinus: <entryFree id="n19650" type="greek" key="gleuci^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gleucĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">gleu/kinos</foreign>, <pb n="817" /> <cb n="GLOB" /> <sense id="n19650.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of must</hi>, <hi rend="ital">made from must</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:53" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 7, 7, § 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
glinon: <entryFree id="n19651" type="greek" key="gli_non"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glīnon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">gli=nos</foreign>, <sense id="n19651.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of maple-tree</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 15, 26, § 67</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
glirarium: <entryFree id="n19652" type="main" key="gli_ra_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glīrārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>glis</etym>, <sense id="n19652.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place for keeping dormice</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:15:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 15, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
glis: <entryFree id="n19653" type="main" key="glis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glis</orth>, <itype>glīris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>perh. kindred with <foreign lang="greek">gale/h</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n19653.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dormouse</hi>: Sciurus glis, Linn.; Glis esculentus, Blumenb.; <cit><quote lang="la">a delicacy with the Romans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:15" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:223 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 57, 82, § 223 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:59" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:8:9" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 8, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 31</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 28, 4</bibl>: in silva mea est glis nullus, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 69</bibl> and 106 P.: glirium examina, Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 119, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gliscerae: <entryFree id="n19654" type="gloss" key="glisce^rae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gliscĕrae</orth> <itype>mensae gliscentes, id est crescentes, per instructionem epularum scilicet</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=98" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 98</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
glisco: <entryFree id="n19655" type="main" key="glisco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glisco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>perh. kindred with cresco, Paul. ex Fest. s. h. v. p. 98 Müll.; cf. Doed. Syn. 1, p. 21</etym>, <sense id="n19655.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to grow up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swell up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spread</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blaze up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burst out</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; cf. crebresco). </sense><sense id="n19655.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis Alexandri Phrygio sub pectore gliscens,</quote> <trans><tr>kindling</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:474" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 474</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of fire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:308" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 308</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 12, 9</bibl>: gliscit, ut ignis oleo, Cic. Hortens. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 22, 21</bibl> (<bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> 10, p. 63</bibl> Kays.): <cit><quote lang="la">suffusa veneno Tenditur, ac sanie gliscit cutis,</quote> <trans><tr>swells</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:107" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">asellus paleis gliscit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>grows stout</tr>, <tr>fat</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:1:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turtur difficulter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:9:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 9, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. Fest. s. v. reglescit, p. 278 Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:5:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 5, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">immensum aucto mari et vento gliscente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 3, 31</bibl></cit> Dietsch.—</sense><sense id="n19655.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to swell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">increase</hi>, <hi rend="ital">augment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spread</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectat atrox hostile caput, gliscitque tepentis Lumina torva videns,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:756" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 756</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hos ubi velle acies et dulci gliscere ferro Dux videt,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>ardently long for</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 639</bibl></cit>: cf. with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (like gestio): <cit><quote lang="la">gliscis regnare superbus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 73</bibl></cit>: ad juvenilem libidinem copia voluptatum gliscit, ut ignis oleo, * Cic. Hortens. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 22, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gaudium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0116,001:ib. 18" default="NO"><author>Pac.</author> ib. 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1061" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1061</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">furor in dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1069" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 1069</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamor, singultus, jurgia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:480" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 480</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rabies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 5, 2, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seditio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 23, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne glisceret primo neclegendo bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saevitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flagitia et infamia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gloria et pericula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multitudo gliscit immensum,</quote> <trans><tr>grows</tr>, <tr>increases</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 27</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">gliscerent numero et aliquando minuerentur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 5</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam eo magnificentiae venerit (res publica), gliscere singulos,</quote> <trans><tr>grow in wealth</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gliscentibus negotiis duo praetores additi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fama gliscit gressu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:6" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 6</bibl></cit>.!*? In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: ut major invidia Lepido glisceretur, <hi rend="ital">may grow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">increase</hi>, Sempron. Asellio ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 481, 5</bibl>: cum te salvum video, gliscor gaudio, Turp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 22, 13</bibl> (Com. Fragm. v. 191 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
glisomarga: <entryFree id="n19656" type="main" key="gli_somarga"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glīsomarga</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">glisso-</orth>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">glysso-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n19656.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of marl</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 8, 4, § 46</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
globatim: <entryFree id="n19657" type="main" key="glo^ba_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glŏbātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>globus</etym>, <sense id="n19657.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in clusters</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bands</hi>, <hi rend="ital">troops</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">per vicina digressi praedones,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 27, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
globo: <entryFree id="n19658" type="main" key="glo^bo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glŏbo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n19658.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make into a ball</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make round</hi> or <hi rend="ital">spherical</hi> (postAug. and perh. only <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">mid.</hi>). </sense><sense id="n19658.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">dependentes ubique guttae parvis globantur orbibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 65, 65, § 163</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:130" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 13, 34, § 130</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">formam mundi in speciem orbis absoluti globatam esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 2, 2, § 5</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n19658.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to form into a body</hi> or <hi rend="ital">crowd</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to crowd together</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ante exortum solis nubes globabuntur, hiemem asperam denuntiabunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:344" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 35, 78, § 344</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:53" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 17, 17, § 53</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">coturnices globatae vehementius properant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 11 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
globositas: <entryFree id="n19659" type="main" key="glo^bo_si^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glŏbōsĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>globosus</etym>, <sense id="n19659.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rotundity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sphericalness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">globosity</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">terrae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, § 16, 23, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
globosus: <entryFree id="n19660" type="main" key="glo^bo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glŏbōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>globus</etym>, <sense id="n19660.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">round as a ball</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spherical</hi>, <hi rend="ital">globose</hi> (class.): (mundum) globosum est fabricatus, quod <foreign lang="greek">sfairoeide\s</foreign> Graeci vocant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 6</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">stellae globosae et rotundae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mundus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:45:116" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 45, 116</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">forma (mundi),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 19, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 39, 98</bibl></cit>: saxum, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 23, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:29:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 29, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
globulus: <entryFree id="n19661" type="main" key="glo^bu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glŏbŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n19661.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little ball</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a globule</hi> (post-Aug. and very rare). </sense><sense id="n19661.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: (chrysocollae) globulis sudore resolutis,<cb n="GLOM" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 5, 27, § 89</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19661.2" n="2" level="3"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n19661.3" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">a lump</hi> of food, <hi rend="ital">dumpling</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=107" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 107</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n19661.4" n="(b)" level="5"> Med. t. t., <hi rend="ital">a pill</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:13 al" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> 13 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n19661.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of speech, <hi rend="ital">a rounding</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">melliti verborum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
globus: <entryFree id="n19662" type="main" key="glo^bus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glŏbus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>kindr. with glomus</etym>, <sense id="n19662.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a round body</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a ball</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sphere</hi>, <hi rend="ital">globe.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19662.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n19662.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: cum duae formae praestantes sint, ex solidis globus (sic enim <foreign lang="greek">sfai=ran</foreign> interpretari placet), ex planis autem circulus aut orbis, qui <foreign lang="greek">ku/klos</foreign> Graece dicitur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:18:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 18, 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille globus, quae terra dicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:28:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 28, 68</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">stellarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">solis et lunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:472" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 472</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">lunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum caelum discessisse visum est atque in eo animadversi globi,</quote> <trans><tr>fire-balls</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:43:97" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 43, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in fundas visci indebant grandiculos globos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 2, 35</bibl></cit>: cordis, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for cor, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 119</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">farinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=107" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 107</bibl></cit> Müll.; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">in the foll.</ref></xr>—</sense><sense id="n19662.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n19662.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A dumpling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a globo farinae dilatato item in oleo cocti dicti globi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=107" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 107</bibl></cit> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 79</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19662.5" n="2" level="3"> In milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">a close order of battle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a knot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">troop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">band</hi>, <hi rend="ital">company</hi>, Cato ap. Fest. s. v. serra, p. 344 b. Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum globo juvenum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 6, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:12:9" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 12, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">emissi militum globi turbam disjecere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 50</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 43</bibl>; 15, 60; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:53" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 53</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19662.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a globular mass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a ball</hi>, <hi rend="ital">globe</hi> of things collected together (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; not in Cicero nor Cæsar): flammarumque globos liquefactaque volvere saxa, <hi rend="ital">globes</hi> or <hi rend="ital">masses of flame</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:473" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 473</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:238" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 238</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 74</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">telorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:381" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 381</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">A throng</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crowd</hi>, <hi rend="ital">body</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">mass</hi> of people: <cit><quote lang="la">extrema contio et circa Fabium globus increpabant inclementem dictatorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:32:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 32, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circa eum aliquot hominum, ne forte violaretur, constitisset globus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:29:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 29, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum repelleretur adsertor virginis a globo mulierum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:47:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 47, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aditum senatus globus togatorum obsederat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magno semper electorum juvenum globo circumdari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 13</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and with a contemptuous secondary notion: si quem ex illo globo nobilitatis ad hoc negotium mittatis,</quote> <trans><tr>from that noble clique</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85, 10</bibl></cit> Kritz.: <cit><quote lang="la">conjurationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:58:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 58, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">consensionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jehu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,014:9:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 4 Reg. 9, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
glocidare: <entryFree id="n19663" type="gloss" key="glo_cida_re"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glōcidāre</orth> et ‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">gluttīre</orth> <itype>gallinarum proprium est, cum ovis incubiturae sunt</itype>, Paul. ex Fest p. 99 Müll. <sense id="n19663.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> cf. the foll. art.</sense></entryFree>
glocio: <entryFree id="n19664" type="hapax" key="glo_ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glōcĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n19664.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cluck as a hen</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:5:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 5, 4</bibl>; cf. the preced. art.</sense></entryFree>
gloctoro: <entryFree id="n19665" type="hapax" key="glocto^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gloctŏro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n19665.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cry as a stork</hi>, Auct. Carm. Philom. 29.</sense></entryFree>
glomerabilis: <entryFree id="n19666" type="main" key="glo^me^ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glŏmĕrābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>glomero</etym>, <sense id="n19666.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rounded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">round</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">sidus Pleiadum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 4, 520</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orbis lunae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 221</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
glomeramen: <entryFree id="n19667" type="main" key="glo^me^ra_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glŏmĕrāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n19667.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rounding;</hi> concr., <hi rend="ital">a round body</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ball</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and perh. ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">dissimiles formae glomeramen in unum conveniunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:686" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 686</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:726" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 726</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec retinentur enim inter se glomeramina quaeque,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the round atoms</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:454" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 454</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dilue praeterea glomeramina,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>pills</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 55, 999</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
glomerarius: <entryFree id="n19668" type="main" key="glo^me^ra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glŏmĕrārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n19668.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one eager to collect men for war</hi> (glomerare manum bello, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:315" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 315</bibl>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 1:8:13" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 1, 8, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
glomerate: <entryFree id="n19669" type="main" key="glo^me^ra_te"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glŏmĕrāte</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. glomero <sense id="n19669.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
glomeratim: <entryFree id="n19670" type="main" key="glo^me^ra_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glŏmĕrātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>glomero</etym>, <sense id="n19670.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in heaps</hi> or <hi rend="ital">crowds</hi>, = turmatim (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">glomeratim ingredi in sedilia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 4, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
glomeratio: <entryFree id="n19671" type="hapax" key="glo^me^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glŏmĕrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id. I.</etym>, of horses, <sense id="n19671.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bringing of the legs together into a ball</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a trotting</hi> (or, as others say, <hi rend="ital">a prancing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">an ambling</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">Asturcones, quibus non vulgaris in cursu gradus, sed mollis alterno crurum explicatu glomeratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 42, 67, § 166</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 117</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
glomero: <entryFree id="n19672" type="main" key="glo^me^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glŏmĕro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>glomus</etym>, <sense id="n19672.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to wind</hi> or <hi rend="ital">form into a ball</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gather into a round heap</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to conglobate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glomerate</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n19672.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">lanam in orbes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic terram deus, ne non aequalis ab omni Parte foret, magni speciem glomeravit in orbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 35</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">9, 222: Eae (offae) maxime glomerantur ex ficis et farre mixto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi venae inter se implicatae glomerantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 22</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">glomerata viscera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8</bibl></cit>, <cb n="GLOR" /> 401: <cit><quote lang="la">atra favilla volat glomerataque corpus in unum Densatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:604" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 604</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frusta mero glomerata vomentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:212" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 212</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:577" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 577</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum grandinem venti glomeratam in terras agunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:31:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 31, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">glomeratae turbine nives,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:523" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 523</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">glomeratus pulvis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:296" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 296</bibl></cit>: (Lapithae) equitem docuere sub armis Insultare solo et gressus glomerare superbos, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to make a horse bring his feet together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make him prance</hi> (<hi rend="ital">trot</hi> or <hi rend="ital">amble</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 117</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 9, 8</bibl> sqq., and v. glomeratio.—</sense><sense id="n19672.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to gather into a round heap</hi> or <hi rend="ital">knot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to collect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">press</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crowd</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assemble together</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">agmina cervi Pulverulenta fuga glomerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 155</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">glomerare manum bello,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 315</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum se glomerant retroque residunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 539</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones in testudinem glomerabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collecti Troes glomerantur eodem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:689" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 689</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 440</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">apes mixtae glomerantur in orbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 79</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 18, 20, § 64</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad terram gurgite ab alto Quam multae glomerantur aves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:311" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 311</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 22, 38, § 75</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">foedam tempestatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:323" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 323</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fumiferam noctem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:254" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 8, 254</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semina vocis glomerata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:497" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 497</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:541" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 541</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19672.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: omnia fixa tuus glomerans determinat annus, qs. <hi rend="ital">revolving</hi>, Cic. poët. Div. 1, 12, 19: haec vetusta, saeclis glomerata horridis, Luctifica clades nostro infixa est corpori, <hi rend="ital">accumulated</hi>, id. poët. Tusc. 2, 10, 25: <cit><quote lang="la">glomerare simul fas et nefas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 3, 134</bibl></cit>.— Hence, * <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">glŏmĕrāte</orth>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis oratorum densata glomeratius aut dixit aut cogitavit?</quote> <trans><tr>more succinctly</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Grat. Act. 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
glomerosus: <entryFree id="n19673" type="main" key="glo^me^ro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glŏmĕrōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>glomus</etym>, <sense id="n19673.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">like a ball</hi>, <hi rend="ital">round</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glomerous</hi> (post-Aug. and very rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:3:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 3, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
glomus: <entryFree id="n19674" type="main" key="glo^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glŏmus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">glōm-</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:360" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 360</bibl>; v. Lachm.), <itype>ĕris</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>for glob-mus, kindr. with globus</etym>, <sense id="n19674.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a ball</hi> or <hi rend="ital">clue</hi> of yarn, thread, etc. (very rare). </sense><sense id="n19674.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">lanae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:360" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 360</bibl></cit> (v. Lachm. ad h. l.); <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 13, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 13, 19, § 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">staminis albi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 142" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 142</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19674.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic.: glomus in sacris crustulum cymbi figura ex oleo coctum appellatur, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=98" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 98</bibl> Müll. (in Cato and Varro globus).</sense></entryFree>
gloria: <entryFree id="n19675" type="main" key="glo_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glōrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. cru, to hear; crav-as, fame; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">klu/w, kle/os</foreign>; Lat. cluo, clueo, inclutus, from the root clŭo; lit., rumor, fame; hence also, like <foreign lang="greek">kle/os</foreign>, pregn.</etym>, <sense id="n19675.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">glory</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">renown</hi>, <hi rend="ital">praise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">honor</hi> (syn.: laus, laudatio, gloriatio, elogium, etc.). </sense><sense id="n19675.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n19675.2" n="(a)" level="5"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">te inmortali adficere gloria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 5, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: viri (Q. Fabii) gloria claret, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 1</bibl> (Ann. v. 315 Vahl.): ut summae gloriae sint a virtute proficiscentia, dedecoris vero praecipui existimentur, quae voluptas suadeat non sine labe vitiorum, Cato ap. Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:66, p. 310" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 66, p. 310</bibl> Orell.: hicine est ille Telamon, modo quem gloria ad caelum extulit? Poët. (perh. Enn.) ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:18:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 18, 39</bibl> (Trag. Rel. Inc. v. 93 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">virtutem tamquam umbra sequitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:45:109" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 45, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non tulit ullos haec civitas aut gloria clariores aut auctoritate graviores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:37:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 37, 154</bibl></cit>: est enim gloria solida quaedam res et expressa, non adumbrata: ea est consentiens laus bonorum, incorrupta vox bene judicantium de excellente virtute; <cit><quote lang="la">ea virtuti resonat tamquam imago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:2:3 sq" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 2, 3 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trahimur omnes studio laudis et optimus quisque maxime gloriā ducitur. Ipsi illi philosophi etiam in illis libellis, quos de contemnenda gloria scribunt, nomen suum inscribunt, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 11, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immortalis gloria (opp. sempiterna turpitudo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:26:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 26, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bello quaeritur gloria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:12:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 12, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maximam gloriam capere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:7:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 7, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse in gloria sempiterna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sit in aeterna gloria Marius, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:10:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 10, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse in maxima gloria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:21:85" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 21, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excellens in re militari gloria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod auctor ei summa augur gloria Attus Navius non erat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honorum gradus summis hominibus et infimis sunt pares, gloriae dispares, etc. ... ut is maxime gloria excellat, qui virtute plurimum praestet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:24:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 24, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unus bis remp. servavi, semel gloriā, iterum aerumna meā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:22:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 22, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">an Pollio et Messala ... parum ad posteros gloriae tradiderunt?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 11, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gloriam qui spreverit veram habebit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:39:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 39, 19</bibl></cit>: spreta in tempore gloria<pb n="818" /> <cb n="GLOR" />  interdum cumulatior redit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:47:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 47, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">militavi non sine gloria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 26, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenui Saleio Gloria quantalibet quid erit, si gloria tantum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:81" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 81</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">candidus, armenti gloria, taurus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>ornament</tr>, <tr>pride</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:290" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 290</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:208" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 208</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">reputation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fame</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 6, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 41:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 41, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">veteres Gallorum gloriae,</quote> <trans><tr>glorious deeds</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita sunt gloriae meretricum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:4:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 4, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:27:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 27, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19675.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">simul rem et belli gloriam armis repperi, Tcr. Heaut. 1, 1, 60: nemo, qui fortitudinis gloriam consecutus est insidiis et malitiā, laudem est adeptus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:19:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 19, 62</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pro gloria belli atque fortitudinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gloria rei militaris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 29, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legum et publicae disciplinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:46:110" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 46, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum gestarum gloria florere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eximia virtutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et gravitatis et ingenii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 23, 72</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:32:116" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 32, 116</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 12, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:68:239" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 68, 239</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">carminum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et titulis et fascibus olim major habebatur donandi gloria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:111" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velocis gloria plantae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:98" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 13, 98</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19675.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, subjectively, <hi rend="ital">thirst</hi> or <hi rend="ital">passion for glory</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ambition; vainglory</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pride</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vaunting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">boasting</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n19675.5" n="(a)" level="5"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">pueri gloriā ducti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:20:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 20, 46</bibl></cit> Tischer: <cit><quote lang="la">moriar, ni, quae tua gloria est, puto te malle a Caesare consuli quam inaurari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 13, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">studio et gloriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:27:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 27, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostentatio et gloria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:14:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 14, 38</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">jactantiā gloriāque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem tulit ad scenam ventoso gloria curru,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 177</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 6, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 179</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caecus Amor sui Et tollens vacuum plus nimio Gloria verticem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:18:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 18, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patriam obruit olim gloria paucorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:142" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vana gloria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:39:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 39, 18</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">perjuriorem hoc hominem si quis viderit Aut gloriarum pleniorem, quam illic est,</quote> <trans><tr>vain boastings</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:2:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 2, 6</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n19675.6" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">generandi mellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 205</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lautae mensae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:376" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 376</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gloriabundus: <entryFree id="n19676" type="main" key="glo_ri^a_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glōrĭābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>glorior</etym>, <sense id="n19676.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">glorying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exulting</hi> (post-class. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">aliqua re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:5:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 5, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 13, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gloriatio: <entryFree id="n19677" type="main" key="glo_ri^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glōrĭātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n19677.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a glorying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">boasting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vaunting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exulting</hi> (a word formed by Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">ex quo efficitur, gloriatione, ut ita dicam, dignam esse beatam vitam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:8:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 8, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 18, 50</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi est ergo gloriatio tua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Rom. 3, 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gloriator: <entryFree id="n19678" type="main" key="glo_ri^a_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glōrĭātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n19678.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a boaster</hi>, <hi rend="ital">braggart</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 357</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
glorificatio: <entryFree id="n19679" type="main" key="glo_ri^fi^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glōrĭfĭcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>glorifico</etym>, <sense id="n19679.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">glorification</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Tract. 105:3" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Tract. 105, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
glorifico: <entryFree id="n19680" type="main" key="glo_ri^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glōrĭfĭco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>glorificus</etym>, <sense id="n19680.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to glorify</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">deum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Idol. 22</bibl></cit>; Prud. Hamart. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 15, 2</bibl> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:14:4 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 14, 4 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
glorificus: <entryFree id="n19681" type="main" key="glo_ri^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glōrĭfĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>gloria-facio</etym>, <sense id="n19681.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of glory</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glorious</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 2, 8, 7, § 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gloriola: <entryFree id="n19682" type="main" key="glo_ri^o^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glōrĭŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>gloria</etym>, <sense id="n19682.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small glory</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a little glory</hi> (a word formed by Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">nosmet ipsi vivi gloriola nostra perfruamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 5, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
glorior: <entryFree id="n19683" type="main" key="glo_ri^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glōrĭor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n19683.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to glory</hi>, <hi rend="ital">boast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vaunt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to brag</hi> of any thing, <hi rend="ital">pride one's self</hi> on any thing (class.); constr. with <case>acc.</case>, or an <hi rend="ital">object</hi>- or <hi rend="ital">relativeclause</hi>, with <case>abl.</case>, <hi rend="ital">de</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in</hi> aliqua re, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19683.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> of <hi rend="ital">pron.</hi> (<hi rend="ital">cognate acc.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">vellem equidem idem posse gloriari quod Cyrus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 10, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut de me ipso aliquid more senum glorier,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 23, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eum haec gloriantem impetum facit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:12:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 12, 9</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">direct object</hi> (post-class. and rare; cf. Weissenb. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:17:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 17, 10</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Krebs, Antibarb. p. 502): rem ineptam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Procul. 12, 8</bibl></cit>: victorem Pacorum. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:4:11" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 42, 4, 11</bibl>.— Hence also in the <hi rend="ital">gerundive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">beata vita glorianda et praedicanda et prae se ferenda est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:17:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 17, 50</bibl></cit>; cf.: est in aliqua vita praedicabile aliquid et gloriandum ac prae se ferendum, ib. § 49.—</sense><sense id="n19683.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With an <hi rend="ital">object</hi>- or <hi rend="ital">relative-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gloriare evenisse ex sententia?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 5, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">is mihi etiam gloriabitur, se omnes magistratus sine repulsa assecutum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes provincias se peragrasse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:64:258" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 64, 258</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eo multum gloriari, se, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seque alterum fore Sullam, inter suos gloriatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: se tenebras offudisse judicibus gloriatus est, Quint. <cb n="GLOR" /> 2, 17, 21; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:11:23" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 11, 23</bibl>.—With a <hi rend="ital">rel.clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gloriatus est expergefactae somno Caesoniae, quantum egisset, dum ca meridiaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:38" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 38</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19683.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">nominibus veterum gloriantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:50:169" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 50, 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus rebus gloriemini in vobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lig. 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod sua victoria tam insolenter gloriarentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 14, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic etiam gloriatus sit occiso malo cive,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:93" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 93</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:22" default="NO">11, 2, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nulla re magis gloriarentur quam decepto per indutias rege,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:47:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 47, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19683.4" n="(d)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case> and <hi rend="ital">clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">secundis rebus nostris, duos consules ab nobis sub jugum missos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:42:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 42, 7</bibl></cit>.— With two <hi rend="ital">ablat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">socero illo,</quote> <trans><tr>in him as father-in-law</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 176</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de tuis divitiis intolerantissime gloriaris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Vat. 12, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de misera vita gloriari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:8:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 8, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de M. Catone, de Ti. Corunciano, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 8, 20</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non pudet philosophum in eo gloriari, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:21:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 21, 48</bibl></cit>: nobis quoque licet in hoc quodammodo gloriari (shortly before with an <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:17:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 17, 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in virtute recte gloriamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:36:87" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 36, 87</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">h</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">adversus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed ne adversus te quidem ego gloriabor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:39:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 39, 16</bibl></cit>.— (<foreign lang="greek">q</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">licet mihi, Marce fili, apud te gloriari, ad quem et hereditas hujus gloriae pertinet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:22:78" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 22, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu ipse mihi gloriari videbare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:16:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 16, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut jure quisquam glorietur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 18, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicitur eo tempore glorians apud suos Pompeius dixisse, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:45:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 45, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">defendendi haec causa, non gloriandi loquor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:19:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 19, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ait ipse de se, nec mentitur in gloriando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:18:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 18, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Domitia) haud negatura immo etiam gloriatura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 10</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.—P. a.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">glōriātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">boastful; comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gloriatior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Rer. Gest. Alex. 2:16" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Rer. Gest. Alex. 2, 16</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">glōrian-ter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">exultingly</hi> (late Lat.): duci ad carcerem, Ps.-<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:ad Fratr. Erem. 4" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> ad Fratr. Erem. 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gloriose: <entryFree id="n19684" type="main" key="glo_ri^o_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glōrĭōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. gloriosus <sense id="n19684.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
gloriosus: <entryFree id="n19685" type="main" key="glo_ri^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glōrĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>gloria</etym>. <sense id="n19685.0" n="I" level="1"> (Acc. to gloria, I.) <hi rend="ital">Full of glory</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glorious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">famous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">renowned</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">illustris, praeclarus, magnificus): de clarorum hominum factis illustribus et gloriosis satis hoc loco dictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:11:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 11, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae si in privatis gloriosa sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:14:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 14, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnificum illud Romanisque hominibus gloriosum, ut Graecis de philosophia libris non egeant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in illa fuga, nobis gloriosa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 28, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mors,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 24, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 12, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:49:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 49, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">princeps,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gloriosissimae victoriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 52</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dies gloriosissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ipsi Agamemnoni fuit honestum, habere, etc. ... mihi vero gloriosum, te juvenem consulem florere laudibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 14, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">bene de re publica mereri, gloriosum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:14:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 14, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod quaesitur gloriosum an indecorum sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 4:61:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 4, 61, 1</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">in saecula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,056:3:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Dan. 3, 56</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19685.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Vainglorious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">boasting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bragging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">haughty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conceited</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ostentatious</hi> (syn.: jactans, arrogans, superbus, insolens, vanus, ostentator). </sense><sense id="n19685.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">vos nequam et gloriosae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(vir) mendax et gloriosus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 4, 1, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi illa magnifica et gloriosa ostentatio civitatis?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 22, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praepotens et gloriosa philosophia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:43:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 43, 193</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistolae jactantes et gloriosae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:9:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 9, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pavo, gloriosum animal,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 20, 22, § 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse gloriosi animi,</quote> <trans><tr>eager for glory</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:prol. 31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. prol. 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">38</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">B. infra: vir,</quote> <trans><tr>a braggart</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:25:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 25, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19685.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp.: Miles gloriosus, <hi rend="ital">the title of a comedy of Plautus.</hi> To this refers: <cit><quote lang="la">deforme est, de se ipsum praedicare, falsa praesertim, et cum irrisione audientium imitari Militem gloriosum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:38:137" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 38, 137</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">milites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:26:98" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 26, 98</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">glōrĭōse</orth>. </sense><sense id="n19685.4" n="1" level="3"> (Acc. to I.) <hi rend="ital">Gloriously</hi>: res magnas manu gerere, Naev. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:8:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 8, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">triumphare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 12, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 15, 1</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia relicua gloriosius retinebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 1, 55</bibl></cit> Dietsch. —<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod per ipsos confici potuit, gloriosissime et magnificentissime confecerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 4, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19685.5" n="2" level="3"> (Acc. to II.) <hi rend="ital">Boastfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vauntingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pompously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exorsus es non gloriose magis a veritate quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:8:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 8, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentiri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:27:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 27, 72</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">proloqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cb n="GLUT" /> amiciri, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 2, 5, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitiam ostentare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 4:61:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 4, 61, 8</bibl></cit> Dietsch.</sense></entryFree>
