glos: <entryFree id="n19686" type="main" key="glos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glos</orth>, <itype>glōris</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ga/lows</foreign>, Att. <foreign lang="greek">ga/lws</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n19686.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a husband's sister</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sister-in-law.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19686.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:10:4:section=6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 10, 4, § 6</bibl>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=98" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 98</bibl> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 27</bibl>; Aus. Idyll. monos. de hist. 13.—</sense><sense id="n19686.2" n="II" level="1"> Acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 557, 6</bibl>, also for fratria, but without an example.</sense></entryFree>
glossa: <entryFree id="n19687" type="greek" key="glossa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glossa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">glw=ssa</foreign>, <sense id="n19687.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an obsolete</hi> or <hi rend="ital">foreign word that requires explanation;</hi> for the usual glossema, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 127</bibl> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:35" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 35</bibl>, written as Greek).—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">glossae</orth>, <hi rend="ital">a term applied to collections of such words with explanations</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tesca aiunt sancta esse, Qui glossas scripserunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=10" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 10</bibl></cit> Müll; cf. glossema.</sense></entryFree>
glossarium: <entryFree id="n19688" type="main" key="glossa_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glossārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>glossa</etym>, <sense id="n19688.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a vocabulary</hi> or <hi rend="ital">glossary of antiquated</hi> or <hi rend="ital">foreign words that need explanation</hi>: vos philosophi meri estis, ut M. Cato ait, mortuaria glossaria; <cit><quote lang="la">namque colligitis lexidia, res tetras et inanes, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:7:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 7, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
glossema: <entryFree id="n19689" type="greek" key="glosse_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glossēma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">glw/sshma</foreign>, <sense id="n19689.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an antiquated</hi> or <hi rend="ital">foreign word needing explanation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">circa glossemata etiam, id est voces minus usitatas, non ultima ejus professionis diligentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:8:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 8, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">camillam (apud Ennium), qui glossemata interpretati, dixerunt administram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=34" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 34</bibl></cit> Müll.: glossemata nobis praecipit, Asin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gramm. 22</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Glos-sēmăta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a name given to collections of such words with explanations</hi>: naucum ait Aelius Stilo omnium rerum putamen: Glossematorum autem scriptores, etc., Fest. s. v. naucum, p. 166, b Müll: ocrem antiqui, ut Ateius Philologus in libro Glossematorum refert, etc., id. s. v. ocrem, p. 181, a.</sense></entryFree>
glossematicus: <entryFree id="n19690" type="greek" key="glosse_ma^ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glossēmătĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">glwsshmatiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n19690.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to obsolete</hi> or <hi rend="ital">foreign words</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus locutionum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 434</bibl></cit> P.</sense></entryFree>
glossopetra: <entryFree id="n19691" type="main" key="glosso^pe^tra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glossŏpĕtra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">glwssope/tra</foreign>, <sense id="n19691.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone resembling the human tongue</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 59, § 164</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 37 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
glottis: <entryFree id="n19692" type="greek" key="glottis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glottis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">glwtti/s</foreign>, <sense id="n19692.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little bird</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 23, 33, § 66</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
glubo: <entryFree id="n19693" type="greek" key="glu_bo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glūbo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>Gr. <foreign lang="greek">glu/fw</foreign>; cf. sculpo</etym> (ante-class.). <sense id="n19693.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to deprive of its bark</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bark</hi>, <hi rend="ital">peel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">salictum glubito arteque alligato,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 33, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ramos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:55:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 55, 2</bibl></cit>.—In mal. part.: <cit><quote lang="la">(Lesbia) Glubit magnanimos Remi nepotes (v. deglubo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:58:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 58, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19693.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cast off its shell</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bark</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">materies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 31, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">17, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
glucidatum: <entryFree id="n19694" type="gloss" key="glucidatum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glucidatum</orth> suave et jucundum. Graeci enim <foreign lang="greek">gluku\n</foreign> dulcem dicunt, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=98" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 98</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
gluma: <entryFree id="n19695" type="main" key="glu_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glūma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>glubo</etym>, <sense id="n19695.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hull</hi> or <hi rend="ital">husk</hi>, esp. of corn (cf.: stramentum, palea, acus): arista et granum omnibus fere notum; <cit><quote lang="la">gluma paucis. Itaque id apud Ennium solum scriptum scio esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:48:1 sq" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 48, 1 sq.</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> p. 174</bibl> Vahl.); Paul. ex Fest. s. h. v. p. 98 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
gluo: <entryFree id="n19696" type="gloss" key="gluo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gluo</orth> <foreign lang="greek">sustu/fw</foreign> (to draw together), Gloss. Philox. (hence glutus, gluten, glus).</entryFree>
glus: <entryFree id="n19697" type="main" key="glus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glus</orth>, <itype>ūtis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Gr. <foreign lang="greek">gloio/s</foreign>, sticky oil; <foreign lang="greek">gli/a</foreign>, slime, gluten</etym>, <sense id="n19697.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">glue;</hi> for the usual gluten, Aus. Idyll. monos. per interr. 12, 10; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 3, 66</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
glutglut: <entryFree id="n19698" type="main" key="glut glut"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glut glut</orth>, an onomatop. word imitating the sound of water falling through a narrow aperture, Poët. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Anthol. Lat.</author> 2, 405</bibl> Burm.</entryFree>
gluten: <entryFree id="n19699" type="main" key="glu_ten"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glūten</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (<sense id="n19699.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">masc.</hi> acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 3, § 296</bibl>), and <orth extent="full" lang="la">glūtĭnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>v. glus; cf. <foreign lang="greek">liso/s, lisso/s</foreign>, smooth; <foreign lang="greek">gli/sxros</foreign>, sticky</etym>, <hi rend="ital">glue.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19699.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, form gluten: <cit><quote lang="la">collectumque haec ipsa ad munera gluten,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1069" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1069</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 160</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:215 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 40, 79, § 215 al.</bibl>; form glutinum. glutinum ferunt Daedalum invenisse, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 67</bibl> and 106; Sall. Fragm. ib.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:231" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 39, 94, § 231</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:82" default="NO" valid="yes">13, 12, 26, § 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:236" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 17, 71, § 236</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 12, 10 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n19699.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a connecting tie</hi>, <hi rend="ital">band</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ossa, nervos ac medullas glutino cutis tegi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 9, 102</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19699.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <foreign lang="greek">ei(marme/nh</foreign> et necessitas ambae sibi invicem individuo connexae sunt glutino (al. glutinio), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Trism. p. 100</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">glutino caritatis haerens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 3, 3</bibl></cit>. <pb n="819" /> <cb n="GLYC" /></sense></entryFree>
glutinamentum: <entryFree id="n19700" type="main" key="glu_ti^na_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glūtĭnāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>glutino</etym>, <sense id="n19700.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that which is glued together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a glued</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pasted place</hi> in paper, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 12, 25, § 81</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
glutinarius: <entryFree id="n19701" type="gloss" key="glu_ti^na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glūtĭnārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>gluten</etym>, <sense id="n19701.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a glueboiler</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4198</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
glutinatio: <entryFree id="n19702" type="hapax" key="glu_ti^na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glūtĭnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>glutino, a gluing together; transf.</etym>, in medic., <sense id="n19702.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a drawing together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">closing</hi> of wounds: <cit><quote lang="la">vulneris,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a closing up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:27:section=28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 27, § 28</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
glutinativus: <entryFree id="n19703" type="main" key="glu_ti^na_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glūtĭnātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, in medic., <sense id="n19703.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that glues</hi> or <hi rend="ital">draws together</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">virtus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 72</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">77</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
glutinator: <entryFree id="n19704" type="main" key="glu_ti^na_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glūtĭnātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n19704.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a gluer together of books</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a bookbinder</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 4</bibl>, b, 1; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2925</bibl> (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 4198</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
glutinatorius: <entryFree id="n19705" type="main" key="glu_ti^na_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glūtĭnātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, in medic., <sense id="n19705.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that glues</hi> or <hi rend="ital">draws together</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> de Diaet. 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
glutineus: <entryFree id="n19706" type="hapax" key="glu_ti^ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glūtĭnĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>gluten</etym>, <sense id="n19706.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gluey</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glutinous</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Rutil.</author> Itin. 1, 610</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
glutinium: <entryFree id="n19707" type="main" key="glu_ti^ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glūtĭnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, v. gluten, II.</entryFree>
glutino: <entryFree id="n19708" type="main" key="glu_ti^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glūtĭno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>gluten</etym>, <sense id="n19708.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to glue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glue together.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19708.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">chartas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 25, 60, § 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fragmenta vitri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 3, 11, § 51</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19708.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in medic., <hi rend="ital">to close up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">join</hi> an opening, esp. a wound: <cit><quote lang="la">glutinantia medicamenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cicatricibus glutinandis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 6, 35, § 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecisos nervos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 5, 19, § 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 28</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si orae vulneris se glutinarunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
glutinosus: <entryFree id="n19709" type="main" key="glu_ti^no_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glūtĭnōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n19709.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of glue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gluey</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glutinous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">viscous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tenacious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1 praef" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1 praef.</bibl></cit> § <cit><quote lang="la">24: caro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 22</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pus et sanguine et sanie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 26, 20</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:11:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 11, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">resina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 7, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
glutinum: <entryFree id="n19710" type="main" key="glu_ti^num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glūtĭnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. gluten.</entryFree>
glutio: <entryFree id="n19711" type="main" key="glu_ti^o1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glūtĭo</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">gluttio</orth>, <itype>īvi or ĭi, ītum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>kindr. with Sanscr. glri, to swallow down; hence also gula and the redupl. gurgulio</etym>, <sense id="n19711.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to swallow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">gulp down</hi>: gluttit, <foreign lang="greek">e)gka/ptei</foreign>, Gloss. (mostly post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n19711.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimio sunt crudae (collyrae), nisi quas madidas gluttias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epulas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:29" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">micularum minimum cum vino destillatum gluttivi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:Ep. 5:40" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author> Ep. 5, 40</bibl></cit> Mai.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 7, 19</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19711.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of sound, <hi rend="ital">to utter interruptedly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as if swallowing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum glutiunt vocem velut strangulati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 12, 15, § 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19711.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Christus clamans glutitam mortem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 2, 267</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n19711.4" type="gloss" key="glutio2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glutio</orth>, <itype>īre, the noise made by hens</itype>, <hi rend="ital">to cluck;</hi> v. ‡ glocidare.</entryFree>
gluto: <entryFree id="n19712" type="main" key="glu_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glūto</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">glutto</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. glutio</etym>, <sense id="n19712.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a glutton</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gormandizer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:112" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 112</bibl>; Poët. ap. Anth. Lat. 2, 405; cf. Paul. ex Fest. s. v. ingluvies, p. 112 Müll.; Schol. Jus. 4, 17; 29; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 10, 114</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
glutus: <entryFree id="n19713" type="main" key="glu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glūtus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">gluttus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lit., <hi rend="ital">part.</hi> of ‡ gluo, drawn together; hence opp. to crumbling, friable</etym>, <sense id="n19713.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">tenacious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">well-tempered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">soft</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus bipalio subactus siet beneque terra tenera siet beneque glutus siet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 45, 1</bibl></cit>; also ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 18, 29, § 125</bibl>.—Here too belongs glittis subactis, levibus, teneris, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=98" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 98</bibl> Müll. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
glycera: <entryFree id="n19714" type="main" key="Gly^ce^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Glycĕra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*glukera/</foreign>, <sense id="n19714.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Greek female name.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19714.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A celebrated courtesan at Athens</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the mistress of the poet Menander</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:187" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 187</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19714.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A mistress of Horace</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:19:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 19, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 30, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19714.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A mistress of Tibullus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:33:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 33, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
glycerium: <entryFree id="n19715" type="main" key="Gly^ce^ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Glycĕrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*gluke/rion</foreign>, <sense id="n19715.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a female character in the Andria of Terence</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 108</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
glycon: <entryFree id="n19716" type="main" key="Gly^con"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Glycon</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Glyco</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*glu/kwn</foreign>, <sense id="n19716.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Greek proper name.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19716.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A wrestler</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 30</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19716.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A physician</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
glyconius: <entryFree id="n19717" type="greek" key="Gly^co_ni_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Glycōnīus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*glukw/neios</foreign>, <sense id="n19717.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Glyconic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">metrum,</quote> <trans><tr>so called from its inventor</tr>, <tr>Glycon</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
glycymeris: <entryFree id="n19718" type="greek" key="gly^cy^me^ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glycymĕris</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">glukumeri/s</foreign>, <sense id="n19718.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of shell-fish</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 11, 53, § 147</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 9 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
glycyrrhiza: <entryFree id="n19719" type="greek" key="gly^cyrrhi_za"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glycyrrhīza</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">gluku/r)r(iza</foreign>, <sense id="n19719.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">licorice-root</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 9, 11, § 24</bibl>.—Also called <orth extent="full" lang="la">glycyrrhīzon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">gluku/r)r(izon</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:284" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 54, 119, § 284</bibl> (called by <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 23</bibl>, dulcis radix).</sense></entryFree>
glycyside: <entryFree id="n19720" type="greek" key="gly^cy^si_de"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glycysīde</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">glukusi/dh</foreign>, <sense id="n19720.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a peony</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 4, 10, § 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:84" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 10, 60, § 84</bibl> <cb n="GNIT" /> sq.; collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">glycysis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 64</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
glyssomarga: <entryFree id="n19721" type="greek" key="glyssomarga"><orth extent="full" lang="la">glyssomarga</orth>, v. glisomarga.</entryFree>
gnaeus: <entryFree id="n19722" type="main" key="Gnaeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gnaeus</orth>, v. Gneus.</entryFree>
gnaphalion: <entryFree id="n19723" type="greek" key="gnapha^li^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gnaphălĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">gnafa/lion</foreign>, <sense id="n19723.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the herb cudweed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cotton-grass</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 10, 61, § 88</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gnarigavit: <entryFree id="n19724" type="gloss" key="gnarigavit"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gnarigavit</orth> <itype>significat apud Livium</itype> (Andron.) narravit, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=95" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 95</bibl> Müll. <sense id="n19724.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi> [gnarus].</sense></entryFree>
gnaritas: <entryFree id="n19725" type="main" key="gna_ri^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gnārĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>gnarus</etym>, <sense id="n19725.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">knowledge</hi> (very rare): locorum, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 116, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 2, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gnarivisse: <entryFree id="n19726" type="gloss" key="gnarivisse"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gnarivisse</orth> <itype>narrasse</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=95" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 95</bibl> Müll. <sense id="n19726.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> cf.: ‡ gnaritur <foreign lang="greek">gnwri/zetai</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
gnarurat: <entryFree id="n19727" type="gloss" key="gnarurat"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gnarurat</orth> <foreign lang="greek">gnwri/zei</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</entryFree>
gnarus: <entryFree id="n19728" type="main" key="gna_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gnārus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> (also ante- and postclass. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">gnārŭris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 2, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. prol. 47</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 22, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 113</bibl>; and cf.: gnaruris <foreign lang="greek">gnw/rimos</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.—Another form is ‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">nārus</orth>, <itype>like navus, notus</itype>, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:47:158" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 47, 158</bibl>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. gna-, ganāmi, know; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">gignw/skw</foreign>; Lat. gnosco, nosco, narrare, etc.</etym>, <sense id="n19728.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">knowing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">acquainted with</hi> a thing; <hi rend="ital">skilful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">practised</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expert</hi> (syn. doctus, eruditus, peritus). </sense><sense id="n19728.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (rare but class.); constr. with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, or with a <hi rend="ital">rel.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">object-clause;</hi> ante- and post-class. with <case>acc.</case> </sense><sense id="n19728.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec loci gnara sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 3, 28</bibl></cit>: loci, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 700</bibl> P.; <cit><quote lang="la">rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:64:228" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 64, 228</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armorum et militiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1 praef" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1 praef.</bibl></cit> § <cit><quote lang="la">4: artis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 8, 9, § 30</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si modo vinitor gnarus est iis utendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:25:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 25, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostri tergi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:25:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 25, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19728.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">rel.clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Periclem uberem et fecundum fuisse, gnarumque, quibus orationis modis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:4:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemine gnaro aut opinante, quidnam coepturus esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:46" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 46</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19728.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hasdrubal satis gnarus, Hannibalem transitus quosdam pretio mercatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:29:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 29, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 5, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">65</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 19 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">concha cum manum videt, comprimit sese operitque opes suas, gnara propter illas se peti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 35, 55, § 110</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19728.5" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">simul gnarures vos volo esse hanc rem mecum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut mecum sitis gnarures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. prol. 47</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19728.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">known</hi> (for the usual notus; post-Aug.; <cit><quote lang="la">very rare, except in Tac.): in paludem gnaram vincentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">idque nulli magis gnarum quam Neroni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 61</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">gnarum id Caesari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 5</bibl></cit> (opp. incognita), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 281, 9</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">conspicui eoque gnari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 35</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi> not in use.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 51 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
gnatho: <entryFree id="n19729" type="main" key="Gna^tho"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gnătho</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*gna/qwn</foreign>, <sense id="n19729.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a parasite in the</hi> Eunuchus <hi rend="ital">of Terence;</hi> hence used to denote <hi rend="ital">a parasite</hi> in gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:25:93 sq" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 25, 93 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 6, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 3, 13</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n19729.1" n="II" level="1"> Deriv.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gnăthōnĭci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, qs. <hi rend="ital">disciples of Gnatho</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Gnathonites</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">parasites</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gnatia: <entryFree id="n19730" type="main" key="Gna_tia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gnātia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, i. q. Egnatia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 97</bibl>, v. Egnatia.</entryFree>
gnatus: <entryFree id="n19731" type="main" key="gna_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. natus under nascor.</entryFree>
gnave: <entryFree id="n19732" type="main" key="gna_ve"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gnāve, gnāvĭtas, gnāvĭter</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">gnāvus</orth>, v. under nav-.</entryFree>
gneus: <entryFree id="n19733" type="main" key="Gne_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gnēus</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gnaeus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cnaeus</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n19733.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman praenomen</hi>, cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:7:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 7, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gnidus: <entryFree id="n19734" type="main" key="Gni^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gnĭdus or Gnĭdos</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cnĭd-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kni/dos</foreign>, <sense id="n19734.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Doric city in Caria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">celebrated for its statue of Venus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the workmanship of Praxiteles;</hi> now <hi rend="ital">Cnido</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:16:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 16, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 28, 29, § 104</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:30:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 30, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 28, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:531" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 531</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 12, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19734.1" n="II" level="1"> Deriv. <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gnĭdĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Cn-</orth>), <itype>a um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Gnidus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Gnidian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Venus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 5, 4, § 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gyges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:5:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 5, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">granum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the seed of the mezereon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 21, 35, § 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arundo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Gnidian writingreed</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 7, 50</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">also called nodi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 74</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gnĭdii</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Cn-</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Gnidus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Gnidians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:60:section=135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 60, § 135</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 5, 4, § 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gnipho: <entryFree id="n19735" type="main" key="Gni_pho"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gnīpho</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n19735.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">M. Antonius Gnipho,</quote> <trans><tr>a rhetorician at Rome in the time of Cicero</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:23 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 23 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
gnitus: <entryFree id="n19736" type="gloss" key="gnitus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gnitus</orth> et <orth extent="full" lang="la">gnixus</orth> a genibus prisci <cb n="GONN" /> dixerunt, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=96" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 96</bibl> Müll. <sense id="n19736.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> v. 1. nitor.</sense></entryFree>
gnobilis: <entryFree id="n19737" type="main" key="gno_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gnōbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, v. nobilis.</entryFree>
gnome: <entryFree id="n19738" type="greek" key="gno_me"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gnōme</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">gnw/mh</foreign>, <sense id="n19738.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sentence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">maxim;</hi> pure Lat., sententia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:Ep. 3:11" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author> Ep. 3, 11</bibl> Mai.</sense></entryFree>
gnomon: <entryFree id="n19739" type="greek" key="gno_mon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gnōmon</orth>, <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">gnw/mwn</foreign>, <sense id="n19739.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the pin</hi> or <hi rend="ital">style of a sundial</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the gnomon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 72, 74, § 182</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:8" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, 194</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gnomonicus: <entryFree id="n19740" type="greek" key="gno_mo^ni^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gnōmŏnĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">gnwmoniko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n19740.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a gnomon</hi>, and, in gen., <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a sundial</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gnomonic.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19740.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n19740.2" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n19740.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">gnōmŏ-nĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">gnōmŏnĭce</orth>, <itype>es</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">gnwmonikh/</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the art of making</hi> or <hi rend="ital">judging of sundials</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the art of dialling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gnomonics</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:9:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 9, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 76, 78, § 187</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n19740.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">gnōmŏnĭci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">gnwmonikoi/</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">persons skilled in gnomonics</hi>, <hi rend="ital">diallists</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 37, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gnosco: <entryFree id="n19741" type="main" key="gnosco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gnosco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. nosco <sense id="n19741.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
gnostice: <entryFree id="n19742" type="main" key="gnosti^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gnostĭcē</orth>, <itype>es</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">gnwstikh/</foreign>, <sense id="n19742.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">insight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the power of perceiving</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 3, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gnostici: <entryFree id="n19743" type="greek" key="Gnosti^ci"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gnostĭci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*gnwstikoi/</foreign>, <sense id="n19743.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Gnostics</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a religious sect in the first centuries of the Christian era</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:de Haeres. 6" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> de Haeres. 6</bibl>. So a work of Tertullian is entitled: adversus Gnosticos.</sense></entryFree>
gnosus: <entryFree id="n19744" type="main" key="Gno_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gnōsus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gnōsos</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gnoss-</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cnoss-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*knwso/s</foreign> (<foreign lang="greek">*knwsso/s</foreign>), <sense id="n19744.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the ancient capital of Crete</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the residence of Minos;</hi> now <hi rend="ital">Cnosson</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:12" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 20, § 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 185</bibl> Cort. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 11, 46</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19744.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n19744.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gnōsĭus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Gnoss-, Cnōs-</orth>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cnoss-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Gnosus</hi>, or <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to Crete</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Gnosian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Cretan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ctesiphon,</quote> <trans><tr>of Gnosus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 37, 38, § 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Epimenides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 48, 49, § 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calami spicula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:15:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 15, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra,</quote> <trans><tr>of Minos</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stella Coronae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of Ariadne</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:222" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 222</bibl></cit>; also called Gn. ardor Bacchi, Col. poët. 10, 52.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gnōsia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Gnosian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Cretan;</hi> of <hi rend="ital">Ariadne</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:3:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 3, 2</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gnō-sii</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Gnosus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Gnosians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:5:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 5, 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19744.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gnōsĭ-ăcus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Gnoss-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, the same: <cit><quote lang="la">rex,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Minos</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regnum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Crete</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:669" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 669</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">carina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:144" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 144</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">rates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:471" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 471</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19744.4" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gnōsĭas</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Gnoss-</orth>), <itype>ădis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Gnosian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Cretan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvencae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:293" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 293</bibl></cit>.—<pos>Subst.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Gnosian</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Ariadne</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:556" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 556</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n19744.5" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gnōsis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Gnoss-</orth>), <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, the same: <cit><quote lang="la">corona,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the constellation of Ariadne's Crown</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:460" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 460</bibl></cit>.—<pos>Subst.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Gnosian</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Ariadne</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:1:232" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 1, 232</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:676 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Th. 12, 676 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
gnotus: <entryFree id="n19745" type="main" key="gno_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gnōtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. nosco <sense id="n19745.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
gobius: <entryFree id="n19746" type="greek" key="go_bi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gōbĭus</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">cōb-</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">gōbio</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kwbio/s</foreign>, <sense id="n19746.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fish of small value</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the gudgeon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,014:128" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Hal. 128</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 57, 83, § 175</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:88" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 88</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:37" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 37</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 10, 131</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">form cobio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 11, 53, § 146</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
golgoe: <entryFree id="n19747" type="main" key="Golgoe"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Golgoe</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Golgi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*golgoi/</foreign>, <sense id="n19747.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Cyprus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">famous for the worship of Aphrodite</hi> (<hi rend="ital">Venus</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 31, 35, § 130</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:36:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 36, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:96" default="NO" valid="yes">64, 96</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gomorra: <entryFree id="n19748" type="main" key="Go^morra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gŏmorra</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gŏmorrha</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*go/mor)r(a</foreign>, <sense id="n19748.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the city of Gomorrha</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Palestine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:10:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 10, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">19, 28</bibl> et saep.; called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gŏmorrhum</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 40</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 35</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19748.1" n="II" level="1"> Deriv.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gŏmorrhaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Gomorrha</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ruinae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Ham. 844</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gomphi: <entryFree id="n19749" type="main" key="Gomphi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gomphi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*go/mfoi</foreign>, <sense id="n19749.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Thessaly on the Penēus</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Kalabaki</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:29 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 8, 15, § 29 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:80:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 80, 1</bibl>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:14" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:13 al" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 13 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n19749.1" n="II" level="1"> Deriv. <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gomphenses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Gomphi</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Gomphians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 81</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gomphus: <entryFree id="n19750" type="greek" key="gomphus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gomphus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">go/mfos</foreign>, <sense id="n19750.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a nail, peg</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Mag. 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:3:48" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 3, 48</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gonger: <entryFree id="n19751" type="main" key="gonger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gonger</orth>, <itype>gri</itype>, v. conger.</entryFree>
gongylis: <entryFree id="n19752" type="greek" key="gongy^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gongylis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">gogguli/s</foreign>, <sense id="n19752.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rape</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turnip</hi>, Col. poët. 10, 421.</sense></entryFree>
goniaea: <entryFree id="n19753" type="greek" key="goniaea"><orth extent="full" lang="la">goniaea</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n19753.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 59, § 164</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gonni: <entryFree id="n19754" type="main" key="Gonni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gonni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n19754.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Thessaly near the Vale of Tempe</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Lycóstomo</hi>, <pb n="820" /> <cb n="GORT" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:10" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 10</bibl>.—Also in the <number>sing.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gonnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:67" default="NO" valid="yes">67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:6" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gonnocondylum: <entryFree id="n19755" type="main" key="Gonnocondy^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gonnocondylum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n19755.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Thessaly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
gonorrhoea: <entryFree id="n19756" type="greek" key="go^norrhoea"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gŏnorrhoea</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">gono/rroia</foreign>, <sense id="n19756.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a seminal flux</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gonorrhœa</hi>, Firm. Math. 3, 7, 8.</sense></entryFree>
gordaei: <entryFree id="n19757" type="main" key="Gordaei"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gordaei</orth>, v. Gordueni.</entryFree>
gordianus: <entryFree id="n19758" type="main" key="Gordi^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gordĭānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n19758.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman proper name;</hi> in partic., the name of three Roman emperors, Capitol. Gord.—</sense><sense id="n19758.1" n="II" level="1"> Deriv. <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gordĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the emperor Gordian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Gordian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">LEGIO,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 53, 10</bibl></cit>; Inscr. Don. cl. 3, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> 48.</sense></entryFree>
gordium: <entryFree id="n19759" type="main" key="Gordi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gordĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*go/rdion</foreign>, <sense id="n19759.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Phrygia Major on the Sangarius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">famous for the Gordian knot</hi> (v. Gordius), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 32, 42, § 146</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:18:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 18, 10</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:1:12" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 1, 12</bibl> sqq.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gordĭensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Gordium</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:172" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> 172</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gordius: <entryFree id="n19760" type="main" key="Gordi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gordĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*go/rdios</foreign>, <sense id="n19760.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a king of Gordium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Phrygia Major</hi>, <hi rend="ital">famous for the inextricable knot on his chariot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which Alexander the Great cut with his sword</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:1:15" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 1, 15</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:7:13" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 7, 13</bibl> sqq.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gordĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Gordius</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nodus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>an insoluble problem</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 11, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gordiutichos: <entryFree id="n19761" type="main" key="Gordiu_ti_chos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gordiūtīchos</orth>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n19761.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Phrygia Major</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gordueni: <entryFree id="n19762" type="main" key="Gordu^e_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gordŭēni</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Cord-</orth>) or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gordyaei</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Cord-</orth>) or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gordaei</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n19762.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Armenia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the modern Kurds</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 15, 17, § 118</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:1:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 1, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gordyaeorum montes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 27, 31, § 129</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gorge: <entryFree id="n19763" type="main" key="Gorge"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gorge</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n19763.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a daughter of Œneus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and sister of Meleager and Dejanira</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who was changed into a bird</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:543" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 543</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 174" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 174</bibl>; the same, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gorgis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:97" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 97</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gorgias: <entryFree id="n19764" type="main" key="Gorgi^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gorgĭas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*gorgi/as</foreign>. <sense id="n19764.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A famous Greek sophist of Leontini</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a contemporary of Socrates</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:5:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 5, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:22:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 22, 103</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:8:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 8, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:12:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 12, 39</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n19764.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A rhetorician in Athens</hi>, <hi rend="ital">instructor of Cicero's son</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and author of the rhetorical work from which excerpts have been made by</hi> Rutilius Lupus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:21:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 21, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19764.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A sculptor of Sparta</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 49</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gorgo: <entryFree id="n19765" type="main" key="Gorgo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gorgo</orth>, <itype>ŏnis</itype>, or -gūs (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gorgŏ-na</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 10, 278), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*gorgw/</foreign>, <sense id="n19765.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a daughter of Phorcus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called</hi> Medusa, <hi rend="ital">whose hair consisted of snakes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and who turned all she looked upon to stone</hi>; <hi rend="ital">she was killed by Perseus. Her head was fixed on the shield of Pallas</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and from her blood sprang the winged horse Pegasus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:699" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 699</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 180</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">202</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:616" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 616</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 438</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:54" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:26:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 26, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:56:section=124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 56, § 124</bibl>.—In apposition: <cit><quote lang="la">ora Medusae Gorgonis anguineis cincta fuisse comis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:7:12" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 7, 12</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Gorgons</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the three daughters of Phorcus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Stheno</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Euryale</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and Medusa</hi>, all of whom are described as above, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:289" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 289</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 31, 36, § 200</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:4:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 4, 9</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n19765.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n19765.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gorgŏnĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Gorgon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Gorgonian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">crines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:801" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 801</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 196</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus,</quote> <trans><tr>the dwelling of Gorgon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:779" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 779</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:504" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 3, 504</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venena,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>snaky hair like that of Gorgon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:341" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 341</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Pegasus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:450" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 450</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:61" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caballus, the same,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:118" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 118</bibl></cit>.—Hence also: <cit><quote lang="la">lacus,</quote> <trans><tr>the fountain Hippocrene</tr>, <tr>on Mount Helicon</tr>, <tr>which burst forth where Pegasus struck the ground with his hoof</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 3</bibl></cit> (4, 2), 32.—</sense><sense id="n19765.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gorgŏnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">coral</hi> (which hardens in the air), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 59, § 164</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gorgobina: <entryFree id="n19766" type="main" key="Gorgobi^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gorgobĭna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n19766.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city on the borders of Aquitania</hi>, <hi rend="ital">settled by the Boii</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perhaps the modern</hi> Charlieu, on the Loire, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 9, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gorgonidonii: <entryFree id="n19767" type="main" key="Gorgo^ni^do_ni^i"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gorgŏnĭdōnĭi campi</orth>, <itype>a name comically formed</itype>, qs. <sense id="n19767.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Gorgon-fields</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 13</bibl>; v. Ritschl ad h. l.</sense></entryFree>
gorgonifer: <entryFree id="n19768" type="gloss" key="gorgo^ni^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gorgŏnĭfer</orth>, <itype>ĕri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Gorgo-fero</etym>, <sense id="n19768.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Gorgon-bearer</hi>, a <usg type="style">poet.</usg> epithet of Perseus: PERSEO INVICTO, Inscr. ap. Gud. 56, 8.</sense></entryFree>
gortyn: <entryFree id="n19769" type="main" key="Gortyn"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gortyn</orth>, <itype>ȳnos</itype>, <sense id="n19769.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr> art.</sense></entryFree>
gortyna: <entryFree id="n19770" type="main" key="Gorty_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gortȳna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gortȳne</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cortȳnia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:7:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 7, 6</bibl>; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gortyn</orth>, <itype>nos</itype>, acc. to the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*go/rtun</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:709" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 709</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*gortu/nh</foreign>, <sense id="n19770.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an important and very ancient city of Crete</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:12" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 20, § 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:11" default="NO" valid="yes">12, 1, 5, § 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3</bibl>, <cb n="GRAC" /> 186; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 821" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 821</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19770.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n19770.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gortȳnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the city of Gortyna</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Gortynian;</hi> and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, in gen., for <hi rend="ital">Cretan</hi> (cf. Gnosius, under Gnosus, II. A.): <cit><quote lang="la">judex,</quote> <trans><tr>of Gortyna</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: canis, Varius ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stabula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spicula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:773" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 11, 773</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbiter,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Minos</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:530" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 530</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliger,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Dœdalus</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 10, 300</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gortȳnii</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Gortyna</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Gortynians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:60" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 60</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19770.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gortȳnĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Gortynian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Cretan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:778" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 778</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n19770.4" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gortȳnis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <pos>adj.</pos>, the same: <cit><quote lang="la">arundo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 214</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gorytos: <entryFree id="n19771" type="greek" key="go_ry_tos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gōrȳtos</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-us</orth>) or <orth extent="full" lang="la">cōrȳtos</orth> (˘˘, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 11, 56</bibl>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">gwruto/s</foreign>. <sense id="n19771.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A quiver</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 169</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:7:15" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 7, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:269 al" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 269 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n19771.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An arrow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">velox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:660" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 660</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gossympinus: <entryFree id="n19772" type="greek" key="gossympi^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gossympĭnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n19772.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the cotton-tree</hi>, Gossypium arboreum, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 10, 21, § 39</bibl>.—Also called <orth extent="full" lang="la">gossypion</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">gos-sipion</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 1, 2, § 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gothi: <entryFree id="n19773" type="main" key="Go^thi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gŏthi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*go/qoi</foreign>, <sense id="n19773.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Goths</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the great tribe of Northern Germany</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">huc possem victos inde referre Gŏthos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1135</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1159</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and scanned Gōthi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1162</bibl></cit> (of the year A. D. 565). Usually regarded as the same tribe, called, at an earlier period, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gŏthō-nes</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gŏtōnes</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 62</bibl>; and, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gŭtōnes</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 14, 28, § 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:35" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 2, 11, § 35</bibl>; but these were more probably the Getae, i. e. the Prussians and Lithuanians; cf. Holzmann ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:page=260 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. p. 260 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n19773.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv.: </sense><sense id="n19773.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gŏthĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the country of the Goths</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 30, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19773.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gŏ-thĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Goths</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Gothic</hi>: bellum, Trebell. XXX. Tyrann. 30.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Gothicus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a surname bestowed on the conqueror of the Goths</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 276, 4</bibl>; Num. ap. Eckh. D. N. V. 7, p. 472.</sense></entryFree>
gothini: <entryFree id="n19774" type="main" key="Gothi_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gothīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n19774.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Celtic tribe that inhabited the region about the modern Cracow</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 43</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gothones: <entryFree id="n19775" type="main" key="Gothones"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gothones</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gotones</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, v. Gothi.</entryFree>
grabatarius: <entryFree id="n19776" type="gloss" key="grabatarius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grabatarius</orth> <foreign lang="greek">klinopoio/s</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</entryFree>
grabatulus: <entryFree id="n19777" type="main" key="gra^ba_tu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grăbātŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>grabatus</etym>, <sense id="n19777.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little couch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pallet</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 107 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2</bibl>, p. 121.</sense></entryFree>
grabatus: <entryFree id="n19778" type="greek" key="gra^ba_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grăbātus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Macedonian</etym>, = <foreign lang="greek">kra/batos</foreign>, <sense id="n19778.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small</hi> or <hi rend="ital">low couch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pallet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">campbed</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">lectus, cubile, stratum, torus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:63:129" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 63, 129</bibl></cit>; Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 181, 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 97</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 18" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:20" default="NO">20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> M. 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:39:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 39, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:32:11" default="NO">12, 32, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 10, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">argento inaurato tectus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Scaev.</author> Dig. 33, 7, 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Marc. 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Act. 5, 15</bibl>; collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">grăbātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:37" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gracchuris: <entryFree id="n19779" type="main" key="Gracchu_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gracchūris</orth>, v. Gracchus, II. B.</entryFree>
gracchus: <entryFree id="n19780" type="main" key="Gracchus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gracchus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n19780.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman family name in the</hi> gens Sempronia; <cit><quote lang="la">the most celebrated are the two brothers Ti. and C. Sempronius Gracchus,</quote> <trans><tr>sons of Ti. Sempronius and Cornelia</tr>, <tr>daughter of Scipio Africanus the elder</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:86:296" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 86, 296</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 7, 6, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cornelia, mater Gracchorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:58:210" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 58, 210</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:168" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 168</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gracchi de seditione querentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19780.1" n="II" level="1"> Deriv. </sense><sense id="n19780.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gracchā-nus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Gracchus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Gracchan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">judices,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the knights who were made judges by a law of C. Gracchus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:34:128" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 34, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mala,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Brev. Vit. 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19780.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Grac-chūris</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a town in Spain founded by Ti. Sempronius Gracchus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ti.
