Sempronius Gracchus proconsul Celtiberos victos in deditionem accepit, monumentumque operum suorum Gracchurim oppidum in Hispania constituit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Ep. 41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> Ep. 41</bibl></cit>; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=97" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 97</bibl> Müll.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gracchū-rĭtāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Gracchuris</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 3, 4, § 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gracilens: <entryFree id="n19781" type="hapax" key="gra^ci^lens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grăcĭlens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>gracilis</etym>, <sense id="n19781.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">slender</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thin</hi>, for the usual gracilis, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 116, 8</bibl>; cf. gracilentus.</sense></entryFree>
gracilentus: <entryFree id="n19782" type="main" key="gra^ci^lentus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grăcĭlentus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n19782.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">slender</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thin</hi> (ante- and post-class. for the usual gracilis): filum, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 116, 8</bibl> (Ann. v. 259 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">equus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:12:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 12, 2</bibl></cit>. <cb n="GRAC" /></sense></entryFree>
gracilesco: <entryFree id="n19783" type="main" key="gra^ci^lesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grăcĭlesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n19783.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [gracilis], <hi rend="ital">to become slender</hi>, <hi rend="ital">small</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">obeliscus gracilescens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 17, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pyramidum magnitudo gracilescit paulatim,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 22, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gracilipes: <entryFree id="n19784" type="hapax" key="gra^ci^li^pes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grăcĭlĭpes</orth>, <itype>pĕdis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>gracilis-pes</etym>, <sense id="n19784.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">slender-footed</hi>: ciconia, Publ. Syr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 55</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gracilis: <entryFree id="n19785" type="main" key="gra^ci^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grăcĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype> (also ante-class. <orth extent="full" lang="la">grăcĭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 489, 21</bibl>; <number>plur.</number>: <sense id="n19785.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">gracilae virgines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 22</bibl></cit>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. karc, to be lean; old Lat. cracentes, slender (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:497" default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> Ann. 497</bibl> Vahl.); cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">koloka/nos</foreign></etym>, <hi rend="ital">thin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slender</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slim; meagre</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lean</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in Aug. prose; not in Cic.; but cf. gracilitas; syn.: exilis, tenuis, macer). </sense><sense id="n19785.1" n="I" level="1"> Physically: <cit><quote lang="la">in gracili macies crimen habere potest,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 328</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gracili sic tamque pusillo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis multa gracilis te puer in rosa, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:43:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 43, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Indi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:466" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 466</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:299" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 299</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equi hominesque paululi et graciles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:11:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 11, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores succinctioresque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 10, 17, § 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">resina (opp. pinguis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 6, 22, § 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gracilis et ejuncida vitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 173</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">folium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 19, 8, 54, § 171</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comae et lanuginis instar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:14:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 14, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 6, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">catena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:176" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 176</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vinculum auri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cacumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coronae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:87" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viae petauri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:86:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 86, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">rima,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:24:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 24, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umbra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:10:86" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 10, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spuma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 5, 15</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">glans brevior et gracilior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 6, 8, § 19</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuit (Nero) ventre projecto, gracillimis cruribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:51" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 51</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n19785.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, opp. to fat or rich, <hi rend="ital">meagre</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scanty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">poor</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 187</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clivi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:4:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vindemiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 20, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 15, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gracili Lare vivere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 287</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">pauperies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> M. 9, p. 219</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19785.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of style, <hi rend="ital">simple</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unadorned</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): materiae gracili sufficit ingenium. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:5:26" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 5, 26</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">lusimus, Octavi, gracili modulante Thalia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cul. 1</bibl></cit>: et in carmine et in soluta oratione genera dicendi probabilia sunt tria, quae Graeci <foreign lang="greek">xarakth=ras</foreign> vocant nominaque eis fecerunt <foreign lang="greek">a(dro/n, i)sxno/n, me/son</foreign>. Nos quoque, quem primum posuimus, uberem vocamus, secundum gracilem, tertium mediocrem. Uberi dignitas atque amplitudo est: <cit><quote lang="la">gracili venustas et subtilitas: medius in confinio est utriusque modi particeps, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:14:1 sq" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 14, 1 sq.</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">inter gracile validumque tertium aliquid constitutum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:66" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praefationes tersae, graciles, dulces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 3, 1</bibl></cit>.—Of the speaker: <cit><quote lang="la">non possumus esse tam graciles, simus fortiores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:36" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 36</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">grăcĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">slenderly.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19785.4" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 130</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19785.5" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">alia ornatius, alia gracilius esse dicenda,</quote> <trans><tr>more simply</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:130" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 130</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gracilitas: <entryFree id="n19786" type="main" key="gra^ci^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grăcĭlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>gracilis</etym>, <sense id="n19786.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">slenderness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thinness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leanness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">meagreness.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19786.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: macies, subtilitas): erat eo tempore in nobis summa gracilitas et infirmitas corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:91:313" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 91, 313</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cervicis et crurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:50" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crurum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">digitalis (vitis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 3, 4, § 40</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">papyrum in gracilitatem fastigatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 13, 11, 22, § 71</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">habet certos sui studiosos (Lysias), qui non tam habitus corporis opimos, quam gracilitates consectentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:16:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 16, 64</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19786.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of style, <hi rend="ital">simplicity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plainness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">want of ornament</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">quid Periclea? similemne credimus Lysiacae gracilitati?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 24</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">exempla in Latina lingua M. Varro esse dicit ubertatis Pacuvium, gracilitatis Lucilium, mediocritatis Terentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:14:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 14, 6</bibl></cit> (v. the whole 14th chap.): <cit><quote lang="la">pressa illa narrationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:3:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 3, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:9:2" default="NO">1, 9, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
graciliter: <entryFree id="n19787" type="main" key="gra^ci^li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grăcĭlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. gracilis <sense id="n19787.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
gracilitudo: <entryFree id="n19788" type="hapax" key="gra^ci^li^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grăcĭlĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>gracilis</etym>, <sense id="n19788.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">slenderness</hi>, for the class. gracilitas, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 116, 6</bibl> (Fragm. Trag. v. 88 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
gracillo: <entryFree id="n19789" type="hapax" key="gracillo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gracillo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n19789.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cackle</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cluck as a hen</hi>: cucurrire solet gallus, gallina gracillat, Auct. Carm. Philom. 25.</sense></entryFree>
gracilus: <entryFree id="n19790" type="main" key="gra^ci^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grăcĭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. gracilis <sense id="n19790.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
graculus: <entryFree id="n19791" type="main" key="gra_cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grācŭlus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">gracc-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>from its note gra gra, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:37" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 37</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 12, 7, 45</bibl></etym>, <sense id="n19791.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a jackdaw</hi>, Corvus monedula, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 79, § 201</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:256" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 47, 107, § 256</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:101" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 27, 41, § 101</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:116:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 116, 6</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n19791.1" n="b" level="4"> Prov. </sense><sense id="n19791.2" n="(a)" level="5"> Vetus adagium est: Nihil cum fidibus graculo, i. e. <hi rend="ital">ignorant persons</hi> <pb n="821" /> <cb n="GRAD" /> <hi rend="ital">have nothing to do with poetry</hi>, Gell. N. A. praef. § 19.—</sense><sense id="n19791.3" n="(b)" level="5"> Graculus Aesopi, i. e. <hi rend="ital">one who decks himself out in borrowed plumes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">makes a fine show with other people's property</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 12</bibl> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 3</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
gradalis: <entryFree id="n19792" type="main" key="gra^da_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grădālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>gradus</etym>, <sense id="n19792.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">step by step</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">pugna,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 473</bibl></cit> P.</sense></entryFree>
gradarius: <entryFree id="n19793" type="main" key="gra^da_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grădārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n19793.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to steps</hi>, <hi rend="ital">going</hi> or <hi rend="ital">proceeding step by step</hi> (very rare; not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n19793.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: equus gradarius, <hi rend="ital">a pacer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ambler</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 17, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugna,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 473</bibl></cit> P.—</sense><sense id="n19793.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of a deliberate speaker: <cit><quote lang="la">Cicero quoque noster gradarius fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 40:11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 40, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gradatim: <entryFree id="n19794" type="main" key="gra^da_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grădātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n19794.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">step by step</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by degrees</hi>, <hi rend="ital">little by little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gradually</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: sensim, paulatim, pedetentim): nihil ita pedetentim et gradatim tum accessus a te ad causam facti, tum recessus, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:14:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 14, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gradatim ascendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:61:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 61, 227</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. 15, 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid opus erat te gradatim istuc pervenire? Sumpsisses tuo jure. Quid autem est istuc gradatim?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:32:89" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 32, 89</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">gradatim respondens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:24:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 24, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad pauciores deducere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 65, 164</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum gradatim sursum versus reditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:39:135" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 39, 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">captiosissimo genere interrogationis utuntur, cum aliquid minutatim et gradatim additur aut demitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 16, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 5, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 4, 21, § 76</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos non una ut dicitur pertica, sed distincte gradatimque tractavi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 2, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:7:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 7, 9</bibl>: amicos habere, <hi rend="ital">by gradations</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">of different grades</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 6, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gradatio: <entryFree id="n19795" type="main" key="gra^da_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grădātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. * <sense id="n19795.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the making of a staircase</hi> or <hi rend="ital">series of steps</hi>, as in a theatre: <cit><quote lang="la">lapideis et marmoreis copiis gradationes (theatri) ab substructione fieri debent,</quote> <trans><tr>the seats ascending by gradations</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19795.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, rhet. t. t., <hi rend="ital">a gradation</hi> or <hi rend="ital">climax</hi> in speaking, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">kli=mac</foreign>: gradatio est, in qua non ante ad consequens verbum descenditur, quam ad superius conscensum est, hoc modo: Nam quae reliqua spes manet libertatis, si illis et quod libet, licet; et quod licet, possunt; et quod possunt, audent; et quod audent, faciunt; <cit><quote lang="la">et quod faciunt, vobis molestum non est? etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 25, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:54:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 54, 207</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:34" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:54" default="NO">9, 3, 54</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 2, 21, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gradatus: <entryFree id="n19796" type="main" key="gra^da_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grădātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n19796.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">furnished with steps</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">densis gradatisque corticum pollicibus ut orbibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 4, 7, § 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 6, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gradilis: <entryFree id="n19797" type="main" key="gra^di^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grădĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n19797.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to steps</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">templum Genii,</quote> <trans><tr>having steps</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 1</bibl></cit>: panis, <hi rend="ital">from the steps</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">distributed to the poor from an elevated place</hi>, Cod. Th. 14, 17, 3 sq. (for which: <cit><quote lang="la">quem panis alit gradibus dispensus ab altis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> adv. Symm. 1, 584</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 948</bibl>); Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:174" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 174</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gradior: <entryFree id="n19798" type="main" key="gra^di^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grădĭor</orth>, <itype>gressus, 3</itype>, <sense id="n19798.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> [Sanscr. kra-, kram, to go; Goth. skrei-tan; Germ. schreiten, Schritt], <hi rend="ital">to take steps</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to step</hi>, <hi rend="ital">walk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">go</hi> (rare but class.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">eo, grassor, incedo, vado, pergo, etc.): jam vero alia animalia gradiendo, alia serpendo ad pastum accedunt, alia volando, alia nando, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:47:122" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 47, 122</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quasdam (bestias) esse gradientes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:13:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 13, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si graderere tantum, quantum loquere, jam esses ad forum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si maledicetis, vostro gradiar limite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 3, 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inde auctumnus adit, graditur simul Euhius Euan,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:743" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 743</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longe gradientem et dira frementem Ut videre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:572" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 572</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">gradiens ingenti passu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:776" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 776</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">induiturque aures lente gradientis aselli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:179" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 179</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quo hic gradietur, pariter progrediminor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidenti animo gradietur ad mortem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:46:110" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 46, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pariter gressi per opaca viarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:633" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 633</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 80</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n19798.1" n="(b)" level="5"> With a homogeneous object: <cit><quote lang="la">uterque sexus (mulus et mula) viam recte graditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:37:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 37, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19798.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> transf., of inanim. and abstr. things: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nubes paulatim repit et omne qua graditur conturbat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">radit vox fauces saepe, facitque asperiora foras gradiens arteria clamor (corresp. to ire foras primordia vocum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:529" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 529</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19798.3" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of the conduct of life, <hi rend="ital">to walk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">live</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conduct one's self</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum sapientibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:13:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 13, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in superbia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,056:4:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dan. 4, 34</bibl></cit> al <cb n="GRAD" /></sense></entryFree>
gradivicola: <entryFree id="n19799" type="hapax" key="Gra_di_vi^co^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Grādīvĭcŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Gradivus</etym>, <sense id="n19799.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a worshipper of Mars</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:222" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 222</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gradivus: <entryFree id="n19800" type="main" key="Gra_di_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Grādīvus</orth> (once <orth extent="full" lang="la">Grădīvus</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:427" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 427</bibl>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>perh. from gradior, he who steps forth, marches out</etym>, <sense id="n19800.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname of Mars</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Numa) Salios item duodecim Marti Gradivo legit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 20, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rex Gradive,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:542" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 542</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nymphas venerabar agrestes Gradivumque patrem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Homericus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:113" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jure venis, Gradive,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:861" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 861</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:128" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 128</bibl>; so <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gradivus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:ib. 3:677" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 677</bibl></cit>; 5, 556; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:M. 14:820" default="NO"><author>id.</author> M. 14, 820</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:863" default="NO">15, 863</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gradus: <entryFree id="n19801" type="main" key="gra^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grădus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype> (archaic <sense id="n19801.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. sing.</hi> graduis, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 494, 17</bibl>; <case>dat.</case> gradu, Lucil. ap. Fest. s. v. remeligines, p. 276 Müll.), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>kindr. with Sanscr. kram, to go; v. gradior</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a step</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pace</hi> (cf.: gressus, passus, incessus). </sense><sense id="n19801.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad hanc conversionem, quae pedibus et gradu non egeret, ingrediendi membra non dedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 6</bibl></cit>: quaenam vox ex te resonans meo gradu remoram facit? Lucil. l. l.: gradum proferre pedum, Enn. ap. Fest. S. V. PEDUM, p. 249, a Müll. (Trag. v. 248 Vahl.): quo nunc incerta re atque inorata gradum Regredere conare? id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 166, 23</bibl> (Trag. v. 12 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">gradum facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:61:249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 61, 249</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tollere gradum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad forum suspenso gradu placide ire perrexi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:6:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 6, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quieto et placido gradu sequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 7, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.<cit><quote lang="la">, on the contrary: celeri gradu Eunt uterque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 1, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut tu es gradibus grandibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">citato gradu in hostem ducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:14:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 14, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concito gradu properare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gradum celerare,</quote> <trans><tr>to hasten</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:641" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 641</bibl></cit>: so, <cit><quote lang="la">corripere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 3, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">addere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 9, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sistere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:465" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 465</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sustinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:398" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 398</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">revocare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">referre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:502" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 502</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vertere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:138" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 138</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">peditum aciem instructam pleno gradu in hostem inducit,</quote> <trans><tr>at full pace</tr>, <tr>at a quick step</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:32:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 32, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 15, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 16, 2</bibl>; cf.: militari gradu viginti milia passuum horis quinque dumtaxat aestivis conficienda sunt; <cit><quote lang="la">pleno autem gradu, qui citatior est, totidem horis XXIV. milia peragenda sunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modico gradu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: presso gradu, = <foreign lang="greek">ba/dhn</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">with measured step</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a moderate pace</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:14:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 14, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">citato gradu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:14:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 14, 17</bibl></cit>; Trebon. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 16, 2</bibl>: non gradu, sed praecipiti cursu a virtute descitum, ad vitia transcursum, <hi rend="ital">step by step</hi>, = gradatim, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:1:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">per gradus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:354" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 354</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19801.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a step</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">degree</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem mortis timuit gradum,</quote> <trans><tr>pace</tr>, <tr>approach</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc quasi gradum quendam atque aditum ad cetera factum intelligitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:15:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 15, 38</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">itaque majoribus nostris in Africam ex hac provincia gradus imperii factus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:1:section=3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 1, § 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 8</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Crassus Licinius nec consul nec praetor ante fuerat, quam censor est factus: ex aedilitate gradum censuram fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 6, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:35:2" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 35, 2</bibl> Drak.: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc gradum mei reditus esse, quod mulieres revertissent,</quote> <trans><tr>a step towards my return</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 23, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:42:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 42, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">notitiam primosque gradus vicinia fecit: Tempore crevit amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 59</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:13:8" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 13, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum consuleretur, quid sentiret, Non possum, inquit, tibi dicere: nescio enim quid de gradu faciat: tamquam de essedario interrogaretur,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of the Peripatetics</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 29" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">etsi spondeus, quod est e longis duabus, hebetior videtur et tardior, habet tamen stabilem quendam et non expertem dignitatis gradum,</quote> <trans><tr>pace</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:64:216" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 64, 216</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n19801.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n19801.4" n="A" level="2"> In milit. and gladiator's lang., <hi rend="ital">station</hi>, <hi rend="ital">position</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ground</hi> taken by a combatant: <cit><quote lang="la">obnisos vos (velim) stabili gradu impetum hostium excipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:12:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 12, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de gradu libero ac stabili conari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:39:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 39, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in suo quisque gradu obnixi, urgentes scutis, sine respiratione ac respectu pugnabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:38:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 38, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inque gradu stetimus, certi non cedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostes gradu demoti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:32:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 32, 8</bibl></cit> Drak. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> for which: <cit><quote lang="la">turbare ac statu movere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:18:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 18, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19801.5" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a firm position</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stand</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corda virum mansere gradu,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>firm</tr>, <tr>steadfast</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:21" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortis et constantis est, non perturbari in rebus asperis, nec tumultuantem de gradu deici, ut dicitur,</quote> <trans><tr>to let one's self be disconcerted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:23:80" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 23, 80</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dejectus de gradu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 15, 3</bibl></cit>: motus gradu, Sen. <cb n="GRAE" /> Const. Sap. 19: <cit><quote lang="la">gradu depulsus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 5, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nam si gradum, si caritatem filii apud te haberem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 9, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19801.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">That on which one steps</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a step</hi> or <hi rend="ital">round of a ladder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a stair.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19801.7" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (usu. in <number>plur.</number>): quemadmodum scalarum gradus si alios tollas, alios incidas, etc., Caecin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 7, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haerent parietibus scalae, postesque sub ipsos Nituntur gradibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:443" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 443</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gradus templorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gradus ejusdem templi tollebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:15:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 15, 34</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aerea cui (templo) gradibus surgebant limina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:448" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 448</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:3:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 3, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro Palatii gradibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeceps per gradus ire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si gradibus trepidatur ab imis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:200" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 200</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19801.8" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum dextro pede primus gradus ascenditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19801.9" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things that rise by steps. </sense><sense id="n19801.10" n="(a)" level="5"> In hair-dressing, <hi rend="ital">a braid of hair</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput in gradus atque anulos comptum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:47" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comam in gradus frangere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 6, 44</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">coma in gradus formata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:51" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 51</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19801.11" n="(b)" level="5"> In econom. lang., <hi rend="ital">a spit</hi> or <hi rend="ital">such a depth of earth as can be dug at once with the spade</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:13:19" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 13, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:1:3" default="NO">4, 1, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19801.12" n="(g)" level="5"> In math., <hi rend="ital">a degree</hi> of a circle, <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 1, 579</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19801.13" n="(d)" level="5"> In veterin. lang., <hi rend="ital">a wrinkle on the roof of a horse's mouth</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">32</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19801.14" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a step</hi>, <hi rend="ital">degree</hi> in tones, in age, relationship, rank, etc. (equally common in <number>sing.</number> and <number>plur.</number>): <cit><quote lang="la">ille princeps variabit et mutabit, omnes sonorum tum intendens tum remittens persequetur gradus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:18:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 18, 59</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:61:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 61, 227</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab ima ad summam (vocem) ac retro multi sunt gradus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 15</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 119</bibl> Tit. et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">Paulatim gradus aetatis scandere adultae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1123</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quod tanta penuria est in omni vel honoris vel aetatis gradu, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 11, 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aetatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:36:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 36, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:7:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 7, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:79" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:3 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tit. 3 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">unus gradus et una progenies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 10, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostri quoque sanguinis auctor Juppiter est, totidemque gradus distamus ab illo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 143</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">a matre Magnum Pompeium artissimo contingebat gradu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (populus) te tam mature ad summum imperium per omnes honorum gradus extulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:11:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 11, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gradus dignitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 27</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 27</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.—Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex tam alto dignitatis gradu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:3:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 3, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gradus altior, altissimus, amplissimus, dignitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:55:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 55, 150</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 6, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:14:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 14, 30</bibl>; cf. also <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 27, 55</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">summum in praefectura florentissima gradum tenere et dignitatis et gratiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:13:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 13, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a senatorio gradu longe abesse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 21, 61</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ascendens gradibus magistratuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:81:281" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 81, 281</bibl></cit>.—Without <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">etenim quis est civis praesertim hoc gradu, quo me vos esse voluistis, tam oblitus beneficii vestri, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 6, 7, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 2, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omni gradu amplissimo dignissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gradus officiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:45:160" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 45, 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temporum servantur gradus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. 4, 12</bibl></cit>: cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">non iidem erunt necessitudinum gradus qui temporum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:18:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 18, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gradus cognationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:10:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 10, 1</bibl></cit> sqq.: <cit><quote lang="la">v. de gradibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 4, 11, 1</bibl></cit>-8: <cit><quote lang="la">agnationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:10:11" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 10, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si plures eodem gradu sint agnati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ulp.</author> Fragm. 26, 5</bibl></cit>: cognati ex transverso gradu usque ad quartum gradum, i. e. <hi rend="ital">collateral kindred</hi> (opp. parentes et liberi), <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gradus plures sunt societatis hominum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 17, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peccatorum gradus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 74, § 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratorum aetates et gradus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 32, 122</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">gradus et dissimilitudines Atticorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 82, 285</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accendendi judicis plures sunt gradus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:166" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 166</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:4:67" default="NO">6, 4, 67</bibl>: nec gradus est ultra Fabios cognominis ullus; <cit><quote lang="la">Illa domus meritis Maxima dicta suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:605" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 605</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ita esset, quid opus erat te gradatim istuc pervenire? . . . A beatis ad virtutem, a virtute ad rationem video te venisse gradibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:32:89" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 32, 89</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes gradus virtutis implere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 14, 18</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">hi plerumque gradus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:46" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 46</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
graea: <entryFree id="n19802" type="main" key="Graea"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Graea</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*grai=a</foreign>, <sense id="n19802.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ancient town in Bœotia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near</hi> Oropus (mentioned by Hom. Il. 2, 498), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:332" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 332</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
graeae: <entryFree id="n19803" type="main" key="Graeae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Graeae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*grai=ai</foreign> (old women), <sense id="n19803.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">daughters of Phorcus</hi> (hence Phorcydes) <hi rend="ital">and Ceto</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sisters and guardians of the Gorgons</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gray-haired from their birth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">having<pb n="822" /> <cb n="GRAE" />  but one eye and one tooth among them</hi>, Hyg. praef. p. 7 Munck.</sense></entryFree>
graecalis: <entryFree id="n19804" type="main" key="Graeca_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Graecālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, v. Graeci, II. F.</entryFree>
graecanice: <entryFree id="n19805" type="main" key="Graeca_ni^ce"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Graecānĭce</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. Graecanicus, under Graeci, II. C. <sense id="n19805.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
graecanicus: <entryFree id="n19806" type="main" key="Graeca_ni^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Graecānĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Graeci, II. C.</entryFree>
graecatim: <entryFree id="n19807" type="main" key="Graeca_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Graecātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. Graeci <sense id="n19807.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> 2.</sense></entryFree>
graecatus: <entryFree id="n19808" type="main" key="Graeca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Graecātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from Graecor.</entryFree>
graece: <entryFree id="n19809" type="main" key="Graece"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Graece</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. Graeci, II. A. <sense id="n19809.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> 1.</sense></entryFree>
graeci: <entryFree id="n19810" type="main" key="Graeci"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Graeci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*graikoi/</foreign>, <sense id="n19810.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Grecians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Greeks</hi>: contendunt Graecos, Graios memorare solent sos, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=301" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 301</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 358 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">eos septem, quos Graeci sapientes nominaverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud Graecos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 27, 64</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia Graecorum sunt antiquissima quaeque Scripta vel optima, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 28</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Graecus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a Greek</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">processit ille, et Graecus apud Graecos non de culpa sua dixit, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignobilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graecus Graecaque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 2, 3, § 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19810.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n19810.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Grae-cus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Greeks</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Greek</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Grecian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plus te operae Graecis dedisse rebus video ... deinde nullam Graecarum rerum significationem daret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:36:152 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 36, 152 sq.</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">litterae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:20:78" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 20, 78</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">neutr. absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graeca leguntur in omnibus fere gentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:10:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 10, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lingua (opp. Latina),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:3:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludi,</quote> <trans><tr>founded on Greek subjects</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 1, 3</bibl></cit> (opp. Osci); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 5, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines,</quote> <trans><tr>Grecian people</tr>, <tr>Greeks</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:29:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 29, 80</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:27:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 27, 65</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">testis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">more bibere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to drink healths</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:26:section=66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 26, § 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graeca fide mercari,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>without credit</tr>, <tr>with ready money</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 3, 47</bibl></cit>: nux, i. e. <hi rend="ital">an almond</hi>, Cloat. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 44</bibl>: pantherae, <hi rend="ital">from Asiatic Greece</hi>, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 6, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rosa,</quote> <trans><tr>a kind of rose</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 4, 10, § 18</bibl></cit>: ovis, perh. <hi rend="ital">Tarentine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 1, 27</bibl>: via, perh. <hi rend="ital">to Magna Graecia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 1, 3</bibl>.—Prov.: ad Calendas Graecas, i. q. our <hi rend="ital">next day after never</hi> (since the Greeks had no Calends), August. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:87" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 87</bibl>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Graecum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Greek language</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Greek</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">Graeco melius usuri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">librum e Graeco in Latinum convertere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:24:87" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 24, 87</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi> in two forms, </sense><sense id="n19810.3" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Graece</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in the Greek language</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Greek</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ea, quae legeram Graece, Latine redderem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:34:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 34, 155</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Acilius qui Graece scripsit historiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:32:115" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 32, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:8:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 8, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">optime scire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:66:265" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 66, 265</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">nescire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">licet legatum Graece scriptum non valeat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ulp.</author> Fragm. 25, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia Graece,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:188" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 188</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19810.4" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Graecātim</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in the Greek</hi> manner: <cit><quote lang="la">amiciri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19810.5" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Graecĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the country of the Greeks</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Greece</hi>: ad Trojam cum misi ob defendendam Graeciam, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:13:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 13, 28</bibl> (Trag. v. 362 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">quod de Corintho dixi, id haud scio an liceat de cuncta Graecia verissime dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:4:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 4, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:15:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 15, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graecia capta ferum victorem cepit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 156</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:340" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 340</bibl></cit>.—In apposition: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; M. Aur. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:Ep. 2:9" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author> Ep. 2, 9</bibl> Mai.—</sense><sense id="n19810.6" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Magna Graecia</orth>, <hi rend="ital">Lower Italy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inhabited by Greeks</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 10, 15, § 95</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:42" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 5, 6, § 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:37:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 37, 154</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 34, 139</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:4:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 4, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:16:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 16, 38</bibl>; called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mājor Graecia</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 7, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Helv. 6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Helv. 6 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:21" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 21</bibl>; whereas by a Greek proper it is called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Parva Graecia</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:6:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 6, 55</bibl>; and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graecia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 5, 10</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: Major Graecia, in gen., for <hi rend="ital">Italy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Itala nam tellus Graecia major erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:64" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 64</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19810.7" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Grae-cānĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Greek origin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the Greek manner</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fashion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Grecian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Greek</hi> (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): alia (verba) Graeca, alia Graecanica,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>words borrowed from the Greeks</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 10:section=70" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 10, § 70</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">torcula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:317" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 31, 74, § 317</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pavimentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 25, 63, § 188</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">color,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 9, 20, § 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">toga, i. e. pallium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 4</bibl></cit>: milites, <hi rend="ital">living in the Greek manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">voluptuously</hi>, Vulc. Av<bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cass. 5</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Graē-cānĭce</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in Greek</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=89" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 89</bibl></cit> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n19810.8" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Graecŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Grecian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Greek</hi> (mostly in a depreciating, contemptuous sense): ineptum <cb n="GRAI" /> sane negotium et Graeculum, <hi rend="ital">thorough Greek</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:35:86" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 35, 86</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">motus quidam temerarius Graeculae contionis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 10, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cautio chirographi,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>not to be relied upon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 18, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:11:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 11, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:7:9" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 7, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitas Massilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 2, 24</bibl></cit> Duk.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: </sense><sense id="n19810.9" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Graecŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> </sense><sense id="n19810.10" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">A paltry Greek</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:22:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 22, 102</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:29:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 29, 70</bibl>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">Graeculus esuriens in caelum, jusseris, ibit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:78" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 78</bibl></cit>.—In the form <orth extent="full" lang="la">Graecŭlĭo</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 76 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n19810.11" n="(b)" level="5"> Post-Aug., without any odious accessory notion, for Graecus: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:24" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mala,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 14, 15, § 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 4, 10, § 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19810.12" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Graecŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a Greekling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a weak imitator of Greek women</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:186" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 186</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19810.13" n="E" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Graecĭen-sis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Grecian</hi> (post-Aug. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 21, 18, § 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scimpodium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:10:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 10, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19810.14" n="F" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Graecālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Grecian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Greek</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">lapides,</quote> <trans><tr>inscribed with Greek letters</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:de Col. p. 116" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> de Col. p. 116</bibl></cit> Goes.</sense></entryFree>
graecia: <entryFree id="n19811" type="main" key="Graecia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Graecia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. Graeci, II. B.</entryFree>
graecigena: <entryFree id="n19812" type="main" key="Graeci^ge^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Graecĭgĕna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Graecus-gigno; cf. Grajugena</etym>, <sense id="n19812.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Greek by birth</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Civ. D. 18:18" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Civ. D. 18, 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
graecisso: <entryFree id="n19813" type="greek" key="graecisso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">graecisso</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-izo</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*graiki/zw</foreign>, <sense id="n19813.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to imitate the Greeks</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to adopt a Grecian manner</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tone</hi>: atque adeo hoc argumentum graecissat; tamen Non atticissat; <cit><quote lang="la">verum sicelissat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:prol. 7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. prol. 7</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. Ritschl ad h. l.: graecizat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Consent.</author> 1063</bibl></cit> P.</sense></entryFree>
graecitas: <entryFree id="n19814" type="main" key="Graeci^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Graecĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Graecus</etym>, <sense id="n19814.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Greek</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Greek language</hi> (post-class.): facundia Graecitatis, Cod. Th. 14, 9, 3.</sense></entryFree>
graecor: <entryFree id="n19815" type="main" key="graecor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">graecor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n19815.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> [Graeci], <hi rend="ital">to imitate the Greeks</hi>, <hi rend="ital">live in the Greek manner</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si Romana fatigat Militia assuetum Graecari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: congraecor, pergraecor.—Hence, * <orth extent="full" lang="la">graecātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">made</hi> or <hi rend="ital">composed in the Greek manner</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">graecatior epistola,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p.329</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">graecāti</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">imitators of the Grecian mode of life</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
graecostadium: <entryFree id="n19816" type="main" key="Graecosta^di^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Graecostădĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, perh. i. q. Graecostasis: <sense id="n19816.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">restitutum post incendium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Anton. 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
graecostasis: <entryFree id="n19817" type="greek" key="Graecosta^sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Graecostăsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*graiko/stasis</foreign> (Greek station or place), <sense id="n19817.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a building in Rome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near the Curia and Comitium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">where at first Grecian and afterwards other foreign ambassadors took up their abode</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=155" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 155</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 60, 60, § 212</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:19 al" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 1, 6, § 19 al.</bibl>; cf. Becker's Antiq. I. p. 284.</sense></entryFree>
graeculio: <entryFree id="n19818" type="main" key="Graecu^li^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Graecŭlĭo</orth>, v. Graeculus, under Graeci, II. D.</entryFree>
graeculus: <entryFree id="n19819" type="main" key="Graecu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Graecŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Graeci, II. D.</entryFree>
graecus: <entryFree id="n19820" type="main" key="Graecus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Graecus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Graeci, II. A.</entryFree>
<entryFree id="n19821" type="main" key="Graecus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Graecus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. Graeci, I.</entryFree>
graii: <entryFree id="n19822" type="main" key="Gra_ii"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Grāii</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Grāi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype> (<sense id="n19822.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> Graium, Enn. ap. Prob. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:600" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 600</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:405" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 405</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:754" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 754</bibl> et saep.), <gen>m.</gen>, a less freq. and mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> form for Graeci, <hi rend="ital">the Grecians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Greeks</hi>: Musas quas Grai memorant, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=26" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 26</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 2 Vahl.): cujus ob os Grai ora obvertebant sua, Poët. (perh. Enn.) ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:18:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 18, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pergama circum Hac fugerent Grai,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:467" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 467</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est locus, Hesperiam Grai cognomine dicunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 530</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 100</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graiorum obscura reperta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fas mihi Graiorum sacrata resolvere jura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de tot Graiorum millibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:241" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 241</bibl></cit>.—In prose: <cit><quote lang="la">si ut Graeci dicunt, omnes aut Graios esse aut barbaros, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 9, 15</bibl>; 6, 16; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:23:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 23, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:21:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 21, 53</bibl>.—In <number>sing.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Grāius</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a Greek</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:594" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 594</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:36:91" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 36, 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:24:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 24, 35</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19822.1" n="II" level="1"> Deriv.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Grāius</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Greeks</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Grecian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Greek</hi>: navus repertus homo, Graio patre, Graius homo, rex, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=169" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 169</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 183); so, <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:720" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 720</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:295" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 295</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 97</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jubae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 412</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 210</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Camena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:16:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 16, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alpes,</quote> <trans><tr>the Grecian Alps</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 20, 24, § 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alpium fores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 17, 21, § 123</bibl></cit>; v. Alpes; <cit><quote lang="la">also called saltus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 3, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
graioceli: <entryFree id="n19823" type="main" key="Gra_ioce^li"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Grāiocĕli</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n19823.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Gallic tribe in the valleys of Mont Cenis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 10, 4</bibl> (others read Garoceli). <cb n="GRAM" /></sense></entryFree>
grajugena: <entryFree id="n19824" type="main" key="Gra_ju^ge^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Grājŭgĕna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Graius-gigno; cf. Graecigena</etym>, <sense id="n19824.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Grecian by birth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a Greek</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): Grajugena, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:36:91" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 36, 91</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equus Grajugenarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:477" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 477</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Grajugenūmque domos suspectaque linquimus arva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:550" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 550</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Grajugenae reges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:215" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 215</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
graius: <entryFree id="n19825" type="main" key="Gra_ius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Grāius</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Graii, II.</entryFree>
