grallae: <entryFree id="n19826" type="main" key="grallae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grallae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>contr. from an obsolete <lbl>dim.</lbl>, gradula, from gradus; cf. rallum, from rado</etym>, <sense id="n19826.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">stilts</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 115, 21 sq.</bibl>; cf. the foll. art.</sense></entryFree>
grallator: <entryFree id="n19827" type="main" key="gralla_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grallātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>grallae</etym>, <sense id="n19827.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who goes</hi> or <hi rend="ital">runs on stilts</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 1, 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 88</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=69" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 69</bibl> Müll.; id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 115, 21</bibl>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=97" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 97</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
gramen: <entryFree id="n19828" type="main" key="gra_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. root gar-, to swallow; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">bor</foreign>- in <foreign lang="greek">bibrw/skw, bora/</foreign>; Lat. -vorus, in carnivorus, vorare, etc.; hence, fuller root gras-; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">gra/stis</foreign>; Lat. grāmen for gras-men; cf. Germ. Gras; Engl. grass</etym>, <sense id="n19828.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">grass</hi> (cf.: herba, faenum, cespes, glaeba). </sense><sense id="n19828.1" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">prostrati in gramine molli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1392" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 1392</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:24" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cervus graminis immemor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:15:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 15, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aprici campi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 162</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">graminis herba,</quote> <trans><tr>a blade of grass</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 5, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:24:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 24, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">floreum,</quote> <trans><tr>flowery turf</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:91:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 91, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">generosum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:40" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quocumque de gramine (equus),</quote> <trans><tr>pasture</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 60</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19828.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tondere gramina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:660" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 660</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 1, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 10, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 56</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 200</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n19828.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">herb.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19828.4" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">ignobile cerinthae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Indum,</quote> <trans><tr>Indian aromatic herbs</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:1:187" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 1, 187</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Arabum de gramine odores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:29" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 29</bibl></cit> (3, 27), 17; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:8:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 8, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non illa feris incognita capris Gramina (i. e. dictamnus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:415" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 415</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neve parum valeant a se data gramina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 137</bibl></cit> (for which: <cit><quote lang="la">accepit cantatas herbas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:98" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 98</bibl></cit>).—</sense><sense id="n19828.5" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">dog's-grass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">couch-grass</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:178 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 19, 118, § 178 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
gramiae: <entryFree id="n19829" type="main" key="gra_mi^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grāmĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>from <foreign lang="greek">gla/mh</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n19829.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a viscous humor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rheum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that collects in the corners of the eyes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 13, 96, § 155</bibl>; cf.: gramiae oculorum sunt vitia, quas alii glamas vocant, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=96" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 96</bibl> Müll. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 119, 18</bibl>, and v. gramiosus.</sense></entryFree>
gramineus: <entryFree id="n19830" type="main" key="gra_mi^ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grāmĭnĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>gramen</etym>, <sense id="n19830.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of grass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">covered with grass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grassy.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19830.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">campus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:287" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 287</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palaestrae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 642</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedile,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 176</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 119</bibl></cit>: corona obsidionalis, <hi rend="ital">a grass crown presented by those who were delivered from a siege to their deliverer</hi>, among the Romans the highest mark of military honor, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:37:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 37, 2</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 3, 4, § 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:6:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 6, 8</bibl>; cf. Dict. of Antiq. p. 309.—</sense><sense id="n19830.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">of Indian reed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bamboo</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hasta (Minervae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:56:section=125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 56, § 125</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
graminosus: <entryFree id="n19831" type="main" key="gra_mi^no_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grāmĭnōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n19831.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of grass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grassy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1 praef" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1 praef.</bibl></cit> § 25; <cit><quote lang="la">7, 9, 8: solum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6 praef" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6 praef.</bibl></cit> § 1.</sense></entryFree>
gramiosus: <entryFree id="n19832" type="hapax" key="gra_mi^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grāmĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>gramiae</etym>, <sense id="n19832.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of matter</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gramiae pituitae oculorum. Caecilius: Gramiosis oculis ipsa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 119, 19</bibl></cit> (Com. Fragm. v. 268 Rib.); v. gramiae.</sense></entryFree>
gramma: <entryFree id="n19833" type="greek" key="gramma1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gramma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">grammh/</foreign>, <sense id="n19833.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a line in writing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a stroke of the pen</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 108</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n19834" type="greek" key="gramma2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gramma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">gra/mma</foreign>, <sense id="n19834.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a weight of two</hi> oboli, Fann. de Pond. 8; 25.</sense></entryFree>
grammateus: <entryFree id="n19835" type="greek" key="gramma^teus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grammăteus</orth>, <itype>ĕos</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">grammateu/s</foreign>, <sense id="n19835.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a scribe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">secretary</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">unus, quem cuncti grammatea dicebant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. p. 265, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
grammatias: <entryFree id="n19836" type="greek" key="gramma^ti^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grammătĭas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">grammati/as</foreign>, <sense id="n19836.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">jasper striped with white lines</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 9, 37, § 118</bibl> (dub.; Jan. monogrammos).</sense></entryFree>
grammatica: <entryFree id="n19837" type="main" key="gramma^ti^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grammătĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. 1. grammaticus, II. B.</entryFree>
grammaticalis: <entryFree id="n19838" type="main" key="gramma^ti^ca_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grammătĭcālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>grammatica</etym>, <sense id="n19838.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">perlaining to grammar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grammatical</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">figurae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 7, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palaestra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Carm. 23, 212</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">grammătĭ-cālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">grammatically</hi>: declinare, Treb. XXX. Tyr. 10, § 5.</sense></entryFree>
grammatice: <entryFree id="n19839" type="main" key="gramma^ti^ce1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grammătĭce</orth>, ës, v. 1. grammaticus, II. B.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n19840" type="main" key="gramma^ti^ce_2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grammătĭcē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 1. grammaticus <sense id="n19840.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
grammaticomastix: <entryFree id="n19841" type="greek" key="gramma^ti^co^mastix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grammătĭcŏmastix</orth>, <itype>īgis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">grammatikoma/stic</foreign>, <sense id="n19841.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a scourge</hi> (i. e. reviler, <pb n="823" /> <cb n="GRAN" /> persecutor) <hi rend="ital">of grammarians</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 12</bibl> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.</hi></sense></entryFree>
grammaticus: <entryFree id="n19842" type="greek" key="gramma^ti^cus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grammătĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">grammatiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n19842.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to grammar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grammatical</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ars,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 12, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:54" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">possis illud grammaticum, hoc rhetoricum magis dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grammaticas ambire tribus et pulpita,</quote> <trans><tr>the tribes of the grammarians</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum eundem (Tuditanum) de rebus grammaticis scripsisse constet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=36" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 36</bibl></cit> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n19842.1" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n19842.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">grammătĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a grammarian</hi> in the more extended sense of the word, <hi rend="ital">a philologist</hi>: appellatio grammaticorum Graeca consuetudine invaluit: sed initio litterati vocabantur. Cornelius quoque Nepos litteratos vulgo appellari ait eos, qui aliquid diligenter et acute scienterque possint aut dicere aut scribere: ceterum proprie sic appellandos poëtarum interpretes, qui a Graecis <foreign lang="greek">grammatikoi</foreign> nominentur ... Veteres grammatici et rhetoricam docebant, etc., <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gramm. 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut si grammaticum se professus quispiam barbare loquatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:4:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 4, 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">grammatici custodes Latini sermonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 95" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 95 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grammatici poëtarum explanatores sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:51:116" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 51, 116</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 3, 10</bibl>: hanc <foreign lang="greek">u(pallagh\n</foreign> rhetores, <foreign lang="greek">metwnumi/an</foreign> grammatici vocant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:27:93" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 27, 93</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:53" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:8:21" default="NO">1, 8, 21</bibl>; cf. in the foll. the passage <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:1:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 1, 4</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:42:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 42, 187</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Ateius) inter grammaticos rhetor, inter rhetores grammaticus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gramm. 10</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">grammatici certant,</quote> <trans><tr>doctors disagree</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 78</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19842.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">grammătĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">gram-mătĭce</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype> (the first form in Cicero and Suet., the latter in Quint.), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">grammatikh/</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">grammar</hi> in the wider sense of the term, <hi rend="ital">philology</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamquam ea verba, quibus instituto veterum utimur pro Latinis, ut ipsa philosophia, ut rhetorica, dialectica, grammatica, geometria, musica, quamquam Latine ea dici poterant, tamen, quoniam usu percepta sunt, nostra ducamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:2:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:42:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 42, 187</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">et grammatice (quam in Latinum transferentes litteraturam vocaverunt) fines suos norit, praesertim tantum ab hac appellationis suae paupertate, intra quam primi illi constitere, provecta: nam tenuis a fonte, assumptis poëtarum historicorumque viribus, pleno jam satis alveo fluit, cum praeter rationem recte loquendi non parum alioqui copiosam prope omnium maximarum artium scientiam amplexa sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:1:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 1, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:14:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 14, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">grammatica,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gramm. 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3</bibl>; 6; 8; <cit><quote lang="la">24 et saep.: grammatice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:2 sq" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 2 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:1" default="NO">1, 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:8:12" default="NO">1, 8, 12</bibl>; 1, 10, 17 et saep.— </sense><sense id="n19842.4" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">grammătĭca</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">grammar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">philology</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in grammaticis poëtarum pertractatio, historiarum cognitio, verborum interpretatio, pronuntiandi quidam sonus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:42:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 42, 187</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">grammă-tĭce</orth>, <hi rend="ital">according to the rules of grammar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grammatically</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi non invenuste dici videtur, aliud esse Latine, aliud grammatice loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n19843" type="main" key="gramma^ti^cus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grammătĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. 1. grammaticus, II. A.</entryFree>
grammatista: <entryFree id="n19844" type="greek" key="gramma^tista"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grammătista</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">grammatisth/s</foreign>, <sense id="n19844.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a teacher of grammar</hi> or <hi rend="ital">of languages</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt qui litteratum a litteratore distinguant, ut Graeci grammaticum a grammatista: et illum quidem absolute, hunc mediocriter doctum existiment,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gramm. 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 3, § 229</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
grammatodidascalus: <entryFree id="n19845" type="greek" key="gramma^to^di^dasca^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grammătŏdĭdascălus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">grammatodida/skalos</foreign>, i. q. grammatista, <sense id="n19845.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a teacher of language</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 3, § 229</bibl> (as Greek, Kopp).</sense></entryFree>
grammatophylacium: <entryFree id="n19846" type="greek" key="gramma^to^phy^la^ci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grammătŏphylăcĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">grammatofula/kion</foreign>, <sense id="n19846.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place for keeping state papers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">archives</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:19:9:section=6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 19, 9, § 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
grammicus: <entryFree id="n19847" type="main" key="grammi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grammĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">grammiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n19847.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to</hi> (geometrical) <hi rend="ital">lines</hi>, <hi rend="ital">geometrical</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deformationes,</quote> <trans><tr>draughts</tr>, <tr>sketches</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3 praef.</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
grampiusmons: <entryFree id="n19848" type="main" key="Grampius mons"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Grampius mons</orth>, v. Graupius.</entryFree>
granarium: <entryFree id="n19849" type="main" key="gra_na_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grānārĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>granum</etym>, <sense id="n19849.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place where corn is kept</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a granary</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=105" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 105</bibl> Müll.; but usually in <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">grā-nārĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, in the same sense (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">herreum, sirus, cumera): triticum condi oportet in granaria sublimia, quae perflentur vento, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:57:1 sq" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 57, 1 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 6, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:302" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 30, 73, § 302</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 19</bibl>; <cb n="GRAN" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:6:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 6, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:26:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 26, 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:110 al" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 110 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
granatim: <entryFree id="n19850" type="main" key="gra_na_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grānātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>granum</etym>, <sense id="n19850.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">grain by grain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by single grains</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">digerere acervum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 177, 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
granatum: <entryFree id="n19851" type="main" key="gra_na_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grānātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. granatus.</entryFree>
granatus: <entryFree id="n19852" type="main" key="gra_na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grānātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>granum</etym>, <sense id="n19852.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having many grains</hi> or <hi rend="ital">seeds</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mala, quae Punica vocantur,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a pomegranate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:42:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 42, 1</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">grānātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a pomegranate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">granata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:46:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 46, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 28, 34, § 115</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:149" default="NO" valid="yes">20, 14, 53, § 149</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
grandaevitas: <entryFree id="n19853" type="main" key="grandaevi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grandaevĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>grandaevus</etym>, <sense id="n19853.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">great age</hi>, <hi rend="ital">longevity</hi> (ante-class.), Pac. and Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 116, 12 sq.</bibl> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0116,001:Fragm. Trag. v. 162" default="NO"><author>Pac.</author> Fragm. Trag. v. 162</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:Fragm. Trag. v. 68:245" default="NO"><author>Att.</author> Fragm. Trag. v. 68, 245</bibl> Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
grandaevus: <entryFree id="n19854" type="main" key="grandaevus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grandaevus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>grandisaevum</etym>, <sense id="n19854.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in years</hi>, <hi rend="ital">old</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aged</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">Nereus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:392" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 392</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alethes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Emathion,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pater,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:519" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 519</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:160" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Senate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:653" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 653</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alios (deos) esse grandaevos semperque canos, alios juvenes atque pueros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 7, 5, § 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 178</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilia,</quote> <trans><tr>of an aged man</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:348" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 348</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
grande: <entryFree id="n19855" type="main" key="grande_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grandē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. grandis, <sense id="n19855.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> B.</sense></entryFree>
grandesco: <entryFree id="n19856" type="main" key="grandesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grandesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n19856.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [grandis], <hi rend="ital">to become great</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to grow</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">quicque sua de materia grandescere alique (preceded by crescere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 191</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 1122</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1160" default="NO" valid="yes">1160</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lentiscus triplici solita grandescere fetu, Cic. poët. Div. 1, 9, 15: grandescunt frumenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:20:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 20, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hordeum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Jun. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lignum intus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 3, 3, § 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
grandiculus: <entryFree id="n19857" type="main" key="grandi^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grandĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n19857.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">rather large</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of moderate size</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">globi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 2, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 5, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
grandifer: <entryFree id="n19858" type="main" key="grandi^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grandĭfer</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>grandisfero</etym>, <sense id="n19858.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bearing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">producing great things</hi>, <hi rend="ital">productive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hae arationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:39:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 39, 101</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 5, § 511</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">loci facies palmis arboribus grandifera, Auct. Itin. Alex. 20, 51: facta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Nazar.</author> Paneg. Const. 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
grandificus: <entryFree id="n19859" type="main" key="grandi^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grandĭfĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>grandis-facio</etym>, <sense id="n19859.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">acting greatly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nobly</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">mens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 18, 6, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
grandiloquus: <entryFree id="n19860" type="main" key="grandi^lo^quus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grandĭlŏquus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>grandis-loquor</etym>, <sense id="n19860.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">speaking grandly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">loftily</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et grandiloqui, ut ita dicam, fuerunt cum ampla et sententiarum gravitate et majestate verborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:5:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 5, 20</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:66" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 66</bibl>: stilus, Serv. Verg. Vit.—In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">grandiloquent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">isti grandiloqui (i. e. Stoici),</quote> <trans><tr>boasters</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:31:89" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 31, 89</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
grandineus: <entryFree id="n19861" type="main" key="grandi^ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grandĭnĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>grando</etym>, <sense id="n19861.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of hail</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">nimbi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Alcim.</author> 3, 329</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 190</bibl></cit>; cf. the foll. art.</sense></entryFree>
grandino: <entryFree id="n19862" type="main" key="grandi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grandĭno</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <sense id="n19862.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. impers.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to hail.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19862.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quare hieme ningat, non grandinet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 4:4:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 4, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Vir. Ill. 73:7" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Vir. Ill. 73, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19862.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: sagittis, plumbo et saxis grandinat, nivit, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 507, 28</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19862.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To hail upon</hi>: vinea grandinata est, August. ap. Psa. 49.</sense></entryFree>
grandinosus: <entryFree id="n19863" type="main" key="grandi^no_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grandĭnōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n19863.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of hail</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">qualitas caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:1:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 1, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
grandio: <entryFree id="n19864" type="main" key="grandi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grandĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>grandis</etym> (ante-class.). <sense id="n19864.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make great</hi>, <hi rend="ital">increase</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enlarge</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">grandire est grandem facere, Varr. Rer. Divin. Lib. I.: cum aut humus semina concipere non possit, aut recepta non reddat, aut edita grandire nequeat, Plaut. Aul. (1, 1, 10): Testudineum istum tibi ego grandibo gradum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 115, 1 sq.</bibl></cit>—Mid.: nec grandiri frugum fetum posse, nec mitescere, <hi rend="ital">to become great</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to grow</hi> (cf. grandesco), Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 115, 11</bibl> (Fragm. Trag. v. 142 Rib.).—</sense><sense id="n19864.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become great</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to grow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mars pater, te precor, uti tu fruges, frumenta, vineta virgultaque grandire beneque evenire sinas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 141, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
grandis: <entryFree id="n19865" type="main" key="grandis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grandis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cf. gradus; also Germ. gross; Engl. great</etym>, <sense id="n19865.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full-grown</hi>, <hi rend="ital">large</hi>, <hi rend="ital">great</hi>, <hi rend="ital">full</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abundant</hi> (class.; most freq. of things; for syn. cf.: magnus, ingens, amplus, procerus, vastus, enormis). </sense><sense id="n19865.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n19865.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">ita, quicquid (olerum) erat, grande erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:5:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 5, 2, 35</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ager novatus et iteratus, quo meliores fetus possit et grandiores edere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:30:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 30, 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae seges grandissima atque optima fuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:52" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:1" default="NO">1</bibl>: farra, old <usg type="style">poet.</usg> ap. <cb n="GRAN" /> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 5, 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:405" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 405</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hordea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 5, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lilia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ilex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 93:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 93, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">et antiqua robora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:88" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grandissimum alicae genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 11, 29, § 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grandissimae olivae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 15, 3, 4, § 15</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae (opp. minutae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 68</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">epistola sane grandis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 21, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sane grandes libri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grandiores libri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbosa et grandis epistula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:71" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erat incisum grandibus litteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:34:section=74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 34, § 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:303" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 303</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:289" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 289</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 23, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 46, 3</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cervi eminentes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 72, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumulus terrenus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 43, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:21:section=47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 21, § 47</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">patella,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> § <cit><quote lang="la">46: speculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:68" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cothurni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:545" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 545</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">membra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:237" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 237</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ossa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:169" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conchae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:48:123" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 48, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rhombi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 95</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">opes grandiores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 16, 16, § 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">smaragdi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divitiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 1118</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui grandem pecuniam credere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecunia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 9, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 49:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 49, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:46:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 46, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:20:7" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 20, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:40:9" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 40, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 24</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">faenus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 21, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aes alienum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 14, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:24:3" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 38, 39, § 127</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: donativum grandius solito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:58" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 58</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">convivium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amiculum grandi pondere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:34:83" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 34, 83</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">grande pondus argenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grande onus exiguo formicas ore gerentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:625" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 625</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">elementa,</quote> <trans><tr>bulky</tr>, <tr>massive</tr>, <tr>heavy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 29</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi> as grandia ingrediens, <hi rend="ital">advancing with great strides</hi>: <foreign lang="greek">makra\ biba/s</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:11:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 11, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">grandia incedens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19865.3" n="B" level="2"> Of persons, <hi rend="ital">grown up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">big</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tall;</hi> and more freq. pregn., <hi rend="ital">advanced in years</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aged</hi>, <hi rend="ital">old;</hi> also with natu or aevo. </sense><sense id="n19865.4" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">an sedere oportuit domi virginem tam grandem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:5:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 5, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">videras grandis jam puer bello Italico, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:36:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 36, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobilis ut grandi cecinit Centaurus alumno (i. e. Achilli),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:13:11" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 13, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Q. Maximus) et bella gerebat ut adolescens, cum plane grandis esset, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 4, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1164</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">legibus annalibus cum grandiorem aetatem ad consulatum constituebant, adolescentiae temeritatem verebantur, etc. (shortly after: progressus aetatis),</quote> <trans><tr>a more advanced age</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:17:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 17, 47</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">grandior aetas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 665</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quandoquidem grandi cibus aevo denique defit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">metuens virgae jam grandis Achilles cantabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:210" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 210</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19865.5" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">natu</hi> or <hi rend="ital">aevo</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non admodum grandis natu, sed tamen jam aetate provectus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 4, 10</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">grandis natu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:49:section=128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 49, § 128</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:15:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 15, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:23:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 23, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:89" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 89</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 49</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in aetate consideratur puer an adolescens, natu grandior an senex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:24:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 24, 35</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">grandior natu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 1, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grandi jam natu vexatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:53" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grandis aevo parens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">jam grandior aevo genitor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:321" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 321</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19865.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n19865.7" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">great</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">powerful</hi>: subsellia grandiorem et pleniorem vocem desiderant. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:84:289" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 84, 289</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox (opp. exigua),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perspicuo et grandi vitio praeditum exemplum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:47:88" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 47, 88</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">exemplis grandioribus uti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:20:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 20, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de rebus grandioribus dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:5:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supercilium,</quote> <trans><tr>lofty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:169" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Maecenas, mearum Grande decus columenque rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:17:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 17, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:574" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 574</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:20:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 20, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praemia meritorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:636" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 636</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lethargus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alumnus,</quote> <trans><tr>noble</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:13:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 13, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si metit Orcus Grandia cum parvis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 179</bibl></cit>; so <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">grandia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 6, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 27</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19865.8" n="B" level="2"> In partic., of style, <hi rend="ital">great</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lofty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sublime</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus quoque dicendi grandius quoddam et illustrius esse adhibendum videtur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:82:337" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 82, 337</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grande atque robustum genus dicendi (opp. subtile),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:58" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causae (opp. pusillae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:151" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antiqua comoedia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grandia et tumida themata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:10:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 10, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:11:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grandia elate, jucunda dulciter, moderata leniter canit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 10, 24</bibl></cit>.—Of the speaker: (oratores Thucydidi aequales) grandes erant verbis, crebri sententiis, compressione rerum breves,<pb n="824" /> <cb n="GRAN" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:7:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 7, 29</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Thucydides rerum gestarum pronunciator sincerus et grandis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 83, 287</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causidicus amplus atque grandis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:9:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 9, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo grandior sit et quasi excelsior orator,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 34, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratores, alii grandes aut graves aut copiosi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Opt. Gen. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multis locis grandior (Lysias),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fiunt pro grandibus tumidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 2, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:77" default="NO">10, 1, 77</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: in two forms. </sense><sense id="n19865.9" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">grandĭter</orth> (acc. to II.), <hi rend="ital">greatly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strongly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">quamvis grandius ille (Alcaeus) sonet,</quote> <trans><tr>sublimely</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud mihi inter maxima granditer cordi est,</quote> <trans><tr>exceedingly</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frugi pater,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">affectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 1:9" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 1, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19865.10" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">grandō</orth> (rare and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>), the same: <cit><quote lang="la">grande fremens,</quote> <trans><tr>strongly</tr>, <tr>aloud</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:684" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 684</bibl></cit>: grande sonat. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:517" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 517</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
grandiscapius: <entryFree id="n19866" type="hapax" key="grandisca_pi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grandiscāpĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>grandis-scapus</etym>, <sense id="n19866.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having a large stem</hi> or <hi rend="ital">trunk</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores, ut ita dicam, grandiscapiae (shortly before: magnarum arborum truncos cum scapo suo transferri),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 86:19" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 86, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
grandisonus: <entryFree id="n19867" type="main" key="grandi^so^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grandĭsŏnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>grandissonus</etym>, <sense id="n19867.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">high-sounding</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">modi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> 1, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
granditas: <entryFree id="n19868" type="main" key="grandi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grandĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>grandis</etym>, <sense id="n19868.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">greatness.</hi> * </sense><sense id="n19868.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of age (acc. to grandis, I. B.): aetatis granditas, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 115, 13</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n19868.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of style (v. grandis, II. B.), <hi rend="ital">grandeur</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sublimity</hi> (very rare): idque apparet ex genere et granditate verborum, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:31:121" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 31, 121</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non illi vis, non granditas, non sublimitas defuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 21, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
granditer: <entryFree id="n19869" type="main" key="grandi^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grandĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. grandis <sense id="n19869.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> A.</sense></entryFree>
grandiusculus: <entryFree id="n19870" type="hapax" key="grandi^uscu_lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grandĭuscūlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n19870.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [grandis, I. B.]. <hi rend="ital">pretty well grown up</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 5, 19</bibl></cit> (dub.; Fleck. grandicula).</sense></entryFree>
grando: <entryFree id="n19871" type="main" key="grando"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grando</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<sense id="n19871.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">masc.</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 208, 11</bibl>) [Sanscr. hrād-uni, storm; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">xa/laza</foreign> for <foreign lang="greek">xalad-ia</foreign>], <hi rend="ital">hail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a hail-storm.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19871.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 2, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:35:86" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 35, 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:37:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 37, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:449" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 449</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 1, 29</bibl> et saep.: nimbus cum saxea grandine subito est exortus ingens, <hi rend="ital">hailstones</hi>, Auct. B. Afr. 47, 1.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrere animos, nimbis, nivibus, grandinibus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:5:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grandines ruunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 38, 38, § 103</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19871.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a shower</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a great quantity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a multitude</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et densa resonant saxorum grandine turres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:38" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspera saxorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:578" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 578</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n19871.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of copious speech: <cit><quote lang="la">qui grandines Ulixei (superat),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 16, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
graneus: <entryFree id="n19872" type="main" key="gra_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grānĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>granum</etym>, <sense id="n19872.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of corn</hi>, only as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">grānĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. puls), <hi rend="ital">a sort of frumenty</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pap made of pounded corn</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 86</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Paralip. 1, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
granicus: <entryFree id="n19873" type="main" key="Gra_ni_cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Grānīcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*gra/nikos</foreign>, <sense id="n19873.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small river in Mysia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which has its source in Mount Ida</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and is famous for the victory of Alexander the Great over the Persians which took place on its banks</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:19:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 19, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 32, 40, § 141</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:763" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 763</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:1:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 1, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
granifer: <entryFree id="n19874" type="hapax" key="gra_ni^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grānĭfer</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>granumfero</etym>, <sense id="n19874.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">grain-bearing</hi>, a <usg type="style">poet.</usg> epithet of ants: <cit><quote lang="la">agmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:638" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 638</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
granius: <entryFree id="n19875" type="main" key="Gra_ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Grānĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n19875.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a Roman</hi> gens: Q. Granius, <hi rend="ital">a praeco</hi>, <hi rend="ital">famous for his puns</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:43:160" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 43, 160</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">46, 172</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:14:33 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 14, 33 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
grannus: <entryFree id="n19876" type="gloss" key="Grannus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Grannus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Ers. and Trel. grian, the sun</etym>, <sense id="n19876.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname of Apollo in several Germanic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Dacian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and Scottish inscriptions</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1997 sq.</bibl> (cf. Grynēus).</sense></entryFree>
granosus: <entryFree id="n19877" type="main" key="gra_no_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grānōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>granum</etym>, <sense id="n19877.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of grains</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">folliculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 31, 105, § 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cortex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 4, 10, § 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
granulum: <entryFree id="n19878" type="main" key="gra_nu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grānŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n19878.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small grain</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Stat. An. 1, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
granum: <entryFree id="n19879" type="main" key="gra_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grānum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>root gar-; Sanscr. ǵaramí, wear away; whence Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ge/rwn, grau=s</foreign>; cf. <foreign lang="greek">gu=ris</foreign>, fine flour</etym>, <sense id="n19879.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a grain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">small kernel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tritici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 4, 1, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:36:78" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 36, 78</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:48:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 48, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:9:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 9, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">uvae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:6:10" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 6, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:12:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 12, 8</bibl> <hi rend="ital">ext.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">turis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 2, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">turea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:410" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 410</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fici,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 15, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 5, 10, § 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">piperis,</quote> <trans><tr>a pepper-corn</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 12, 7, 15, § 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:150" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 8, 78, § 150</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">papaveris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:2:24" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 2, 24</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">salis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 8, 77, § 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cerae mili magnitudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 24, 55, § 116</bibl></cit>: <cb n="GRAS" /> marmoreum, <hi rend="ital">marble granules</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pounded marble</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 3 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
graphiarius: <entryFree id="n19880" type="main" key="gra^phi^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grăphĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>graphium</etym>, <sense id="n19880.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to writing-styles</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">theca,</quote> <trans><tr>a style-case</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 35</bibl></cit>.—Also <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">grăphĭārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:21" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
graphice: <entryFree id="n19881" type="main" key="gra^phi^ce_1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grăphĭcē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. graphicus <sense id="n19881.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n19882" type="main" key="gra^phi^ce2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grăphĭce</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, v. graphicus.</entryFree>
graphicus: <entryFree id="n19883" type="greek" key="gra^phi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grăphĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">grafiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n19883.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to painting</hi> or <hi rend="ital">drawing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">graphic.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19883.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, only <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">grăphĭce</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. ars), like <foreign lang="greek">h( grafikh/</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the art of drawing</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 77</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19883.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n19883.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Picturesque</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fine</hi> (very rare): eminentes expressiones graphicoteram efficient in aspectu delectationem (Gr. compar. <foreign lang="greek">grafikwteran</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19883.4" n="B" level="2"> Of persons, <hi rend="ital">exquisite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elegant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">masterly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">notable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">skilful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">graphicum mortalem Antiphonem!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:1:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 4, 1, 64</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 104</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nugator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 3, 3, 29</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">gră-phĭce</orth>. </sense><sense id="n19883.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Picturesquely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">versibus satis munde atque graphice factis describere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:17:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 17, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:4:1" default="NO">12, 4, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19883.6" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">finely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beautifully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nicely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exactly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">obunctis oculis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 214, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum hanc hospitam crepidula ut graphice decet!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 3, 3, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc ego huic graphice facetus flam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
graphiolum: <entryFree id="n19884" type="hapax" key="gra^phi^o^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grăphĭŏlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>graphium</etym>, <sense id="n19884.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small scion</hi> = surculus, Ven. Carm. 5, 15 <hi rend="ital">in lemm.</hi></sense></entryFree>
graphis: <entryFree id="n19885" type="greek" key="gra^phis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grăphis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis and ĭdos</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">grafi/s</foreign>. <sense id="n19885.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A drawing-pencil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sketching-pen</hi>: pingere collibitum est: graphidem date, Ser. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 516</bibl> P.—</sense><sense id="n19885.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">drawing; a draught</hi>, <hi rend="ital">design</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">architectum oportet graphidos scientiam habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alias multa graphidis vestigia exstant in tabulis ac membranis ejus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 68</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
graphium: <entryFree id="n19886" type="greek" key="gra^phi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grăphĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">grafi/on</foreign> (pure Lat. scriptorium, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 6, 9, 2</bibl>), <sense id="n19886.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a writingstyle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:11:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 11, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:14" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 1, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 38, 73, § 184</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:82" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
grasos: <entryFree id="n19887" type="greek" key="gra_so^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grāsŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">gra=sos</foreign>, <sense id="n19887.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of seaweed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 25, 48, § 135</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
grassatio: <entryFree id="n19888" type="main" key="grassa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grassātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>grassor</etym>, <sense id="n19888.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rioting</hi> (post-Aug. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">nocturnae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 22, 43, § 126</bibl></cit>; cf. the foll. art. and grassatura.</sense></entryFree>
grassator: <entryFree id="n19889" type="main" key="grassa_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grassātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n19889.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A vagabond</hi>, <hi rend="ital">idler</hi>: poëticae artis honos non erat. Si qui in ea re studebat, aut sese ad convivia applicabat, grassator vocabatur, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:2:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 2, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19889.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A disorderly person</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one who goes rioting about</hi> (esp. at night, whether for fun and enjoyment or for robbery), <hi rend="ital">a rioter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a waylayer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">street-robber</hi>, <hi rend="ital">footpad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc modo viator quoque bene vestitus causa grassatori fuisse dicetur, cur ab eo spoliaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:15:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 15, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grassatorum plurimi palam se ferebant succincti ferro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:32" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grassatores et sicarii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:72" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nocturni grassatoris insidiosa violentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:38" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferro subitus grassator agit rem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:305" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 305</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
grassatura: <entryFree id="n19890" type="hapax" key="grassa_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grassātūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n19890.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rioting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">waylaying</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in primis tuendae pacis a grassaturis et latrociniis seditionumque licentia curam habuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:37" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:19:16:section=6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 19, 16, § 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
grassor: <entryFree id="n19891" type="main" key="grassor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grassor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype> (<sense id="n19891.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf. pres.</hi> grassarier, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Ham. 651</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">act. collat.</hi> form grassabamus, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, 7</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [gradior], <hi rend="ital">to go</hi>, <hi rend="ital">go about</hi> (not in Cic. and Cæs.; cf.: gradior, incedo, vado, pergo). </sense><sense id="n19891.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n19891.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (mostly ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">hoc grassari gradu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">siccine hic cum uvida veste grassabimur?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:4:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 1, 4, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 19</bibl>: sine eam pedibus grassari, Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 316, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">recte grassatur via,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0594,001:ib. 5" default="NO"><author>Nov.</author> ib. 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:477" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 477</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">certum'st moriri, quam hunc pati grassari lenonem in me,</quote> <trans><tr>come about me</tr>, <tr>approach me</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 3, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19891.3" n="b" level="4"> Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">(aranĕus) quanta arte celat pedicas scutulato rete grassantes,</quote> <trans><tr>going about</tr>, <tr>moving around</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 24, 28, § 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per omnes nervos articulosque humore pestifero grassante,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 23, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque avaritia solum, sed etiam crudelitas in capta urbe grassata est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:6:6" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 6, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19891.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n19891.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To go loitering</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rioting about</hi> (cf. grassator, I.): se in juventutem grassantem in Subura<cb n="GRAT" />  incidisse, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 13, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">per omnia clandestina grassari scelera latrociniorum, id 42, 18, 1: ubi Caesarem esse qui grassaretur pernotuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 25</bibl></cit>.—Hence, of parasites, i. q. adulari, <hi rend="ital">to pay one's court to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to flatter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fawn upon</hi>: grassari antiqui ponebant pro adulari, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=97" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 97</bibl>
