Müll.— </sense><sense id="n19891.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To go about with thievish designs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to lie in wait</hi>: grassari dicuntur latrones vias obsidentes, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=97" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 97</bibl> Müll. (cf. grassator, II.): <cit><quote lang="la">in umbris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Anthol. Lat.</author> 2, 186, 42 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silurus grassatur, ubicumque est, omne animal appetens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 15, 17, § 45</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n19891.7" n="b" level="4"> With <case>acc.</case>, <hi rend="ital">to fall upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assault</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attack</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">turmas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:571" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 571</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n19891.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n19891.9" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to go</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proceed</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">act</hi> in any manner: saepe hac eadem sum grassatus via, Nov. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 316, 7</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">consimili grassantur via,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0404,001:ib. 9" default="NO"><author>Afran.</author> ib. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi animus ad gloriam virtutis via grassatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grassandum ad clara periclis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:570" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 570</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(assertor) ait, se jure grassari, non vi,</quote> <trans><tr>that he was proceeding</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:44:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 44, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longe alia via grassabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:27:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 27, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilio grassandum, si nihil vires juvarent, ratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:14:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 14, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mutua dissimulatione et iisdem, quibus petebatur, artibus grassatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupidine atque irā, pessimis consultoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 64:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 64, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsequio,</quote> <trans><tr>to act obsequiously</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolo,</quote> <trans><tr>to act cunningly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">assentando multitudini grassari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:23:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 23, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superbe avareque in provincia grassatos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:67" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 67</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19891.10" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to attack</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proceed against; to proceed with violence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">act harshly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rage against.</hi>—Constr.: <hi rend="ital">in aliquid</hi> and <hi rend="ital">in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">adversus aliquem</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">trecenti conjuravimus principes juventutis Romanae, ut in te hac via grassaremur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:12:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 12, 15</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in possessionem agri publici grassari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in externos grassari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:36" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversus omnis aevi hominum genus grassari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 34</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui cum contemptu religionis grassatus etiam adversus deos fuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita bacchantem atque grassantem adoriri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:56" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omni rapinarum genere grassati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diverso vitiorum genere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 14</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">placuit veneno grassari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 15, 60</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ii (sagitarii) dum eminus grassabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 47</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of abstract subjects: accusatorum major in dies et infestior vis sine levamento grassabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut clausis unam intra domum accusatoribus et reis, paucorum potentia grassaretur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicemus de his (malis), quae totis corporibus grassantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 11, 67, § 107</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">haec (vitia) in pueris grassari, illa in adultis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 1, 3, § 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mala vestra, ... alia grassantia extrinsecus, alia in visceribus ipsis ardentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. B. 27:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. B. 27, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rabidorum more luporum Crimina persultant toto grassantia campo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 468</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grassandi in re familiari facultas,</quote> <trans><tr>of wasting</tr>, <tr>plundering</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:10:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 26, 10, 6</bibl></cit>.—Fig.: <cit><quote lang="la">nec ferro grassatur saepius ullum mentis vitium quam cupido, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:174" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 174</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19891.11" n="b" level="4"> With <case>acc.</case> (cf. above, I. B. 2. b.): <cit><quote lang="la">simulque Romam pestilentia grassabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 33:5" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 33, 5</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">P. a.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">grassans</orth>, <itype>ntis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a robber</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thief</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquid Lycurgi villa grassantibus praebuisset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 117, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 209, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sublatis susceptoribus grassantium cupido conquiescit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 3, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gratanter: <entryFree id="n19892" type="main" key="gra_tanter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grātanter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. grator <sense id="n19892.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
gratatorius: <entryFree id="n19893" type="main" key="gra_ta_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grātātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>grator</etym>, <sense id="n19893.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gratulatory</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">apices,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 5, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
grate: <entryFree id="n19894" type="main" key="gra_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. gratus <sense id="n19894.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
grates: <entryFree id="n19895" type="main" key="gra_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grātes</orth> (usually only in the <case>nom.</case> and <sense id="n19895.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">acc. plur.;</hi> in the <case>abl.</case> gratibus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 37</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>gratus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">thanks</hi> rendered (esp. to the gods: gratias agere being the usual form to human beings), <hi rend="ital">thanksgiving</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut Ephesiae Dianae lauta laudes Gratesque agam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diis laudes gratesque agunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:36:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 36, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:48:3" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 48, 3</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">in the following the passages,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 69</bibl></cit> and 12, 37: <cit><quote lang="la">vobis (dis) grates ago atque habeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 5, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grates deis immortalibus agere habereque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:11:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 11, 12</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">23, 12, 7: dis populoque Romano grates agunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:25:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 25, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:39:12" default="NO" valid="yes">45, 39, 12</bibl>: grates tibi ago, summe Sol, vobisque, reliqui caelites, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">grates dis agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 23, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:17:6" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 17, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 41</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: nec esse, qui diis grates agendas censeant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:21:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 21, 9</bibl></cit>: salsipotenti et multipotenti Jovis <pb n="825" /> <cb n="GRAT" /> fratri ... laudes ago et grates gratiasque habeo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudes et grates reversis legionibus habens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 69</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Agrippinam iisdem quibus principem laudibus gratibusque venerati sunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vobis, o fidissime civium atque amicorum, grates ago habeoque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:6:17" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dexteram ejus amplexi grates habebant velut praesenti deo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:16:17" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 16, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 69</bibl> Draeger ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">Tiberius egit grates benevolentiae patrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o decus Italiae, virgo, quas dicere grates Quasve referre parem?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:508" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 508</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grates persolvere dignas Non opis est nostrae, Dido,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 600</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grates rependere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:3:155" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 3, 155</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus pro bene factis fateor deberi tibi Et libertatem et multas grates gratias (cf. above: grates gratiasque),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 1, 6</bibl></cit>.—Sarcastically: <cit><quote lang="la">at tibi pro scelere, exclamat, pro talibus ausis, Di .. Persolvant grates dignas et praemia reddant Debita!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:537" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 537</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gratia: <entryFree id="n19896" type="main" key="gra_ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grātĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>gratus; lit., favor, both that in which one stands with others and that which one shows to others</etym>. <sense id="n19896.0" n="I" level="1"> (Acc. to gratus, I.) <hi rend="ital">Favor which one finds with others</hi>, <hi rend="ital">esteem</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">liking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">love</hi>, <hi rend="ital">friendship</hi> (syn. favor): <cit><quote lang="la">pluris pauciorum gratiam faciunt pars hominum quam id quod prosint pluribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perspicio nihili meam vos facere gratiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut majores ejus (Plancii) summum in praefectura florentissima gradum tenuerint et dignitatis et gratiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:13:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 13, 32</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Sex. Roscius gratia atque hospitiis florens hominum nobilissimorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deinde si maxime talis est deus, ut nulla gratia, nulla hominum caritate teneatur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:44:124" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 44, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque quo Cn. Pompeii gratiam mihi per hanc causam conciliari putem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 24, 70</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem restituere in gratiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 9, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem restituere in ejus veterem gratiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in gratiam reducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 8, 19</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: cum aliquo in gratiam redire,</quote> <trans><tr>to reconcile one's self with one</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:14:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 14, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Thras. 3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Thras. 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:8:5 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dat. 8, 5 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus gratiam sequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si suam gratiam Romani velint, posse eis utiles esse amicos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 4, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab aliquo inire gratiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:46:section=113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 46, § 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a bonis omnibus summam inire gratiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnam inire gratiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:12:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 12, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantam eo facto ad plebem inierat gratiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:46:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 46, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud regem gratiam initam volebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at te apud eum, dii boni, quanta in gratia posui!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 6, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 11, 6</bibl>; Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">with a different construction: apud Lentulum ponam te in gratiam (Ern. conj. in gratia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aliquo in laude et in gratia esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:17:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 17, 51</bibl></cit>; cf. Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 14, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter vos sic haec potius cum bona Ut componantur gratia quam cum mala,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 3, 17</bibl></cit> Ruhnk.: <cit><quote lang="la">plerique (in divortio) cum bona gratia discedunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:1:32:section=10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 24, 1, 32, § 10</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">without bona: cum istuc quod postulo impetro cum gratia,</quote> <trans><tr>with a good grace</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia quae potui in hac summa tua gratia ac potentia a te impetrare,</quote> <trans><tr>credit</tr>, <tr>influence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:29:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 29, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Iccius Remus, summa nobilitate et gratia inter suos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 6, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 43, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratiā plurimum posse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 9, 3</bibl></cit>; 1, 20, 2; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum gratia, auctoritate, pecunia valent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 63, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratiā valere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:44:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 44, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inproba quamvis Gratia fallaci praetoris vicerit urna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:4" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem triumphum magis gratiae quam rerum gestarum magnitudini datum constabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:59:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 59, 1</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">L. Murenae provincia multas bonas gratias cum optima existimatione attulit,</quote> <trans><tr>tokens of favor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:20:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 20, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum haec res plurimas gratias, firmissimas amicitias pariat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non hominum potentium studio, non excellentibus gratiis paucorum, sed universi populi Romani judicio consulem factum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 3, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19896.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, objectively, like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">xa/ris</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">agreeableness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pleasantness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">charm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beauty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loveliness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grace</hi> (only <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; <cit><quote lang="la">esp. freq. in Quint.): gratia formae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:Ter. 1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. Ter. 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:260" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 19, 79, § 260</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid ille gratiae in vultu ostenderit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6</bibl></cit> prooem. § 7; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 3, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">unica nec desit jocundis gratia verbis,</quote> <trans><tr>charm</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:2:29" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 2, 29</bibl></cit>; cf.: neque<cb n="GRAT" />  abest facundis gratia dictis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 127</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">plenus est jucunditatis et gratiae (Horatius),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:96" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermonis Attici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:ib. 65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 65</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">12, 10, 35: dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 3, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">brevitatis novitatisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:ib. 58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis bene scriptorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 2, 46</bibl></cit> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 29 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">uvis et vinis gratiam affert fumus fabrilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 1, 3, § 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 9, 6, § 53</bibl>. —Hence, </sense><sense id="n19896.2" n="2" level="3"> As a <hi rend="ital">nom. propr.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Grātiae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, a transl. of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*xa/rites</foreign>, the goddesses of favor, loveliness, grace, etc., <hi rend="ital">the three Graces</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Aglaia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Euphrosyne</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and Thalia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">daughters of Jupiter and Eurynome</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:3:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 1, 720</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 4, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 30, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 19, 16</bibl>; 3, 21, 22; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:82" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 82</bibl>.—In <number>sing.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Grātia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, collect., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:429" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 429</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n19896.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Favor which one shows to another</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mark of favor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kindness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">courtesy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">service</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obligation.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19896.4" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (rare): ita mihi Telamonis patris, avi Aeaci et proavi Jovis grata est gratia, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 85, 23</bibl> (Trag. v. 367 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">ergo ab eo petito gratiam istam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 63</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">gratiam a patre si petimus, spero ab eo impetrassere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">petivit in beneficii loco et gratiae, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:82:section=189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 82, § 189</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quod beneficii gratiaeque causa concessit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 48</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc gratiam ut sibi des,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 3, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juris jurandi volo gratiam facias,</quote> <trans><tr>excuse</tr>, <tr>release</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:3:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 5, 3, 59</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui delicti gratiam facere,</quote> <trans><tr>to grant pardon</tr>, <tr>forgive</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 104 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> Kritz.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui mihi atque animo meo nullius umquam delicti gratiam fecissem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:Cat. 52:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 52, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: quibus senatus belli Lepidani gratiam fecerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:Fragm. 3:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fragm. 3, 34</bibl></cit> Gerl.: <cit><quote lang="la">alii ipsi professi se pugnaturos in gratiam ducis,</quote> <trans><tr>to please</tr>, <tr>for the sake of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 21, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">deletam urbem cernimus eorum, quorum in gratiam Saguntum deleverat Hannibal,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:39:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 39, 12</bibl></cit> Drak.: <cit><quote lang="la">in gratiam alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:26:12" default="NO" valid="yes">39, 26, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:41:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 41, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:49 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 49 al.</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: data visceratio in praeteritam judicii gratiam,</quote> <trans><tr>for the favor shown him on the trial</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:22:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 22, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil ibi majorum respectus, gratia nulla umbrarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:64" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 64</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19896.5" n="B" level="2"> In partic., a mark of favor shown for a service rendered, <hi rend="ital">thanks</hi> (by word or deed), <hi rend="ital">thankfulness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gratitude; acknowledgment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">return</hi>, <hi rend="ital">requital</hi> (the form with agere of returning thanks is the <number>plur.</number>, but with habere, referre, debere, nearly always in <number>sing.</number>; but when thanks are due to or rendered by more than one person, the form gratias referre, etc., may be used; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>., and cf. Krebs. Antibarb. p. 505): <cit><quote lang="la">quae (gratia) in memoria et remuneratione officiorum et honoris et amicitiarum observantiam teneat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:22:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 22, 66</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">gratia est, in qua amicitiarum et officiorum alterius memoria et remunerandi voluntas continetur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 53, 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immortales ago tibi gratias agamque dum vivam: nam relaturum me affirmare non possum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 10, 11, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">renuntiate, gratias regi me agere: referre gratiam aliam nunc non posse, quam ut suadeam, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:37:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 37, 8</bibl></cit> (v. ago): <cit><quote lang="la">dīs gratias agere ... si referre studeant gratias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:26 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 26 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">L. Lucceius meus, homo omnium gratissimus, mirificas tibi apud me gratias egit, cum diceret, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:42:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 42, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eique amplissimis verbis per senatus consultum gratias egimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lentulo nostro egi per litteras tuo nomine gratias diligenter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">justissimas gratias agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:3:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamquam gratiarum actionem a te non desiderabam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 10, 19, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc tecum sic agam, tulisse ut potius injuriam, quam retulisse gratiam videar,</quote> <trans><tr>to have made a return</tr>, <tr>requital</tr>, <tr>recompense</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:16:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 16, 47 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magno meo beneficio affecti cumulatissime mihi gratiam retulerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeclaram vero populo Romano refers gratiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:11:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 11, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut pro tantis eorum in rem publicam meritis honores eis habeantur gratiaeque referantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:15:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 15, 39</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 10, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">me omnibus, si minus referenda gratia satisfacere potuerim, at praedicanda et habenda certe satis esse facturum,</quote> <trans><tr>if I cannot requite ... I can extol</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 1, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: nimirum inops ille, si bonus est vir, etiam si referre gratiam non potest, habere certe potest. Commode autem quicumque dixit, pecuniam qui habeat, non reddidisse; qui reddiderit, non habere: gratiam autem et qui retulerit, habere <cb n="GRAT" /> et qui habeat retulisse, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:20:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 20, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:28:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 28, 68</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 42, 101</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 11, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratias habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:37:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 37, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui summas gratias habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui maximas infinitasque agere atque habere gratias, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6 praef.</bibl></cit> 4: <cit><quote lang="la">merito vestro maximas vobis gratias omnes et agere et habere debemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 10, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meritam dīs immortalibus gratiam justis honoribus et memori mente persolvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:33:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 33, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro beneficio gratiam repetere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:47:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 47, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratias ob hoc agere, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:54:50:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 54, 50, 4</bibl></cit>; so with <hi rend="ital">ob</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:31:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 31, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Treb. Pol.</author> Trig. Tyr. 10, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro tuo summo beneficio gratias agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:16:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 16, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:11:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 11, 12</bibl>; Plin, Pan. 25, 1; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:3:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 3, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum carmine nostro Redditur agricolis gratia caelitibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:36" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 1, 36</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc certe justitiae convenit suum cuique reddere, beneficio gratiam, injuriae talionem aut certe malam gratiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 81" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 81 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">rarely: in gratiam habere (=ita accipere, ut ad gratiam comparandam valere putet),</quote> <trans><tr>to accept as thankworthy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 111:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 111, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unum vis curem: curo. Et est dīs gratia, Cum ita, ut volo, est,</quote> <trans><tr>I thank</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:2:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 2, 58</bibl></cit>; cf.: <hi rend="ital">Er.</hi> Eamus intro, ut prandeamus. <hi rend="ital">Me.</hi> Bene vocas: tam gratia est, <hi rend="ital">no</hi>, <hi rend="ital">I'm much obliged to you</hi> (the negative being omitted, as in the Fr. <hi rend="ital">je vous remercie</hi>, and the Germ. <hi rend="ital">ich danke sehr</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 3, 36</bibl>.—Ellipt.: fores effregit? restituentur; <cit><quote lang="la">discidit Vestem? resarcietur: est, dīs gratia, Et unde haec fiant, et adhuc non molesta sunt,</quote> <trans><tr>thank Heaven</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 2, 41</bibl></cit>.—With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (anteclass. and post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">dīs gratias agebat, tempus sibi dari, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 64</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 1, 1, 15</bibl>.—Hence, as <hi rend="ital">adverbs</hi>: </sense><sense id="n19896.6" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">grātĭā</orth> (acc. to II. A.), lit., <hi rend="ital">in favor of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on account of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for the sake of;</hi> hence, in gen., <hi rend="ital">on account of</hi> (usually placed after the <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, in Quint. a few times before it; cf.: causa, ergo). </sense><sense id="n19896.7" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed neque longioribus quam oportet hyperbatis compositioni serviamus, ne quae ejus gratia fecerimus, propter eam fecisse videamur,</quote> <trans><tr>lest what we have done to embellish the style we should seem to have done merely on account of the construction we had chosen</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:144" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum abest, ut haec bestiarum etiam causa parata sint, ut ipsas bestias hominum gratia generatas esse videamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:63:158" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 63, 158</bibl></cit>: tu me amoris magis quam honoris servavisti gratia, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:32:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 32, 69</bibl> (Trag. v. 316 Vahl.); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">honoris gratia nomino,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 7, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuptiarum gratia haec sunt ficta atque incepta omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simulabat sese negotii gratia properare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 76:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 76, 1</bibl></cit>: hominem occisum esse constat; <cit><quote lang="la">non praedae gratia: quia inspoliatus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 33</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hereditatis gratia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:12:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 12, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem censores senatu probri gratia moverant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 23, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">profectus gratia dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:10:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 10, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">brevitatis gratia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 2, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decoris gratia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 6, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">difficultatis gratia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:77" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 2, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut invidiae gratia ... aut miserationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesentis gratia litis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:7:4 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 7, 4 al.</bibl></cit>—With <hi rend="ital">gerund.</hi>: duxit me uxorem liberorum sibi quaesendum gratia, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=258" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 258</bibl> Müll. (Trag. v. 161 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut aut voluptates omittantur majorum voluptatum adipiscendarum causa, aut dolores suscipiantur majorum dolorum effugiendorum gratia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:10:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 10, 36</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:43:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 43, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tentandi gratia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 47:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 47, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hiemandi gratia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 61:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 61, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colloquendi gratia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 61:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 61, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">placandi gratia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 71:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 71, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simulandi gratia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 37:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 37, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sui exposcendi gratia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amplificandi gratia ... vel miserandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">elevandae invidiae gratia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 13, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recuperandae dignitatis gratia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:79" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 1, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitandae similitudinis gratia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:11 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 1, 11 al.</bibl></cit> —Ellipt.: ejus generis hae sunt quaestiones. Si, exempli gratia, vir bonus Alexandria Rhodum magnum frumenti numerum advexerit, etc., <hi rend="ital">for example</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for instance</hi> (for the usual exempli causa; so, <cit><quote lang="la">verbi gratia, for verbi causa, infra),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:12:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 12, 50</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">exempli gratia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 41, 41, § 110</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which in full: pauca tamen exempli gratia ponam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:5:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eorum unam discordiam ponemus exempli gratia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:213" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 25, 57, § 213</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propter aliam quampiam rem, verbi gratia propter voluptatem,</quote> <trans><tr>for instance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:11:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 11, 30</bibl></cit>.—Placed before the <pb n="826" /> <cb n="GRAT" /> <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratiā decoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8 praef" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8 praef.</bibl></cit> § <cit><quote lang="la">18: compositionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lenitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:144" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">significationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 6, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19896.8" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">pron.</hi> (mostly ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">meā gratiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 5, 2, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui nihil ocius venit tamen hac gratia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 5, 1, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">abire istac gratia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 138</bibl></cit>: (Medea) per agros passim dispergit corpus: id eā gratiā, Ut, etc., Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:26:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 26, 67</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">eā gratiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 4, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:5:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 4, 5, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 4, 3, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed huc qua gratia te arcessi jussi, ausculta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 19</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 79</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">id ea gratia eveniebat, quod nemo ex fuga regem sequitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 54:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 54, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id ea gratia facilius fuit, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 80:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 80, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19896.9" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">grā-tĭīs</orth> (always as a trisyll. in ante-class. poets; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1321,001:Com. Fragm. v. 110" default="NO"><author>Pompon.</author> Com. Fragm. v. 110</bibl> Rib.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:prol. 5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. prol. 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:4:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 7, 26</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 1806</bibl>; so in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:chapter=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4</bibl> and 5 Halm), and contr., <orth extent="full" lang="la">grātīs</orth> (since the class. per.; acc. to II. A.), lit., <hi rend="ital">out of favor</hi> or <hi rend="ital">kindness;</hi> hence, pregn., <hi rend="ital">without recompense</hi> or <hi rend="ital">reward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for nothing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gratuitously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gratis</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">proi=ka</foreign> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">gratuito, nequidquam, frustra): quae (psaltria) quantum potest Aliquo abicienda est, si non pretio, at gratiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 7, 26</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si mihi dantur duo talenta argenti numerata in manum, Hanc tibi noctem honoris causa gratiis dono dabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:38 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 3, 38 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam introduxistis fidicinam, atque etiam fides, Ei quae accessere, tibi addam dono gratiis,</quote> <trans><tr>into the bargain</tr>, <tr>to boot</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:4:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae Romae magna cum infamia pretio accepto edixeras, ea sola te, ne gratis in provincia male audires, ex edicto Siciliensi sustulisse video,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:46:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 46, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic primum questus est non leviter Saturius, communem factum esse gratis cum Roscio, qui pretio proprius fuisset Fanni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:10:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 10, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratis dare alicui (opp. pretium accipere ab aliquo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:175:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 175, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id me scis antea gratis tibi esse pollicitum. Quid nunc putas, tanta mihi abs te mercede proposita?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:3:section=7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 3, § 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratis rei publicae servire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:26:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 26, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum gratis pagina nostra placet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:16:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 16, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutes omnes per se ipsas gratis diligere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:26:83" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 26, 83</bibl></cit>.—Opp. for payment: <cit><quote lang="la">is repente, ut Romam venit, gratis praetor factus est. Alia porro pecunia ne accusaretur data,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:39:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 39, 101</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 19</bibl>, § <cit><quote lang="la">48: habitent gratis in alieno?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:23:83" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 23, 83</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">habitare in aedibus alienis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:5:9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habitationem cui dare,</quote> <trans><tr>free of cost</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:2:53:section=2" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 19, 2, 53, § 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:3:11" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 3, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gratiae: <entryFree id="n19897" type="main" key="Gra_tiae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Grātiae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, v. gratia, I. B. 2.</entryFree>
gratianopolis: <entryFree id="n19898" type="main" key="Gra_ti^a_no^po^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Grātĭānŏpŏlis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n19898.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Gallia Narbonensis</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Grenoble in Dauphiné</hi>, Aug. Civ. Dei, 21, 7, 2; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 3, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gratianus: <entryFree id="n19899" type="main" key="Gra_ti^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Grātĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Grātiānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. Gratius, II.</entryFree>
gratidius: <entryFree id="n19900" type="main" key="Gra_ti^di^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Grātĭdĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n19900.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a Roman</hi> gens, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:16:36 al" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 16, 36 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n19900.1" n="II" level="1"> Deriv. <orth extent="full" lang="la">Grā-tĭdĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to a Gratidius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:45:168 al" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 45, 168 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
gratificatio: <entryFree id="n19901" type="main" key="gra_ti^fi^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grātĭfĭcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>gratificor</etym>, <sense id="n19901.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a showing kindness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">doing favors</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obligingness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">complaisance</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">conjungitur impudens gratificatio cum acerba injuria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:3:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 3, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:20:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 20, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:44:122" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 44, 122</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 3, 9, § 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gratifico: <entryFree id="n19902" type="main" key="gra_ti^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grātĭfĭco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. gratificor <sense id="n19902.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
gratificor: <entryFree id="n19903" type="main" key="gra_ti^fi^cor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grātĭfĭcor</orth>, <itype>ātus</itype> (<sense id="n19903.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">act.</hi> collat. form gratificat, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 7, 6 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratificavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,010:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eph. 1, 6</bibl></cit>), 1, <hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [gratus+ facio], <hi rend="ital">to do a favor to</hi> a person, <hi rend="ital">to oblige</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gratify;</hi> also <hi rend="ital">to do</hi> a thing <hi rend="ital">as a favor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make a present of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surrender</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sacrifice</hi> a thing (class.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">condono, largior): gratificatur mihi gestu accusator: inscientem Cn. Pompeium fecisse significat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 6, 14</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quod Pompeio se gratificari putant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 1, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut sit ipsa libertas, in quo populo potestas honeste bonis gratificandi datur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:18:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 18, 39</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:15:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 15, 52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de eo quod ipsis superat, aliis gratificari volunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:15:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 15, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deus nihil cuiquam tribuens, nihil gratificans omnino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:44:123" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 44, 123</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:14:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 14, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur tibi hoc non gratificer, nescio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut praepararent suorum animos, ne quid pars altera gratificari pro Romanis posset,</quote> <trans><tr>to prove complaisant to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> dub. (Weissenb. reads gratificari populo Romano; perh. the words <cb n="GRAT" /> pro Romanis are spurious): <cit><quote lang="la">audax, impurus, populo gratificans et aliena et sua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 44</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 6, 11, § 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">potentiae paucorum decus atque libertatem suam gratificari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 3, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">homo nimis in gratificando jure liber, L. Sisenna,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Cornel. Fragm. p. 450</bibl></cit> Orell.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut, quod populi sit, populus jubeat potius quam patres gratificentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:24:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 24, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gratificus: <entryFree id="n19904" type="main" key="gra_ti^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grātĭfĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>gratus + facio</etym>, <sense id="n19904.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">kind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obliging</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">pectus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Petr.</author> Vit. S. Mart. 2, 716</bibl></cit>: dominus, Porphyr. Paneg. ad Constant. 1, 6.</sense></entryFree>
gratiis: <entryFree id="n19905" type="main" key="gra_tii_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grātiīs</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">grātīs</orth>), v. gratia, B. <sense id="n19905.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
gratilla: <entryFree id="n19906" type="main" key="gra_tilla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grātilla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n19906.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of cake</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 230</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gratiose: <entryFree id="n19907" type="main" key="gra_ti^o_se"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grātĭōse</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. gratiosus <sense id="n19907.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
gratiositas: <entryFree id="n19908" type="main" key="gra_ti^o_si^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grātĭōsĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>gratiosus</etym>, <sense id="n19908.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">agreeableness</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">novitatis gratiositas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 1, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gratiosus: <entryFree id="n19909" type="main" key="gra_ti^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grātĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>gratia</etym>, <sense id="n19909.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of favor.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19909.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Enjoying favor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in favor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">popular</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regarded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beloved</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agreeable</hi>, etc. (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">a favorite expression with Cicero, and used mostly of persons): ego Plancium et ipsum gratiosum esse dico et habuisse in petitione multos cupidos sui gratiosos, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:19:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 19, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homini honesto, sed non gratiosiori quam Cn. Calidius est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:20:section=44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 20, § 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum adversario gratiosissimo contendat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines potentes, gratiosi, diserti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 9, 21</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">splendidi homines et aliis praetoribus gratiosi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:14:section=37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 14, § 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pythius, qui esset ut argentarius apud omnes ordines gratiosus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:14:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 14, 58</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:18:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 18, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 4, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ego doceo gratiosum esse in sua tribu Plancium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:19:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 19, 47</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt quidam homines in suis vicinitatibus et municipiis gratiosi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Petit. Cons. 6:24" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Petit. Cons. 6, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">is cum et suo splendore et nostra commendatione gratiosissimus in provincia fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 3</bibl></cit>.—Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">vidi et cognovi, causas apud te rogantium gratiosiores esse quam vultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:11:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lig. 11, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratiosa missio,</quote> <trans><tr>through favor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:14:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 14, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:6:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 6, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Berytensis colonia Augusti beneficiis gratiosa,</quote> <trans><tr>favored</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:15:1" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 50, 15, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupressus odore violenta ac ne umbra quidem gratiosa, materie rara,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 33, 60, § 139</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19909.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That shows favor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obliging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">complaisant</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">gratiosi scribae sint in dando et cedendo loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:84:290" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 84, 290</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">grātĭōse</orth>, <hi rend="ital">out of favor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">graciously</hi> (postclass. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">neque sordide neque gratiose,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:7:7:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 26, 7, 7, § 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratiosius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pseudo</author> Ascon. Cic. Verr. 2, 1, 4, § 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gratis: <entryFree id="n19910" type="main" key="gra_ti_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grātīs</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. gratia, B. <sense id="n19910.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
gratius: <entryFree id="n19911" type="main" key="Gra_ti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Grātĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n19911.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a Roman</hi> gens. </sense><sense id="n19911.1" n="1" level="3"> <itype>Gratius, ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the opponent of the poet Archias</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 4, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19911.2" n="2" level="3"> Gratius Faliscus, <hi rend="ital">a contemporary of Ovid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">author of a poem on hunting</hi>, Cynegeticon, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:16:34" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 16, 34</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19911.3" n="II" level="1"> Deriv.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Grātĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Gratius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Gratian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vasa ex argento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 11, 49, § 139</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Grātiānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">son and co-regent of the emperor Valentinian I.</hi>, from 367 to 383 A. D.</sense></entryFree>
grator: <entryFree id="n19912" type="main" key="gra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grātor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n19912.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [gratus], <hi rend="ital">to manifest joy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to wish one joy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to congratulate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rejoice with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rejoice</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> or in post-Aug. prose; not in Cic.; class. gratulor, congratulor): nec tibi me in hac re gratari decet, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 5, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inveni, germana, viam: gratare sorori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:478" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 478</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:434" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 434</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">invicem inter se gratantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:43:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 43, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nescia, gratentur consolenturne parentem (by zeugma),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:578" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 578</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jovis templum gratantes ovantesque adire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:13:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 13, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudantes gratantesque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter venerantes gratantesque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad gratandum sese expedire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:418" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 418</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratatur reduces (= eos reduces esse),</quote> <trans><tr>congratulates them on their return</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 40</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(eum Tiberius) incolumem fore gratatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totoque libens mihi pectore grator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:244" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 244</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quid tibi grataris?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:11:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 11, 65</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">grātanter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">with rejoicing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with joy</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">senatus gratanter accepit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Macr. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accipere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Max. 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 17, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2588</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gratuito: <entryFree id="n19913" type="main" key="gra_tu^i_to_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grātŭītō</orth> <pos>adv.</pos>, v. gratuitus <sense id="n19913.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> <cb n="GRAT" /></sense></entryFree>
gratuitus: <entryFree id="n19914" type="main" key="gra_tu^i_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grātŭītus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">grātŭĭtum</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:6:16" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 6, 16</bibl>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>gratia</etym>, <sense id="n19914.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is done with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">out pay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reward</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">profit; free</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spontaneous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">voluntary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gratuitous</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ea (examina apium) vel aere parta vel gratuita contingunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:8:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid? liberalitas gratuitane est an mercenaria? si sine praemio benigna est, gratuita: si cum mercede, conducta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:18:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 18, 48</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">probitas gratuita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:31:99" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 31, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominum caritas et amicitia gratuita est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:44:122" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 44, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne gratuita quidem suffragia,</quote> <trans><tr>purchased</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:22:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 22, 54</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">comitia gratuita,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>at which no gratuities were distributed to voters</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:15:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 15, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 15</bibl>, b, 4: <cit><quote lang="la">pecunia,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>without interest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum debitor gratuita pecunia utatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 2, 5, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">usus pecuniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:41" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milies sestertio proposito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 48</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and perh. also, fenus,</quote> <trans><tr>lending without interest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">universi milites gratuitam et sine frumento stipendioque operam (obtulerunt),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cadaverum et ruderum gratuita egestio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratuita in Circo loca,</quote> <trans><tr>free places</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subsellia,</quote> <trans><tr>free benches</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 17</bibl></cit>: navis, <hi rend="ital">a free ship</hi> or <hi rend="ital">boat</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 6:19" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 6, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">furor,</quote> <trans><tr>innate</tr>, <tr>spontaneous</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:42:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 42, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crudelitas,</quote> <trans><tr>unprovoked</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:37:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 37, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeterita parricidia,</quote> <trans><tr>without effect</tr>, <tr>in vain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:47:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 47, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">AVGVSTALIS,</quote> <trans><tr>without pay</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3918</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">SO, SACERDOS, Inscr. ap. Maff. Mus. Ver. 80, 3: largis gratuitum cadit rapinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:6:16" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odium aut est ex offensa, aut gratuitum,</quote> <trans><tr>unprovoked</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 105:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 105, 3</bibl></cit> (al. gratuito).—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">grātŭīto</orth>, <hi rend="ital">without pay</hi> or <hi rend="ital">profit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for naught</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gratis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gratuitously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic (Polygnotus) et Athenis porticum, quae Poecile vocatur, gratuito (pinxit), cum partem ejus Micon mercede pingeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 9, 35, § 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque tamen eloquentiam gratuito contingere,</quote> <trans><tr>without cost</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multorum causas et non gravate et gratuito defendentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:19:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 19, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum mediocribus multis gratuito civitatem in Graecia homines impertiebant,</quote> <trans><tr>for no particular reason</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 5, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ne per otium torpescerent manus aut animus, gratuito potius malus atque crudelis erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 16, 3</bibl></cit> Kritz: <cit><quote lang="la">gratuito nemo bonus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 1:48:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 48, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gratulabundus: <entryFree id="n19915" type="main" key="gra_tu^la_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grātŭlābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>gratulor</etym>, <sense id="n19915.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">congratulating</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quo se omnis multitudo gratulabunda effudit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:33:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 33, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 19</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">velut gratulabundus patriae exspiravit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6:8:13" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 6, 8, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gratulatio: <entryFree id="n19916" type="main" key="gra_tu^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grātŭlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n19916.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a manifestation of joy; a wishing joy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">congratulation; a rejoicing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">joy</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n19916.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., constr. usu. with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuntiatur mihi, tantam isti gratulationem esse factam, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 8, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratulationes habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:35:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 35, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unius diei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudis nostrae gratulatio tua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:17:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 17, 6</bibl></cit>: quam (imaginem parentis sui) paucis ante diebus laureatam in sua gratulatione conspexit, <hi rend="ital">during the congratulations made to him</hi> (on account of obtaining the consulship), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:41:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 41, 88</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum gratulatione ac favore ingenti populi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:24:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 24, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter gratulationes amicorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(signum Dianae) in suis antiquis sedibus summa cum gratulatione civium et laetitia reponitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:34:section=74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 34, § 74</bibl></cit>;
