cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quanta gratulatio consecuta est!</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 39, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic parenti suo ... solatio in laboribus, gratulationi in victoria fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 5, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19916.2" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to gratulor, II.) <hi rend="ital">A religious festival of joy and thanksgiving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a public thanksgiving</hi> (= supplicatio, obsecratio): <cit><quote lang="la">gratulatio, quam tuo nomine ad omnia deorum templa fecimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">is supplicationem mihi decrevit ... qui quaestori gratulationem decrevit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 5, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ceteris bene gestā, mihi uni conservatā re publicā gratulationem decrevistis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 10, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diis immortalibus non erat exigua eadem gratulatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 11, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratae nostrae diis immortalibus gratulationes erunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 14, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum patefacta gratulationi omnia in urbe templa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:40:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 40, 4</bibl></cit> Weissenb. (al patuere, facta gratulatione): <cit><quote lang="la">civitatem in supplicationibus ac gratulationibus esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:33:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 33, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gratulator: <entryFree id="n19917" type="main" key="gra_tu^la_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grātŭlātor</orth>, <sense id="n19917.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a congratulator</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:74:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 74, 1</bibl> (also in a spurious passage in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:33:108" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 33, 108</bibl>; v. Madv. ad h. l.). <pb n="827" /> <cb n="GRAT" /></sense></entryFree>
gratulatorie: <entryFree id="n19918" type="main" key="gra_tu^la_to_ri^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grātŭlātōrĭē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. gratulatorius <sense id="n19918.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
gratulatorius: <entryFree id="n19919" type="main" key="gra_tu^la_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grātŭlātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>gratulor</etym>, <sense id="n19919.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">congratulatory</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">epistola, Capitol. Max. et Balb. 17: cena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Rer. Gest. Alex. 3:34 al" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Rer. Gest. Alex. 3, 34 al.</bibl></cit>—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">grātŭ-lātōrĭē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in a congratulatory manner</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mirari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 8:6" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 8, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gratulor: <entryFree id="n19920" type="main" key="gra_tu^lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grātŭlor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n19920.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [gratus]. </sense><sense id="n19920.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To manifest one's joy</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to wish</hi> a person <hi rend="ital">joy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to congratulate;</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to rejoice</hi> (freq. and class.; cf. grator).—Constr., <hi rend="ital">alicui</hi>, (<hi rend="ital">alicui</hi>) <hi rend="ital">de aliqua re</hi> or <hi rend="ital">aliquid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quod</hi>, rarely <hi rend="ital">in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pro aliqua re</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aliqua re</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alicui rei</hi>, an <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">unum illud nescio, gratulerne tibi, an timeam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 5, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 9, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratulor tibi, mi Balbe, vereque gratulor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse mihi gratulatus sum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:104:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 104, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:15:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 15, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod mihi de filia et de Crassipede gratularis, agnosco humanitatem tuam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 7, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quod mihi de nostro statu, etc., gratularis: minime miramur, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 7, 7</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">1, 7, 11: ego vero vehementer gratulor de judicio ambitus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legatio de victoria gratulatum venit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:13:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 13, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesare interfecto M. Brutus Ciceronem nominatim exclamavit atque ei recuperatam libertatem est gratulatus,</quote> <trans><tr>congratulated him on the restoration of liberty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:12:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 12, 28</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ei voce maxima victoriam gratulatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi gratulatus es illius diei celebritatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 20, 1</bibl></cit> (but cf. Krebs, Antibarb. p. 507): <cit><quote lang="la">Sejanum oppressum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Athenienses victoriam gratulabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:8:12" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 8, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitates quae gratulatae illi sibique victoriam fuerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 8, 3 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratulor tibi pro amicitia nostra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi pro opportunitate temporis gratulor, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 14, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tamen, quod abes, gratulor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 1</bibl></cit>; 4, 14, 1; 13, 73, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 8, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:7:15" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 7, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:12:17" default="NO">8, 12, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi etiam in hoc gratulor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:37:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 37, 91</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">qua in re tibi gratulor ita vehementer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temporibus nostris gratulare pro ingenio tali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:27:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 27, 5</bibl></cit>: gratulor tibi affinitate viri mediusfidius optimi, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 13, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vires ejus sibi accessisse gratulabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:5:15" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 13, 5, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:1:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tota mihi mente tibique Gratulor, ingenium non latuisse tuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:9:54" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 9, 54</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ego me nunc denique natum Gratulor,</quote> <trans><tr>congratulate myself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 3, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse mihi gratulatus sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratulor victoriae suae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">felicitati tuae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 14, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">itaque inter se impii cives, quasi vicissent, gratulabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 12, 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque enim regio fuit ulla, ex qua non publice ad me venerint gratulatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:22:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 22, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laeto vultu gratulantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratulatum satis suo nomine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 14, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum gratulamur (in dicendo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:4:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gratulantes ex sententia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratulanti inter poenam,</quote> <trans><tr>congratulating himself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:60" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">elemento gratulor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:86" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 86</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19920.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To give thanks</hi>, <hi rend="ital">render thanks</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to thank</hi>, esp. a deity, =grates, gratias agere (mostly ante-class.): Juppiter, tibi, summe, tandem male re gesta gratulor, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 116, 30</bibl> (Trag. v. 242 Vahl.); cf.: eamus Jovi maximo gratulatum, Scip. Afric. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:18:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 18, 3</bibl>: gratulor divis, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 804</bibl>, and ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 116, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">deos gratulando obtundere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: dis immortalibus, M. Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 5, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quapropter illi dolori gratulor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6 praef" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6 praef.</bibl></cit> § 8 Spald.</sense></entryFree>
gratus: <entryFree id="n19921" type="main" key="gra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. har-jami, love, desire; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">xai/rw, xa/rma, xa/ris</foreign></etym>. <sense id="n19921.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beloved</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acceptable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pleasing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agreeable</hi> (syn.: acceptus, jucundus, optatus, dulcis, blandus, suavis; in this signif. in ante-Aug. prose, viz. in Cic. and Cæs., only of things; gratiosus, mostly of persons). </sense><sense id="n19921.1" n="A" level="2"> Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">non ille (amor tuus) quidem mihi ignotus, sed tamen gratus et optatus: dicerem jucundus, nisi id verbum in omne tempus perdidissem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 15, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">illud tamen dicam, mihi id, quod fecisti, esse gratissimum. Tale enim tuum judicium non potest mihi non summe esse jucundum. Quod cum ita sit, esse gratum necesse est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ista veritas, etiam si jucunda non est, mihi tamen grata est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 3, 24, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. also: cujus officia jucundiora licet saepe mihi fuerint, <cb n="GRAT" /> numquam tamen gratiora, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 6, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae omnia mihi jucunda, hoc extremum etiam gratum fuit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so corresp. or connected with jucundus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 17, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:18:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 18, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 3, 8, § 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:23:5" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 23, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid est, quod aut populo Romano gratius esse debeat aut sociis exterisque nationibus optatius esse possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 3, 7</bibl></cit>; so with optatus cf. above, the passage <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 15, 1</bibl>: quod approbaris, id gratum acceptumque habendum. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:15:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 15, 45</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi pol grata acceptaque hujus est benignitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 1, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:96:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 96, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">munus eorum gratum acceptumque esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 7</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">rarely in the contrary order: quorum mihi Dona accepta et grata habeo, tuaque ingrata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:7:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 7, 56</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Tox.</hi> Credidi gratum fore Beneficium meum apud te. <hi rend="ital">Do.</hi> Immo equidem gratiam tibi habeo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 7, 8</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">grata tibi esse mea officia non miror: cognovi enim te gratissimum omnium, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam multi, ut Galli, ut Poeni homines immolare et pium et diis immortalibus gratissimum esse duxerunt!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 16, 5</bibl>; Cic. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 398, 28</bibl> (Rep. 6, 2 Mos.); cf. in <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedere in his scholis gratius erat quam ire per solitudines, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 2, 6, § 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: hedera est gratissima Baccho,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:767" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 767</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dapibus supremi Grata testudo Jovis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:32:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 32, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eoque erat cujusque gratior in re publica virtus, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 34 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">o diva, gratum quae regis Antium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:35:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 35, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">grato sub antro,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 198</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hora,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 4, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lux,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 5, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nox,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Carm. Sec. 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:15:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 15, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 11, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">artes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 13, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">error mentis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">protervitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:19:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 19, 7</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">feceris, si de re publica quid sentias explicaris, nobis gratum omnibus,</quote> <trans><tr>will do us all a favor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quamobrem utrique nostrum gratum admodum feceris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:4:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod si eum interfecerit, multis sese nobilibus gratum esse facturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:44:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 44, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quapropter gratissimum mihi feceris, si curaris, ut, etc. ... Hoc mihi gratius facere nihil potes,</quote> <trans><tr>a very great favor ... no greater favor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">is adulescens ita locatus est, ut, quae rebus grata erant, gratiora verbis faceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:13:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 13, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratum elocuta consiliantibus Junone divis,</quote> <trans><tr>something pleasant</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 3, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19921.2" n="B" level="2"> Of living beings. </sense><sense id="n19921.3" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Herophile Phoebo grata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:68" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 5, 68</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vates diis gratissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:585" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 585</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">superis deorum gratus (Mercurius) et imis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:10:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 10, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">donec gratus eram tibi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 9, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:2:31" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 2, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratus Alexandro regi Magno fuit ille Choerilus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 232</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui (Maecenati) cum se gratum et acceptum in modum amici videret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Gramm. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">filio ejus Fausto gratissimus fuit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(cervus) gratus erat tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 121</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19921.4" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">olim gratus eram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:12:7" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 12, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 6, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">conviva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 2, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comitum gratissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:221" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 221</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenum gratissime Crantor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:367" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 367</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o mihi de fratris longe gratissime natis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:586" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 586</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestor consulibus suis non minus jucundus et gratus quam usui fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:23:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 23, 5</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">grātus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a favorite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">darling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam (classem) non amicorum sed gratorum appellabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:46" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 46 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense><sense id="n19921.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thankful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grateful; thankworthy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deserving</hi> or <hi rend="ital">procuring thanks</hi> (beneficii memor): <cit><quote lang="la">cognovi te gratissimum omnium: nec enim tu mihi habuisti modo gratiam, verum etiam cumulatissime retulisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 11, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:18:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 18, 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamquam gratiarum actionem a te non desiderabam, cum te re ipsa atque animo scirem esse gratissimum, tamen, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 10, 19, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si bene de me meritis gratum me praebeo, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:38:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 38, 91</bibl></cit> (v. Krebs, Antibarb. p. 508); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut grati ac memores beneficii esse videantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 8, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hegesaratus, magnis meis beneficiis ornatus in consulatu suo, memor et gratus fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 25</bibl></cit>; cf. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 11</bibl>, A, 3: <cit><quote lang="la">tu quam gratus erga me fueris, ipse existimare potes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 5, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: ut quam gratissimus erga te esse cognoscerer,<cb n="GRAV" />  <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 12</bibl>: gratiorem me esse in te, Brut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 10, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quod adest gratum juvat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 12, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudo vos, Quirites, cum gratissimis animis prosequimini nomen clarissimi adolescentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:4:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 4, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 11, 30</bibl>, and 10, 3, 7: <cit><quote lang="la">tu, quamcumque deus tibi fortunaverit horam, gratā sume manu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 11, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod tamen nunc faciam: tum, cum gratum mihi esse potuit, nolui,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>might have procured me thanks</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est istuc datum Profecto, ut grata mihi sint, quae facio, omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 3, 1, 6</bibl></cit> Ruhnk.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">didicisse, quam sit re pulchrum, beneficio gratum, fama gloriosum, tyrannum occidere,</quote> <trans><tr>productive of gratitude</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:46:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 46, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro quibus beneficiis vix satis gratus videar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 2:41:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 2, 41, 5</bibl></cit> Dietsch.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">grātē</orth>. </sense><sense id="n19921.6" n="1" level="3"> (Acc. to I. = jucunde.) <hi rend="ital">With pleasure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agreeably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">willingly</hi> (rare in the class. period): <cit><quote lang="la">praeterita grate meminit et, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:19:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 19, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberti pupillorum grate facient, si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:10:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 26, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insignis haec munificentia ... nec a debitoribus magis quam a creditoribus gratius excepta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:11:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratissime provocari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19921.7" n="2" level="3"> (Acc. to II.) <hi rend="ital">Thankfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gratefully</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid et grate et pie facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:41:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 41, 98</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quid pie, quid grate, quid humaniter, aut fecerit aut tulerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:11:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 11, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:66" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 66</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">natales grate numeras,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 210</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">beneficium qui dat, vult accipi grate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:31" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid recipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 22</bibl></cit>; and in <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">id munus inter censoria opera gratissime acceptum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 60, 60, § 214</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
graupius: <entryFree id="n19922" type="main" key="Graupi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Graupĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Gramp-</orth>) <orth extent="full" lang="la">mons</orth>, <sense id="n19922.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain in the north of Britain</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gravabilis: <entryFree id="n19923" type="main" key="gra^va_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grăvābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>gravo</etym>, <sense id="n19923.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">oppressive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">troublesome</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">cibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:17" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vomitus capiti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:ib. 4:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:15:136" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Acut. 1, 15, 136</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gravamen: <entryFree id="n19924" type="main" key="gra^va_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grăvāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n19924.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">trouble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">physical inconvenience</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Varr. 9, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 5, 30, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gravastellus: <entryFree id="n19925" type="hapax" key="gra_vastellus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grāvastellus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>‡ gravaster, from ‡ gravus, kindr. to <foreign lang="greek">grau=s</foreign> and the Ger. grau; Engl. gray; the ground-form of ravus</etym>, <sense id="n19925.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a gray-headed fellow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis est haec muliercula et illic gravastellus qui venit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 5, 1, 14</bibl></cit>; cf.: gravastellus senior, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=96" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 96</bibl> Müll. (where it is erroneously derived from gravis; moreover, he reads s. v. Ravi coloris, p. 272, in Plautus, ravistellus).</sense></entryFree>
gravate: <entryFree id="n19926" type="main" key="gra^va_te"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grăvāte</orth>, v. gravo <sense id="n19926.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
gravatim: <entryFree id="n19927" type="main" key="gra^va_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grăvātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>gravo</etym>, <sense id="n19927.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with difficulty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unwillingly</hi> (very rare for the usual gravate): <cit><quote lang="la">cadere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:387" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 387</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud gravatim socia arma Rutulis junxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gravatio: <entryFree id="n19928" type="main" key="gra^va_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grăvātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n19928.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">heaviness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oppression</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">post cibum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:32:171" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 32, 171</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:10:96" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tard. 5, 10, 96</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:4:3:33" default="NO">4, 3, 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gravedinosus: <entryFree id="n19929" type="main" key="gra^ve_di^no_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grăvēdĭnōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>gravedo</etym>, <sense id="n19929.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">subject to colds</hi> or <hi rend="ital">catarrhs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that easily takes cold.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19929.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: sunt alii ad alios morbos procliviores: itaque dicimus gravedinosos quosdam, quosdam torminosos, non quia jam sint, sed quia saepe sint, *<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:12:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 12, 27</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19929.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">that produces colds</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ervum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 15, 38, § 139</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gravedo: <entryFree id="n19930" type="main" key="gra^ve_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grăvēdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>gravis</etym>. <sense id="n19930.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Heaviness</hi> of the limbs, <hi rend="ital">cold</hi> in the head, <hi rend="ital">catarrh</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi gravedo profluat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 4, 1, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 16, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16, 14, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:44:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 44, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 6, § 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:150" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 13, 94, § 150</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:31" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 4, 11, § 31</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 2</bibl>; of <hi rend="ital">heaviness in the head produced by intoxication</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad crapulae gravedines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 13, 51, § 136</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19930.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pregnancy</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Nemes.</author> Cyneg. 132</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
graveolens: <entryFree id="n19931" type="main" key="gra^ve^o^lens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grăvĕŏlens</orth> (also separately: <orth extent="full" lang="la">grave olens</orth>), <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>gravis-, 1. oleo</etym>. * <sense id="n19931.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Strong - smelling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">graveolentia centaurea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:270" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 270</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19931.1" n="II" level="1"> In a bad sense. <hi rend="ital">illsmelling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">noisome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rank</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fauces graveolentis Averni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 201</bibl></cit>; App. de Mundo, p. 74.</sense></entryFree>
graveolentia: <entryFree id="n19932" type="main" key="gra^ve^o^lenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grăvĕŏlentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>graveolens, II.</etym>, <sense id="n19932.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an offensive</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rank smell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fetidness</hi> (Plin. ian): <cit><quote lang="la">alarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 22, 43, § 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">narium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 9, 36, § 92</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gravesco: <entryFree id="n19933" type="main" key="gra^vesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grăvesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n19933.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [gravis], <hi rend="ital">to become<pb n="828" /> <cb n="GRAV" />  burdened</hi> or <hi rend="ital">heavy</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose). </sense><sense id="n19933.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n19933.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">fetu nemus omne gravescit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>becomes loaded</tr>, <tr>filled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:429" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 429</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19933.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to become pregnant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cameli lac habent, donec iterum gravescant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:236" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 41, 96, § 236</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19933.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to become grievous</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to grow worse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aerumna gravescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1069" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1069</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impetus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:337" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 337</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec in morte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1022" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 1022</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valetudo Augusti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">publica mala in dies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 51</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n19933.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To be cumbered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">embarrassed</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> de Virg. 1, 6, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">peccato gravescit oratio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> in Psa. 118</bibl></cit>, Serm. 22, § 5.</sense></entryFree>
graviditas: <entryFree id="n19934" type="main" key="gra^vi^di^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grăvĭdĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>gravidus</etym>, <sense id="n19934.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pregnancy</hi> (very rare; perh. <foreign lang="greek">a(/pac ei)rhm</foreign>.); ab eo (Sole) Luna illuminata graviditates et partus afferat maturitatesque gignendi, *<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:46:119" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 46, 119</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gravido: <entryFree id="n19935" type="main" key="gra^vi^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grăvĭdo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n19935.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to burden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">load.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19935.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">gravidavit = implevit. Caecilius: Per mysteria hic inhoneste gravidavit probro,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 118, 12 sq.</bibl></cit> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0013,001:Com. Fragm. v. 223" default="NO"><author>Caecil.</author> Com. Fragm. v. 223</bibl> Rib.).—</sense><sense id="n19935.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to impregnate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravidari ex aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Epit. 14" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Epit. 14</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: quae (terra) gravidata seminibus omnia pariat et fundat ex sese, *<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:33:83" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 33, 83</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gravidus: <entryFree id="n19936" type="main" key="gra^vi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grăvĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>gravis, burdened, loaded; hence in partic.</etym>, <sense id="n19936.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pregnant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with child</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with young</hi> (class.; syn. praegnans, fetus). </sense><sense id="n19936.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n19936.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: mater, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 17, 52</bibl> (Trag. v. 57 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">puero gravida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravida esse ex aliquo viro,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> prol. 111; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 3, 32</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which also simply aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 1, 18</bibl></cit> and 19: <cit><quote lang="la">de semine Jovis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:260" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 260</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgo ex eo compressu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 4, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prius gravida facta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:3:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 3, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere gravidam aliquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:5:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 5, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum esset gravida uxor, et jam appropinquare partus putaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:11:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 11, 31</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:18:section=48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 18, § 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 5</bibl> sqq.; of animals, etc. (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">gravida pecus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 150</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:633" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 633</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">muraena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">balaenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 6, 5, § 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19936.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">grăvĭda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a pregnant woman</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:5:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 5, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 6, 57, § 107</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:59" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 6, 17, § 59</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n19936.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">laden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">filled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">full</hi> (only <usg type="style">poet.</usg>); constr. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, with <case>abl.</case>, or <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19936.5" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad fores auscultato ... neu qui manus attulerit steriles intro ad nos, Gravidas foras exportet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: cum se gravido tremefecit corpore tellus, <hi rend="ital">fruit-laden</hi>, Cic. poët. Div. 1, 11, 18: <cit><quote lang="la">nubes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:440" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 440</bibl></cit> (cf. Lachm. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:II. p. 365" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> II. p. 365</bibl>); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:2:107" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 2, 107</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cornu lunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:56" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne gravidis procumbat culmus aristis,</quote> <trans><tr>loaded</tr>, <tr>full</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 111</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aristae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">olivae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:281" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 281</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fetus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:293" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 293</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(caprae) gravido superant vix ubere limen,</quote> <trans><tr>full</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:317" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 317</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19936.6" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravidae nunc semine terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:633" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 633</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubera gravida vitali rore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:12:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 12, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi pampineo gravidus auctumno Floret ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: equus (Trojanus) armatis, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 2</bibl> (Ann. v. 97 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">tempestas fulminibus atque procellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:259" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 259</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alvus (serpentis) venenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:155" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 155</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Amathunta metallis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:531" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 531</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stipes nodis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:507" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 507</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pharetra sagittis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 22, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbs bellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 87</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Italia imperiis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 229</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anus arcanis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:394" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 394</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parens sorte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:22" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populus noxa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:542" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 542</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectus curis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:735" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 735</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:161" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 161</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n19936.7" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mellis apes gravidae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:120" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 120</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19936.8" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">full</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abundant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod bonis benefit beneficium, gratia ea gravidast bonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:Capt. 2:2:108" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 108</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gravis: <entryFree id="n19937" type="main" key="gra^vis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grăvis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. gurus (root gar-); Gr. <foreign lang="greek">baru/s</foreign>, heavy; gravis, for gar-uis; cf. also Brutus</etym>. With respect to weight, <sense id="n19937.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">heavy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weighty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ponderous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burdensome;</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loaded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">laden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burdened</hi> (opp. levis, light; in most of its significations corresp. to the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">baru/s</foreign>; cf. onerosus, onerarius). </sense><sense id="n19937.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> or with <case>abl.</case> </sense><sense id="n19937.2" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: imber et ignis, spiritus et gravis terra, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=37" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 37</bibl> Müll.; so, <cit><quote lang="la">tellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:355" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 355</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:225 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 225 sq.</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:450 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 450 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">limus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:496" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 496</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eo etiam cavillatus est, aestate grave esse aureum amiculum, hieme frigidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:34:83" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 34, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navigia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 8, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tot ora navium gravi Rostrata duci pondere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:4:17" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum gravius dorso (aselli) subiit onus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 9, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sarcina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 13, 6</bibl></cit>: <cb n="GRAV" /> inflexi grave robur aratri, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 162</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus (tibicinae) Ad strepitum salias terrae gravis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 26</bibl></cit>: terra, <hi rend="ital">burdened</hi> (by the heavy body), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 118</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves hostilibus spoliis graves,</quote> <trans><tr>heavily laden</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:35:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 35, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">agmen grave praedā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 5, 8</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which also simply: grave agmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:39:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 39, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miles,</quote> <trans><tr>heavy-armed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravis aere dextra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum fatalis equus saltu super ardua venit Pergama et armatum peditem gravis attulit alvo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>filled</tr>, <tr>full</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:516" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 516</bibl></cit> (an imitation of Maximo saltu superavit Gravidus armatis equus, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 2</bibl>; v. gravidus, II. <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">graves imbre nubes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:15:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 15, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">graves fructu vites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravis vinculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:27:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 27, 10</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n19937.3" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n19937.4" n="a" level="4"> With respect to value or number, <hi rend="ital">heavy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">great.</hi> So, aes grave, <hi rend="ital">heavy money</hi>, money of the oldest standard, in which an <hi rend="ital">as</hi> weighed a full pound: grave aes dictum a pondere, quia deni asses, singuli pondo libras, efficiebant denarium, etc., Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=98" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 98</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">et quia nondum argentum signatum erat, aes grave plaustris quidam (ex patribus) ad aerarium convehentes, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:60:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 60, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:46:5" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 46, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:33:2" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 33, 2</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">populus Romanus ne argento quidem signato ante Pyrrhum regem devictum usus est: librales appendebantur asses. Quare aeris gravis poena dicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 13, § 42</bibl></cit>: argentum, i. e. <hi rend="ital">uncoined</hi> = rude: <cit><quote lang="la">placet argentum grave rustici patris sine ullo opere et nomine artificis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 1:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">notavit aliquos, quod pecunias levioribus usuris mutuati graviore fenore collocassent,</quote> <trans><tr>at a higher rate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:39" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 39</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in graviore annona,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 25</bibl></cit>: grave pretium, <hi rend="ital">a high price</hi>, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 314, 25</bibl>.—With respect to number: graves pavonum greges, <hi rend="ital">great</hi> or <hi rend="ital">numerous flocks</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 314, 31</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n19937.5" n="b" level="4"> For the usual gravidus, <hi rend="ital">with young</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pregnant</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">regina sacerdos Marte gravis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 274</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">uterus (shortly after: gravidus tumet venter),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:495" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 495</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">balaenae utero graves (shortly before, gravidae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 6, 5, § 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19937.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n19937.7" n="1" level="3"> Of hearing or sound, <hi rend="ital">deep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">low</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bass</hi> (opp. acutus, treble): <cit><quote lang="la">vocem ab acutissimo sono usque ad gravissimum sonum recipiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:59:251" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 59, 251</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 57, 216</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (sonus) acuta cum gravibus temperans, varios aequabiliter concentus efficit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:42" default="NO">42</bibl>: sonus, 2, 8, 15; 5, 10, 125; 11, 3, 41; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 203</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">syllaba,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>unaccented</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:22 sq" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 5, 22 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:33" default="NO">12, 10, 33</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19937.8" n="2" level="3"> Of smell or flavor, <hi rend="ital">strong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unpleasant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">offensive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">an gravis hirsutis cubet hircus in alis,</quote> <trans><tr>rank</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:12:5" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 12, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">chelydri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:415" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 415</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ellebori,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 451</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odor calthae,</quote> <trans><tr>strong</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 6, 15, § 28</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">herba odore suaviter gravi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 9, 70, § 118</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">117: habrotonum odore jucunde gravi floret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 10, 34, § 60</bibl></cit>: absynthium ut bibam gravem, i. e. <hi rend="ital">bitter</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 19, 27</bibl>, and 314, 14.—</sense><sense id="n19937.9" n="3" level="3"> Of the state of the body or health, <hi rend="ital">gross</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indigestible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unwholesome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">noxious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">severe; sick</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Cleanthes) negat ullum esse cibum tam gravem, quin is die et nocte concoquatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:9:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 9, 24</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">genera cibi graviora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravissima bubula (caro),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pisces gravissimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque ex salubri loco in gravem, neque ex gravi in salubrem transitus satis tutus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">solum caelumque juxta grave,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solet esse gravis cantantibus umbra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 10, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anni tempore gravissimo et caloribus maximis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 16, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">gravis auctumnus in Apulia circumque Brundisium ex saluberrimis Galliae et Hispaniae regionibus, omnem exercitum valetudine tentaverat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grave tempus et forte annus pestilens erat urbi agrisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 6, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 8, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:377" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 377</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbo gravis,</quote> <trans><tr>sick</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 95</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">gravis vulnere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:48:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 48, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetate et viribus gravior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:19:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 19, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravior de vulnere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:65" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non insueta graves tentabunt pabula fetas,</quote> <trans><tr>sick</tr>, <tr>feeble</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 50</bibl></cit>; so <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut abit in somnum gravis,</quote> <trans><tr>heavy</tr>, <tr>languid</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1066" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1066</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n19937.10" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n19937.11" n="A" level="2"> In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">heavy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burdensome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oppressive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">troublesome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grievous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">painful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harsh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">severe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disagreeable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unpleasant</hi> (syn.: molestus, difficilis, arduus): qui labores morte finisset graves, <cb n="GRAV" /> Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:48:115" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 48, 115</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod numquam tibi senectutem gravem esse senserim ... quibus nihil est in ipsis opis ad bene beateque vivendum, iis omnis aetas gravis est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 2, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">onus officii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:38:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 38, 112</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et facilior et minus aliis gravis aut molesta vita est otiosorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:21:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 21, 70</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">miserior graviorque fortuna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:32:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 32, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec si gravia aut acerba videantur, multo illa gravius aestimare debere, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 14</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">velim si tibi grave non erit, me certiorem facias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:73:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 73, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grave est homini pudenti petere aliquid magnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 6, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 5, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">est in populum Romanum grave, non posse, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:7:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 7, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbum gravius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:58:section=134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 58, § 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quid gravius in fratrem statueret ... quod si quid ei a Caesare gravius accidisset, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 20, 1</bibl></cit> and 4: <cit><quote lang="la">gravissimum supplicium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 31, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habemus senatusconsultum in te, Catilina, vehemens et grave,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">edictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 21, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravioribus bellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravis esse alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:76:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 76, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">adversarius imperii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:22:86" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 22, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravior hostis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:18:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 18, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senes ad ludum adolescentium descendant, ne sint iis odiosi et graves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravis popularibus esse coepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:30:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 30, 5</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">gravis malae conscientiae lux est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 122" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 122</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19937.12" n="B" level="2"> In a good sense, <hi rend="ital">weighty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">important</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grave;</hi> with respect to character, <hi rend="ital">of weight</hi> or <hi rend="ital">authority</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eminent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">venerable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">great</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam erit alienis gravis, qui suis se concinnat levem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod apud omnes leve et infirmum est, id apud judicem grave et sanctum esse ducetur?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea (honestas) certe omni pondere gravior habenda est quam reliqua omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:8:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 8, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum gravibus seriisque rebus satisfecerimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 29, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctoritas clarissimi viri et in rei publicae maximis gravissimisque causis cogniti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. causa, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 315, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:44:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 44, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravius erit tuum unum verbum ad eam rem, quam centum mea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut potentia senatus atque auctoritas minueretur: quae tamen gravis et magna remanebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiis non tam gravibus et severis quam concinnis et venustis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:95:325" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 95, 325</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravior oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:56:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 56, 227</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil sibi gravius esse faciendum, quam ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inceptis gravibus et magna professis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exemplum grave praebet ales, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 4, 11, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non tulit ullos haec civitas aut gloria clariores, aut auctoritate graviores, aut humanitate politiores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:37:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 37, 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et esse et videri omnium gravissimus et severissimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 56, 228</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo prudens et gravis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 9, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque oratio abhorrens a persona hominis gravissimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non idem apud graves viros, quod leviores (decet),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:45" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir bonus et gravis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:184" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 184</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravissimi sapientiae magistri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 1, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum pietate gravem ac meritis si forte virum quem Conspexere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravissima civitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravem atque opulentam civitatem vineis et pluteis cepit,</quote> <trans><tr>an important city</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:17:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 17, 12</bibl></cit>.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">grăvĭter</orth>. </sense><sense id="n19937.13" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Weightily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heavily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ponderously</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">aëra per purum graviter simulacra feruntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:302" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 302</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">graviter cadere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:741" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 741</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:7:49" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 7, 49</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19937.14" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n19937.15" n="(a)" level="5"> Of tones, <hi rend="ital">deeply</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura fert, ut extrema ex altera parte graviter, ex altera autem acute sonent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:543" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 543</bibl>.—Far more freq., </sense><sense id="n19937.16" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Vehemently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strongly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violently</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">graviter crepuerunt fores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 3, 52</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">spirantibus flabris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:428" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 428</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 3, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pertentat tremor terras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:287" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 287</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferire aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:295" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 295</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conquassari omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 105</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae gravissime afflictae erant naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:31:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 31, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19937.17" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n19937.18" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Vehemently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deeply</hi>, <hi rend="ital">severely; harshly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unpleasantly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disagreeably</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">graviter aegrotare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:10:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 10, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque is sum, qui gravissime ex vobis mortis periculo terrear,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:30:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 30, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravissime dolere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 54</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem ego amarem graviter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 87</bibl></cit>;
