cf.: placere occoepit graviter, postquam est mortua, <pb n="829" /> <cb n="GRAV" /> Caecil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 314, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi edepol iratus sum graviter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cives gravissime dissentientes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 12, 11, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si me meis civibus injuria suspectum tam graviter atque offensum viderem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">graviter angi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:3:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tulit hoc commune dedecus jam familiae graviter filius,</quote> <trans><tr>with chagrin</tr>, <tr>vexation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 6, 16</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">graviter et acerbe aliquid ferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:58:section=152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 58, § 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">graviter accipere aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:52:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 52, 211</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 36</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">adolescentulus saepe eadem et graviter audiendo victus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nolo in illum gravius dicere,</quote> <trans><tr>more harshly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 1, 2, 60</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">de amplissimis viris gravissime acerbissimeque decernitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 5, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 3, 16, 4</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: severe et graviter et prisce agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:14:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 14, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut non gravius accepturi viderentur, si nuntiarentur omnibus eo loco mortem oppetendam esse,</quote> <trans><tr>more sorrowfully</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 4, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19937.19" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">In an impressive</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dignified manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impressively</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gravely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seriously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with propriety</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dignity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">his de rebus tantis tamque atrocibus neque satis me commode dicere neque satis graviter conqueri neque satis libere vociferari posse intelligo. Nam commoditati ingenium, gravitati aetas, libertati tempora sunt impedimento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Scipio) utrumque egit graviter,</quote> <trans><tr>with dignity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:21:77" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 21, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res gestas narrare graviter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:9:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 9, 30</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">locum graviter et copiose tractare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 2, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
